title: BoilerRoom
script:
1
00:00:01,000 --> 00:00:04,074
Subtitles downloaded from www.OpenSubtitles.org

2
00:00:54,888 --> 00:00:56,879
I read this article
a while back...

3
00:00:56,956 --> 00:00:59,857
that said Microsoft employs more
millionaire secretaries...

4
00:00:59,926 --> 00:01:02,326
than any other company
in the world.

5
00:01:02,395 --> 00:01:05,728
They took stock options
over Christmas bonuses.

6
00:01:05,799 --> 00:01:07,994
It was a good move.

7
00:01:08,068 --> 00:01:10,559
I remember there was this photograph
of one of the groundskeepers...

8
00:01:10,637 --> 00:01:12,832
next to his Ferrari.

9
00:01:12,906 --> 00:01:14,931
Blew my mind.

10
00:01:15,008 --> 00:01:18,000
You see shit like that,
and it just plants seeds...

11
00:01:18,078 --> 00:01:20,603
makes you think it's possible,
even easy.

12
00:01:20,680 --> 00:01:23,808
And then you turn on the TV,
and there's just more of it.

13
00:01:23,883 --> 00:01:26,408
The $87 million dollar
lottery winner.

14
00:01:26,486 --> 00:01:29,614
That kid actor that just made
20 million on his last movie.

15
00:01:29,689 --> 00:01:32,214
That Internet stock that
shot through the roof.

16
00:01:32,292 --> 00:01:35,420
You could've made millions on it
if you'd just got in early.

17
00:01:35,495 --> 00:01:39,625
And that's exactly
what I wanted to do... get in.

18
00:01:39,699 --> 00:01:44,068
I didn't want to be an innovator. I just
wanted to make the quick, easy buck.

19
00:01:44,137 --> 00:01:46,469
I just wanted in.

20
00:01:47,640 --> 00:01:49,938
Notorious B.I.G.
Said it best...

21
00:01:50,009 --> 00:01:53,410
"Either you're slinging crack rock,
or you got a wicked jump shot. "

22
00:01:53,480 --> 00:01:55,846
Nobody wants to work
for it anymore.

23
00:01:55,915 --> 00:01:59,544
There's no honor in taking
that after-school job at Mickey D's.

24
00:01:59,619 --> 00:02:02,486
Honor's in the dollar, kid.

25
00:02:02,555 --> 00:02:05,615
So I went the white-boy way
of slinging crack rock.

26
00:02:05,692 --> 00:02:07,353
I became a stockbroker.

27
00:02:14,267 --> 00:02:17,668
- Get off!
- Two hundred!

28
00:02:17,737 --> 00:02:20,570
Put your money back down!
Yo! Put your money back down!

29
00:02:41,895 --> 00:02:45,092
So I got in at this firm,
J. T. Marlin...

30
00:02:45,165 --> 00:02:48,100
owned by
this guy Michael Brantley...

31
00:02:48,168 --> 00:02:50,500
a salesman among salesmen.

32
00:02:50,570 --> 00:02:53,505
Mr. Brantley!

33
00:02:53,573 --> 00:02:57,339
- Mr. Brantley! Welcome! How are you?
- How you gonna handle these guys?

34
00:02:57,410 --> 00:02:59,901
- They're great.
- You think you can handle this or what?

35
00:02:59,979 --> 00:03:02,914
- I think so. We can handle it.
- You can handle it?

36
00:03:10,323 --> 00:03:12,257
A double scotch on the rocks.

37
00:03:20,266 --> 00:03:23,463
Holy shit, yo.
Yo, yo, yo, yo, yo!

38
00:03:23,536 --> 00:03:26,835
That's the jockey from Venezuela.
He's a sicko. He weighs like 48 pounds.

39
00:03:26,906 --> 00:03:29,670
119, but you're close, slut.

40
00:03:29,742 --> 00:03:31,903
Whatever. Give me three-to-one
on that skinny little nigger.

41
00:03:31,978 --> 00:03:36,210
Richie, Richie.
Do me a favor, will you?

42
00:03:36,282 --> 00:03:38,716
Just for, like, ten minutes.
Just give it a rest.

43
00:03:38,785 --> 00:03:43,119
Yo, homes, I need some "chocaine."
I need some motherfuckin' nose candy.

44
00:03:43,189 --> 00:03:45,248
I need some cizzi up my nizzi...

45
00:03:45,325 --> 00:03:47,316
'cause I need to get high
like a motherfucker.

46
00:03:47,393 --> 00:03:50,453
Know what I'm sayin'?
So give me some of that nose candy.

47
00:03:50,530 --> 00:03:52,862
Bring that table over here.

48
00:03:52,932 --> 00:03:57,198
Everybody quiet down for a second.
All right. Hold on.

49
00:03:57,270 --> 00:04:02,469
Thanks. I wanted to let you know those
pikers at the N.A.S.D. Are off our ass.

50
00:04:05,144 --> 00:04:09,581
- Fuckin' retard.
- Fuck you. I'm on vacation.

51
00:04:09,649 --> 00:04:13,278
Bear Stearns can call the S.E.C.
They can't find any dirt on us.

52
00:04:13,353 --> 00:04:16,789
J.T. Marlin, once again,
has unlimited trading authorization.

53
00:04:16,856 --> 00:04:19,620
I told you guys.
You can't keep a good man down!

54
00:04:21,227 --> 00:04:22,819
We're superstars now.

55
00:04:22,895 --> 00:04:25,887
J.P. Morgan just faxed over
their congratulations...

56
00:04:25,965 --> 00:04:27,956
and said,
"Welcome to the club."

57
00:04:29,902 --> 00:04:32,837
This also means those teams
headed by Todd and Richie...

58
00:04:32,905 --> 00:04:35,305
who were good enough
to give up their rep numbers...

59
00:04:35,375 --> 00:04:38,071
They can stop cold calling
and start trading again.

60
00:04:38,144 --> 00:04:40,237
Welcome back!

61
00:04:40,313 --> 00:04:42,281
And just to show you
how appreciative I am...

62
00:04:42,348 --> 00:04:43,610
there's a little something extra.

63
00:04:43,683 --> 00:04:46,379
Tell me about it, baby, tell me!

64
00:04:46,452 --> 00:04:49,182
I want you guys
to go up to suite 418.

65
00:04:52,025 --> 00:04:54,255
I handpicked them myself.

66
00:04:56,229 --> 00:04:59,198
We're players now, boys!
Let's celebrate. Salute!

67
00:06:29,155 --> 00:06:32,283
Don't touch the cards.
Don't touch the cards.

68
00:06:42,101 --> 00:06:44,126
- Fourteen.
- Hit me.

69
00:06:44,203 --> 00:06:46,694
Come on, Mike. I told you you
gotta hit the table. Sixteen.

70
00:06:46,773 --> 00:06:49,139
Hit me.

71
00:06:49,208 --> 00:06:51,802
And bust.
Sorry about that.

72
00:06:51,878 --> 00:06:54,904
Fuck! Can't
win a fuckin' hand tonight!

73
00:06:54,981 --> 00:06:57,745
Hey, Steve?
Come here for a second.

74
00:06:57,817 --> 00:06:59,580
You thirsty?
I don't care.

75
00:06:59,652 --> 00:07:02,416
Go take my car and get Mike a Coke
and a falafel. You hungry?

76
00:07:02,488 --> 00:07:05,719
Yeah. Yeah.
Sure. Why not?

77
00:07:05,792 --> 00:07:07,760
- And dealer busts.
- Yeah!

78
00:07:07,827 --> 00:07:09,818
What the fuck are
you so happy about?

79
00:07:09,896 --> 00:07:12,057
Whoa, take it easy.

80
00:07:12,131 --> 00:07:14,326
Roller coaster.
Ups and downs. You know that.

81
00:07:14,400 --> 00:07:17,426
All right. Place your bets.

82
00:07:18,571 --> 00:07:21,096
I was living in Kew Gardens Hills,
running my biz...

83
00:07:21,174 --> 00:07:24,439
giving the Queens College kids
something to do between classes.

84
00:07:24,510 --> 00:07:27,070
- See you guys.
- Fuck you.

85
00:07:27,146 --> 00:07:30,445
- Okay. I'll see you tomorrow.
- I was doing well.

86
00:07:41,093 --> 00:07:44,119
It's strange to think how
that knock changed everything.

87
00:07:44,197 --> 00:07:47,758
Everything.
Hey, don't get me wrong here.

88
00:07:47,834 --> 00:07:49,324
No, no. I got it.

89
00:07:49,402 --> 00:07:52,963
I don't believe in fate.
I believe in odds.

90
00:07:53,039 --> 00:07:55,132
- He's not gonna let you in.
- Why not?

91
00:07:55,208 --> 00:07:57,142
'Cause he doesn't know who you are.
He'll think you're a cop.

92
00:07:57,210 --> 00:08:00,941
So what? I got a bankroll
that'll choke a hippo. Let's just see.

93
00:08:01,013 --> 00:08:03,607
- Who are you?
- What's up?

94
00:08:03,683 --> 00:08:08,347
- It's my boy, Greg. Oh, shit!
- What are you doin'? Come in.

95
00:08:08,421 --> 00:08:11,049
What's goin' on? Come here, crazy.
What are you doin'?

96
00:08:11,123 --> 00:08:13,956
How're you doin'?
Come in. Come in.

97
00:08:15,461 --> 00:08:19,363
Oh, shit. Wait.
Is that your new ride?

98
00:08:19,432 --> 00:08:22,230
- Him.
- Nice.

99
00:08:22,301 --> 00:08:24,292
- Hi. Seth.
- Hey. Greg.

100
00:08:24,370 --> 00:08:25,701
Nice to meet you.

101
00:08:25,771 --> 00:08:28,934
- We thought we were done for the night.
- Too late to get a couple hands in?

102
00:08:29,008 --> 00:08:30,999
No, no, no. 24-7.

103
00:08:32,445 --> 00:08:35,642
Hey, Steve, could you get us
a couple of sandwiches?

104
00:08:37,383 --> 00:08:40,409
- All right. Give me 400.
- Wait. What about the betting?

105
00:08:40,486 --> 00:08:44,650
- What were you thinking?
- Five hundred, max?

106
00:08:46,425 --> 00:08:48,893
We don't usually
service that level of action...

107
00:08:48,961 --> 00:08:51,156
but I hate
to turn away a new customer.

108
00:08:51,230 --> 00:08:54,324
We might not have enough cash
to settle you at the end of the night.

109
00:08:54,400 --> 00:08:57,392
That's okay.
You can just pay me tomorrow.

110
00:08:57,470 --> 00:08:59,938
All right.
How much you want?

111
00:09:00,006 --> 00:09:03,635
- Five dimes.
- Jeff.

112
00:09:03,709 --> 00:09:05,006
You had to do it, didn't you?

113
00:09:05,077 --> 00:09:06,738
You make me look
like I'm at the kiddie table.

114
00:09:06,812 --> 00:09:09,906
- If the shoe fits, kid. Come on.
- Fuckin' rich man.

115
00:09:09,982 --> 00:09:12,314
- What denomination?
- What denomination?

116
00:09:12,385 --> 00:09:16,116
How about three Puerto Ricans,
two Chinks and a Guinea?

117
00:09:16,188 --> 00:09:18,213
I don't care. Mix it up.
Whatever you want.

118
00:09:18,291 --> 00:09:20,452
What about a Swahili? Jesus.

119
00:09:20,526 --> 00:09:23,188
I don't know what that is either.
You're starting to upset me.

120
00:09:23,262 --> 00:09:25,389
You got your own chips, huh,
with your name on them?

121
00:09:25,464 --> 00:09:27,364
This is no joke.

122
00:09:27,433 --> 00:09:31,961
We used to use the
Bicycle poker chips...

123
00:09:32,038 --> 00:09:34,006
and then some kid started
sneaking in additional funds.

124
00:09:34,073 --> 00:09:37,201
- Who's that? Moyshe?
- No, no. Some kid up the block.

125
00:09:37,276 --> 00:09:39,141
Fuckin' Moyshe.

126
00:09:40,379 --> 00:09:44,611
- So that's a nice car you have there.
- Thanks. A Ferrari.

127
00:09:44,684 --> 00:09:47,949
Yeah. It's a 355,
six-speed transmission, right?

128
00:09:48,020 --> 00:09:51,751
Yeah. It's a synchromesh.
I love it. Nice.

129
00:09:51,824 --> 00:09:54,918
Yo, shit is yellow, B.
Rizzy's the color, nugga.

130
00:09:54,994 --> 00:09:57,258
Yellow's filthy. Come on.

131
00:09:57,330 --> 00:09:59,821
It's Big Bird mode.

132
00:09:59,899 --> 00:10:02,800
All right.
Place your bets.

133
00:10:14,046 --> 00:10:16,241
- Hey.
- You are late.

134
00:10:16,315 --> 00:10:20,274
- I know. I'm sorry.
- Your father is really upset.

135
00:10:20,353 --> 00:10:23,618
- He won't even tell me what it is.
- Jesus.

136
00:10:27,593 --> 00:10:30,289
- Hey.
- What's up, Seth?

137
00:10:30,363 --> 00:10:32,888
- How you doin'? How's school?
- It's all right.

138
00:10:32,965 --> 00:10:35,490
That's a good question, Seth.
You wanna tell us what happened?

139
00:10:35,568 --> 00:10:40,369
- We didn't know if you were comin'.
- Oh, yeah. Traffic was crazy.

140
00:10:40,439 --> 00:10:42,134
So?

141
00:10:42,208 --> 00:10:46,235
Do you wanna wait till after
dinner to talk about it?

142
00:10:46,312 --> 00:10:48,610
Yeah, let's eat first.

143
00:10:48,681 --> 00:10:53,812
- Answer the question, Seth.
- I dropped out.

144
00:10:53,886 --> 00:10:56,150
You wanna tell us why?

145
00:10:56,222 --> 00:11:01,182
Well, I gave it a year, Dad,
and it's just not for me.

146
00:11:01,260 --> 00:11:04,423
I see. So that means you've been
lying to us for six months.

147
00:11:04,497 --> 00:11:05,794
Six months, Seth.

148
00:11:05,865 --> 00:11:09,392
"School's fine, Dad.
My grades are good, Dad."

149
00:11:09,468 --> 00:11:13,427
Let's just leave that for a second.
So you dropped out.

150
00:11:13,506 --> 00:11:16,737
That means you haven't been getting
your student loan checks, right?

151
00:11:16,809 --> 00:11:20,404
Is that right? How are you making
the rent every month, Seth?

152
00:11:22,581 --> 00:11:26,073
I'm running a business,
and I'm just earning a living.

153
00:11:26,152 --> 00:11:30,919
Earning a living? This what
you call earning a living?

154
00:11:30,990 --> 00:11:32,981
- Marty, are those drugs?
- Yes.

155
00:11:33,059 --> 00:11:37,086
- Yes, those are drugs?
- No, Mom. This is an honest living.

156
00:11:37,163 --> 00:11:39,927
And you can ask any one
of my customers.

157
00:11:39,999 --> 00:11:42,365
What do you mean, "customers"?
Where's the customers?

158
00:11:42,435 --> 00:11:44,335
They're children of people
in this community.

159
00:11:44,403 --> 00:11:48,169
How do you think I got these?
Anyway, it's illegal.

160
00:11:48,240 --> 00:11:53,268
You're running a backdoor card game!
How do you think this reflects on me?

161
00:11:53,345 --> 00:11:57,179
I'm a judge,
for Christ's sake!

162
00:11:57,249 --> 00:12:01,345
Are you listening to me?

163
00:12:03,022 --> 00:12:06,514
I'm gonna be honest with you.
You're runnin'a good business.

164
00:12:06,592 --> 00:12:09,493
I think you're a smart kid,
pullin' in some real cash.

165
00:12:09,562 --> 00:12:13,123
But I gotta tell you, man,
this is risky fuckin' business.

166
00:12:13,199 --> 00:12:16,532
I mean, you really honestly plan
on dealing cards to college kids...

167
00:12:16,602 --> 00:12:18,695
when you're fuckin' 35?

168
00:12:18,771 --> 00:12:21,968
You don't think you'll get pinched
in the next couple years?

169
00:12:22,041 --> 00:12:26,808
Maybe it's time to start thinkin'
about down-the-line time.

170
00:12:28,447 --> 00:12:31,439
So, you want me
to come work for you?

171
00:12:31,517 --> 00:12:35,749
What? I guess it'll be like retribution
for me taking all your money here?

172
00:12:35,821 --> 00:12:38,813
First of all, I am not
done with you here, all right?

173
00:12:38,891 --> 00:12:40,950
And, no, you're only gonna
work for me a short time.

174
00:12:41,026 --> 00:12:42,926
You pass the Series Seven.

175
00:12:42,995 --> 00:12:46,453
You learn the ropes.
You're on your own.

176
00:12:46,532 --> 00:12:49,797
Yeah, ask Adam, man.
He'll tell you.

177
00:12:49,869 --> 00:12:52,030
- It's good.
- It's good?

178
00:12:52,104 --> 00:12:55,232
- Yeah.
- I'm gonna be blunt.

179
00:12:55,307 --> 00:12:58,902
We're talkin' about
millions of dollars.

180
00:13:41,720 --> 00:13:43,745
I was making
good money with the casino...

181
00:13:43,823 --> 00:13:46,121
but these guys
were macking it hard.

182
00:13:46,192 --> 00:13:48,854
That's the level
I wanted to be operating on.

183
00:13:48,928 --> 00:13:52,489
So I drove out
to Long Island, way out.

184
00:13:52,565 --> 00:13:56,626
The office was a good hour
away from Wall Street.

185
00:13:56,702 --> 00:13:58,636
Somebody forgot to tell the guys
who worked there, though.

186
00:13:58,704 --> 00:14:00,365
They looked and acted...

187
00:14:00,439 --> 00:14:03,374
like they took the Six train
to Fulton Street every morning.

188
00:14:03,442 --> 00:14:04,932
But it wasn't Wall Street.

189
00:14:05,010 --> 00:14:07,672
It was exit 53
on the Long Island Expressway...

190
00:14:07,746 --> 00:14:11,147
a good hour from
the New York Stock Exchange.

191
00:14:22,595 --> 00:14:27,328
No, no, no, no. You don't wanna act now.
This stock is going to turn.

192
00:14:27,399 --> 00:14:29,959
I'm invested very heavily myself.
We just stay put.

193
00:14:30,035 --> 00:14:32,367
I don't know if you've ever had the
opportunity to purchase I.P.O. Before...

194
00:14:32,438 --> 00:14:34,633
but we have this company that's going
to market in about a week or so.

195
00:14:34,707 --> 00:14:37,403
We're gonna have to move on this now.
This is gonna happen next week.

196
00:14:37,476 --> 00:14:39,808
We don't wanna marry this stock.
We're in; we're out.

197
00:14:39,879 --> 00:14:42,780
What do you mean, you don't buy stock
over the phone? How do you do it?

198
00:14:42,848 --> 00:14:46,978
Smoke signals? Telepathy? World leaders
solve problems over the phone.

199
00:14:47,052 --> 00:14:52,012
I'm not a Charles Schwab.
I don't need your business; I value it.

200
00:14:52,091 --> 00:14:55,549
I'm successful to the point where
I don't need to chase your business.

201
00:14:55,628 --> 00:14:59,359
Hey, kid, get the fuck
outta here!

202
00:15:08,641 --> 00:15:10,165
Over here.

203
00:15:11,310 --> 00:15:15,076
- Have they started interviewing yet?
- No.

204
00:15:15,147 --> 00:15:19,743
- Know how long it's gonna be?
- You'll all be going in together.

205
00:15:19,818 --> 00:15:22,286
But I thought
this was, like, an interview?

206
00:15:22,354 --> 00:15:25,949
It is. It's a group interview.
You'll see.

207
00:15:37,937 --> 00:15:40,906
No, man.
You're a male.

208
00:15:42,574 --> 00:15:45,134
Group interview, my ass.

209
00:15:45,210 --> 00:15:47,838
It was like a Hitler Youth rally,
in retrospect.

210
00:15:47,913 --> 00:15:50,507
The guy who pitched us, Jim Young,
was the head recruiter there.

211
00:15:50,582 --> 00:15:54,985
- Okay, guys. Let's go.
- Between him and Michael, honestly...

212
00:15:55,054 --> 00:15:58,922
they could sell bubble gum
in the lockjaw ward at Bellevue.

213
00:16:09,868 --> 00:16:12,336
I'm sorry, man.
This is my seat.

214
00:16:12,404 --> 00:16:15,532
- Oh, shit. I'm so sorry.
- It's okay. Don't worry about it.

215
00:16:17,810 --> 00:16:22,008
- Fuckin' dumb-ass.
- Get the fuck outta here.

216
00:16:23,115 --> 00:16:25,606
- What?
- Don't talk to me. Don't look at me.

217
00:16:25,684 --> 00:16:29,620
Just get your ass out of that Italian
leather chair and get the fuck out.

218
00:16:29,688 --> 00:16:33,385
Right now. Come on.
Let's go, schlepp rock.

219
00:16:33,459 --> 00:16:35,222
Out.

220
00:16:37,896 --> 00:16:40,023
Sit down.

221
00:16:40,099 --> 00:16:43,068
We expect everyone here to
treat their coworkers...

222
00:16:43,135 --> 00:16:45,194
with a certain level
of respect.

223
00:16:45,270 --> 00:16:50,333
Before we start, I have one question.
Has anyone passed a Series Seven exam?

224
00:16:50,409 --> 00:16:54,038
- I have a Series Seven license.
- Good for you. You can get out too.

225
00:16:54,113 --> 00:16:56,172
What? Why?

226
00:16:56,248 --> 00:16:59,081
We don't hire brokers here.
We train new ones.

227
00:16:59,151 --> 00:17:03,383
That's it, Skippy.
Pack your shit. Let's go.

228
00:17:07,426 --> 00:17:09,986
Okay. Here's the deal.

229
00:17:10,062 --> 00:17:13,828
I'm not here to waste your time.
I hope you're not here to waste mine.

230
00:17:13,899 --> 00:17:15,799
So I'm gonna keep this short.

231
00:17:15,868 --> 00:17:17,859
If you become an employee
of this firm...

232
00:17:17,936 --> 00:17:20,530
you will make your first million
within three years.

233
00:17:20,606 --> 00:17:22,198
Okay? I repeat that:

234
00:17:22,274 --> 00:17:26,108
You will make a million dollars
within three years...

235
00:17:26,178 --> 00:17:30,274
of your first day of employment
at J.T. Marlin.

236
00:17:30,349 --> 00:17:33,546
There is no question whether or not
you'll become a millionaire here.

237
00:17:33,619 --> 00:17:36,520
The only question
is how many times over.

238
00:17:36,588 --> 00:17:40,115
You think I'm joking?
I am not joking.

239
00:17:40,192 --> 00:17:44,026
I am a millionaire.
It's a weird thing to hear, right?

240
00:17:44,096 --> 00:17:46,792
I'll tell ya.
It's a weird thing to say.

241
00:17:46,865 --> 00:17:49,060
I am a fucking millionaire.

242
00:17:49,134 --> 00:17:52,228
And guess how old I am.
Twenty-seven.

243
00:17:52,304 --> 00:17:56,172
You know what that makes me here?
A fuckin' senior citizen.

244
00:17:56,241 --> 00:17:59,870
This firm is entirely comprised
of people your age, not mine.

245
00:17:59,945 --> 00:18:03,847
Lucky for me, I'm very fucking good
at my job, or I'd be out of one.

246
00:18:03,916 --> 00:18:06,908
You guys are the new blood.
You're gonna go home with the kessef.

247
00:18:06,985 --> 00:18:10,421
You are the future big swinging dicks
of this firm.

248
00:18:10,489 --> 00:18:14,482
Now, you all look money hungry,
and that's good.

249
00:18:14,560 --> 00:18:18,462
Anybody tells you money is the root
of all evil doesn't fuckin' have any.

250
00:18:18,530 --> 00:18:22,091
They say money can't buy happiness?
Look at the fuckin' smile on my face.

251
00:18:22,167 --> 00:18:25,762
Ear to ear, baby.
You want details? Fine.

252
00:18:25,838 --> 00:18:28,466
I drive a Ferrari
355 Cabriolet.

253
00:18:28,540 --> 00:18:33,603
What's up? I have a ridiculous house
in the South Fork.

254
00:18:33,679 --> 00:18:37,274
I have every toy you could imagine,
and best of all, kids...

255
00:18:37,349 --> 00:18:39,283
I am liquid.

256
00:18:39,351 --> 00:18:43,788
So, now you know what's possible.
Let me tell you what's required.

257
00:18:43,856 --> 00:18:48,293
You are required to work
your fucking ass off at this firm.

258
00:18:48,360 --> 00:18:53,127
We want winners here, not pikers.
A piker walks at the bell.

259
00:18:53,198 --> 00:18:57,635
A piker asks how much vacation you get
in the first year. Vacation?

260
00:18:57,703 --> 00:19:01,036
People come and work at this firm
for one reason: To become filthy rich.

261
00:19:01,106 --> 00:19:05,543
We're not here to make friends.
We're not savin' the manatees, guys.

262
00:19:05,611 --> 00:19:08,876
You want vacation time?
Go teach third grade, public school.

263
00:19:14,620 --> 00:19:18,818
Okay. The first three months
at the firm are as a trainee.

264
00:19:18,891 --> 00:19:20,119
You make $150 a week.

265
00:19:20,192 --> 00:19:23,355
After you're done training,
you take the Series Seven.

266
00:19:23,428 --> 00:19:24,895
Pass that, you become junior broker...

267
00:19:24,963 --> 00:19:26,624
and you open accounts
for your team leader.

268
00:19:26,698 --> 00:19:30,395
You open 40 accounts, you start
workin' for yourself. Sky's the limit.

269
00:19:30,469 --> 00:19:31,902
Word about being a trainee.

270
00:19:31,970 --> 00:19:35,235
Friends, parents, other brokers,
they're gonna give you shit.

271
00:19:35,307 --> 00:19:38,538
It's true. $150 a week?
Not a lot of money.

272
00:19:38,610 --> 00:19:39,508
Pay them no mind.

273
00:19:39,578 --> 00:19:42,911
You need to learn this business,
and this is the time to do it.

274
00:19:42,981 --> 00:19:45,848
Once you pass the test,
none of that's gonna matter.

275
00:19:45,918 --> 00:19:47,977
Your friends are shit.

276
00:19:48,053 --> 00:19:50,681
Tell them you made 25 grand last month,
they're won't fucking believe you.

277
00:19:50,756 --> 00:19:53,122
Fuck them! Fuck 'em!

278
00:19:53,192 --> 00:19:56,855
Parents don't like the life you lead?
"Fuck you, Mom and Dad."

279
00:19:56,929 --> 00:20:01,366
See how it feels when you're makin'
their fuckin' Lexus payments.

280
00:20:01,433 --> 00:20:05,028
Now, go home and think about it.
Think about whether it's really for you.

281
00:20:05,103 --> 00:20:08,561
If you decide it isn't...
It's nothing to be embarrassed about.

282
00:20:08,640 --> 00:20:12,736
It's not for everyone.
Thanks.

283
00:20:12,811 --> 00:20:15,974
But if you
really want this...

284
00:20:16,048 --> 00:20:19,540
you call me on Monday
and we'll talk.

285
00:20:19,618 --> 00:20:23,213
Just don't
waste my fuckin' time.

286
00:20:23,288 --> 00:20:25,449
Okay. That's it.

287
00:21:12,070 --> 00:21:14,061
- Hi.
- Hi.

288
00:21:14,139 --> 00:21:17,267
So, what's up?

289
00:21:17,342 --> 00:21:21,972
- How you doin'?
- I'm fine, Seth. What's on your mind?

290
00:21:22,047 --> 00:21:27,417
I feel bad about the way things went
at the house last week.

291
00:21:28,553 --> 00:21:32,421
I just don't feel like we get
anywhere when we talk at home.

292
00:21:32,491 --> 00:21:36,291
Well, I don't know
that there's anything to talk about.

293
00:21:36,361 --> 00:21:40,297
- Can I get you anything to drink?
- No. I'm fine, thanks.

294
00:21:40,365 --> 00:21:43,129
You dropped out
of school, Seth.

295
00:21:43,201 --> 00:21:46,398
You're running an illegal casino
out of your apartment.

296
00:21:46,471 --> 00:21:50,202
You're putting my career at risk.
What is there to talk about, Seth?

297
00:21:50,275 --> 00:21:55,144
Well, I don't know why
we can't just discuss this. I mean...

298
00:21:55,213 --> 00:21:57,272
Maybe you're just not
seeing my side.

299
00:21:57,349 --> 00:22:00,716
Your side? What side?
You're doing wrong.

300
00:22:00,786 --> 00:22:02,981
I'm not your best friend.
That's your mother's racket.

301
00:22:03,055 --> 00:22:05,523
I'm your father.
I tell you when you screw up.

302
00:22:05,590 --> 00:22:08,491
What did you think I was gonna do?
Pat you on the back for the casino idea?

303
00:22:08,560 --> 00:22:11,085
Tell you what
a great entrepreneur you are?

304
00:22:12,297 --> 00:22:14,629
So what do you want me
to do, Seth?

305
00:22:14,700 --> 00:22:18,431
I mean, my God, if I'd called my father
to meet me for a cup of coffee...

306
00:22:18,503 --> 00:22:21,529
to talk about my screwups,
he probably would've laughed.

307
00:22:21,606 --> 00:22:24,302
We didn't have nice little chats
about why I was a bad boy.

308
00:22:24,376 --> 00:22:26,207
I got smacked.

309
00:22:26,278 --> 00:22:29,076
And I didn't do it again.
Much simpler.

310
00:22:29,147 --> 00:22:32,548
Look. I'm just trying to restore
what's left of our relationship.

311
00:22:32,617 --> 00:22:34,710
"Relationship"?

312
00:22:34,786 --> 00:22:38,017
What the fuck are you
talking about, relationship?

313
00:22:38,290 --> 00:22:40,520
What? Are we dating?

314
00:22:40,592 --> 00:22:42,719
I'm not your girlfriend Seth;
I'm your father.

315
00:22:42,794 --> 00:22:45,092
Clean up your life,
make an honest living...

316
00:22:45,163 --> 00:22:48,860
and then you and I can talk
like normal people, all right?

317
00:23:16,361 --> 00:23:19,421
- Hey, Seth.
- Hi. How you doin'?

318
00:23:19,498 --> 00:23:23,798
- Abby.
- Oh, yeah. I know. I forgot.

319
00:23:23,869 --> 00:23:26,133
It's okay. I never told you.

320
00:23:26,204 --> 00:23:28,570
Besides, the other day
you looked a little frazzled...

321
00:23:28,640 --> 00:23:31,871
so I didn't think
you'd remember anyway.

322
00:23:33,412 --> 00:23:36,040
- Today's my first day.
- No shit?

323
00:23:36,114 --> 00:23:38,844
Yeah.

324
00:23:38,917 --> 00:23:41,283
- See ya.
- See ya.

325
00:23:47,559 --> 00:23:49,424
No, that's not how it works.

326
00:23:49,494 --> 00:23:52,725
If I was asking you to
own 5,000 or 10,000 shares...

327
00:23:52,798 --> 00:23:55,892
of some pink-sheet, bullshit company
with negative earnings...

328
00:23:55,967 --> 00:23:57,764
I'd tell you
to hang up the phone...

329
00:23:57,836 --> 00:24:00,669
call your local broker
and short the stock.

330
00:24:00,739 --> 00:24:05,574
I wouldn't expect your business.
But, Don, I am bringing you...

331
00:24:05,644 --> 00:24:10,240
Seth. Seth. Come over here.
It's not your table.

332
00:24:10,315 --> 00:24:13,682
...F.D.A. Landmark approval.
It's, like, the cancer pill.

333
00:24:13,752 --> 00:24:19,054
No. It's a cancer pill.
No, Don, it's not Propecia P.

334
00:24:19,124 --> 00:24:22,821
It is the cancer pill.
Oh, Donald, please take a chance.

335
00:24:22,894 --> 00:24:25,021
You look pretty.

336
00:24:25,096 --> 00:24:27,462
Thank you.

337
00:24:27,532 --> 00:24:30,695
So you wanna tell me where the fuck
you were last night?

338
00:24:30,769 --> 00:24:34,068
- Not particularly.
- Okay.

339
00:24:39,544 --> 00:24:42,104
This is for you.

340
00:24:42,180 --> 00:24:47,675
I don't know how to better
explain this to you, but...

341
00:24:49,488 --> 00:24:51,547
it's over.

342
00:24:51,623 --> 00:24:54,524
Okay. I disagree.

343
00:24:56,294 --> 00:24:58,990
- Hang on a second.
- Here you go.

344
00:25:02,434 --> 00:25:04,959
- What's up? Is he in?
- I don't know.

345
00:25:08,240 --> 00:25:12,370
Hey. These are the D&B cards.
These are our leads.

346
00:25:12,444 --> 00:25:15,743
- Morning.
- Every card is an opportunity, right?

347
00:25:15,814 --> 00:25:19,215
These are good leads.
People on these cards buy stock.

348
00:25:19,284 --> 00:25:21,582
Your job is to call them
and get them interested in the firm.

349
00:25:21,653 --> 00:25:24,417
You're not actually selling stock yet,
but you're selling the dream.

350
00:25:24,489 --> 00:25:26,423
So get 'em wet. Tell 'em
that in a month from now...

351
00:25:26,491 --> 00:25:30,052
a senior broker's gonna
call them back with an idea.

352
00:25:30,128 --> 00:25:31,618
So who are these people?

353
00:25:31,696 --> 00:25:34,062
Average client's 45 years old,
from the Midwest...

354
00:25:34,132 --> 00:25:37,898
$150,000 annual income,
1 million net, has a local broker...

355
00:25:37,969 --> 00:25:41,097
but loves a hotshot New Yorker
who sounds good on the phone.

356
00:25:41,172 --> 00:25:44,608
So the card won't tell you that. It only
has name, address and occupation.

357
00:25:44,676 --> 00:25:48,237
So you gotta
feel 'em out, see?

358
00:25:48,313 --> 00:25:51,680
"Peter Davis, Vice President,
Parks Telecommunications."

359
00:25:51,750 --> 00:25:53,684
The guy's probably
a fuckin' whale.

360
00:25:53,752 --> 00:25:57,449
So feel 'im out, see what he's got.
Truth is, it doesn't matter these days.

361
00:25:57,522 --> 00:26:00,582
With the Dow where it is now,
everybody wants a piece of the market.

362
00:26:00,659 --> 00:26:04,288
I can close anyone anytime anywhere.
Just give me a phone number.

363
00:26:04,362 --> 00:26:07,092
- Greg, I have John Duncklee on three.
- Not now. I'll call him back.

364
00:26:07,165 --> 00:26:09,929
Now, once you qualify the guy,
you send him a press packet.

365
00:26:10,001 --> 00:26:13,459
It'll be easy, and it'll get you
comfortable on the phone, which is key.

366
00:26:13,538 --> 00:26:17,770
This entire business revolves
around the phone. Play the numbers.

367
00:26:17,842 --> 00:26:21,300
This is a contact sport. The more people
you contact, the better you'll do.

368
00:26:21,379 --> 00:26:26,078
- A good broker makes 700 calls a day.
- What's the phone bill like?

369
00:26:26,151 --> 00:26:28,619
This month
was approaching 400,000.

370
00:26:28,687 --> 00:26:31,520
Listen to me. Even though
you're not selling stock yet...

371
00:26:31,590 --> 00:26:34,991
I want you to remember the code
we have here, okay?

372
00:26:35,060 --> 00:26:36,994
- Did you see Glengarry Glen Ross?
- Yeah.

373
00:26:37,062 --> 00:26:40,190
- Do you remember "ABC"?
- Yeah. "Always be closing."

374
00:26:40,265 --> 00:26:42,893
That's right. "Always be closing."
"Telling's not selling."

375
00:26:42,968 --> 00:26:47,428
That's the attitude you wanna have.
There's two rules as a trainee.

376
00:26:47,505 --> 00:26:50,440
Number one:
We don't pitch the bitch here.

377
00:26:50,508 --> 00:26:51,839
What?

378
00:26:51,910 --> 00:26:54,310
We don't sell stock to women.
I don't care who it is; we don't do it.

379
00:26:54,379 --> 00:26:56,210
Nancy Sinatra calls,
you tell her you're sorry.

380
00:26:56,281 --> 00:26:57,873
They're a constant pain
in the ass...

381
00:26:57,949 --> 00:26:59,940
and you're never
gonna hear the end of it.

382

1279
01:22:45,726 --> 01:22:48,923

that guy's gotta take me down.

1280
01:22:48,996 --> 01:22:52,056

That's a fuck-off question.

1281
01:22:52,133 --> 01:22:54,931

and he blew it.

1282
01:22:55,002 --> 01:22:57,163
To a question like,
"What is the firm minimum?"

1283
01:22:57,238 --> 01:22:59,604

1284
01:22:59,674 --> 01:23:01,539
You don't like the idea;
don't pick up a single share.

1285
01:23:01,609 --> 01:23:04,305

you know, "Uh, 100 shares."

1286
01:23:04,378 --> 01:23:06,403

1287
01:23:06,480 --> 01:23:08,880

to be closing all the time!

1288
01:23:08,950 --> 01:23:11,009

Learn how to push.

1289
01:23:11,085 --> 01:23:13,110
Talk to 'em.
Ask 'em questions.

1290
01:23:13,187 --> 01:23:15,246

It doesn't matter.

1291
01:23:15,323 --> 01:23:17,314
Anything.
Just get a "yes" out of 'em.

1292
01:23:17,391 --> 01:23:21,088

life jacket, would you grab it?" " Yes!"

1293
01:23:21,162 --> 01:23:24,097

1294

1295
01:23:27,468 --> 01:23:29,402

1296
01:23:29,470 --> 01:23:32,928

1297
01:23:33,007 --> 01:23:37,137

1298
01:23:37,211 --> 01:23:40,271

1299
01:23:40,348 --> 01:23:42,282

1300

1301
01:23:44,919 --> 01:23:49,117

1303
01:23:51,392 --> 01:23:54,293

1305

01:24:01,836 --> 01:24:05,033

1308
01:24:07,575 --> 01:24:12,638

1309
01:24:12,713 --> 01:24:15,341

1310
01:24:15,416 --> 01:24:18,783

1311
01:24:18,853 --> 01:24:23,187

That's it. I'm done.

1312
01:24:23,257 --> 01:24:26,522

1313
01:24:26,594 --> 01:24:29,495

1314
01:24:29,563 --> 01:24:32,225

1315
01:24:32,299 --> 01:24:34,563

1316
01:24:34,635 --> 01:24:37,570

1317

1318
01:24:39,940 --> 01:24:43,637

1320
01:24:47,114 --> 01:24:49,639

1323

1326

1332

1333

1340

1342

1343
01:26:01,155 --> 01:26:03,316

1344
01:26:03,390 --> 01:26:05,551

1345
01:26:05,626 --> 01:26:08,652
If you own 100 shares at 10 dollars,
and you pick up another 100 at 5...

1346
01:26:08,729 --> 01:26:10,788

at 7.50 a share.

1347

1349

1350

if I take you out at 15,
that's 71/2 points.

1351

1352

1354

1355

1356

1357

1373

1374

1377

1385

1394

1395

1396

1397
01:29:06,974 --> 01:29:09,204

1398
01:29:10,778 --> 01:29:14,737

1399
01:29:14,815 --> 01:29:18,751

1400

1401

1402
01:29:32,499 --> 01:29:35,024

1403

1404

1405
01:29:41,675 --> 01:29:44,542

1406
01:29:44,611 --> 01:29:46,545

1407

1408
01:29:50,684 --> 01:29:53,812

1409
01:29:53,887 --> 01:29:57,379
I want Davis brought in

1410

1411

Calm people down.

1412

1413

1414

Isaac, I got a Mr. Klastow.

1415

1416

1417

1418

1419

1422

1426

1427
01:30:47,908 --> 01:30:52,572

1428
01:30:55,249 --> 01:30:56,910

1429

1430

1431

1432

1436
01:31:20,174 --> 01:31:24,235

1437
01:31:24,311 --> 01:31:27,246

1438

1439
01:31:29,316 --> 01:31:32,752

- Seth, I need the money back!

1440
01:31:32,820 --> 01:31:35,220

1441
01:31:35,289 --> 01:31:37,985
Please, Seth,
I need the money back!

1442
01:31:38,058 --> 01:31:40,720

1443

Hello? Hello?

1444

1445

1446
01:31:59,813 --> 01:32:01,678

1447
01:32:01,748 --> 01:32:05,206

1448
01:32:05,285 --> 01:32:08,777

1449

1450

1451

1452

1453

1454
01:32:36,316 --> 01:32:41,686

1455

1456
01:32:44,758 --> 01:32:48,956

1457
01:32:55,536 --> 01:32:57,697

doing here, Seth?

1458
01:32:57,771 --> 01:33:00,763

1459
01:33:00,841 --> 01:33:02,968

1460
01:33:03,043 --> 01:33:05,409

1461
01:33:05,479 --> 01:33:07,504

1462
01:33:07,581 --> 01:33:09,811

1463
01:33:09,883 --> 01:33:12,852

1464

1465

1467

1468

1469

1471

you can make a lot of money.

1474

1475

1476

1477

1478
01:33:57,764 --> 01:34:02,064
What, are you out of your fucking mind?

1479
01:34:02,135 --> 01:34:04,933
I think it's time
for you to...

1480

1481

I bought you that bike.

1482
01:34:19,119 --> 01:34:23,146

1483
01:34:23,223 --> 01:34:25,623

1484
01:34:25,692 --> 01:34:29,458

when I broke my leg?

1485
01:34:29,529 --> 01:34:31,963
Yes, Seth, I remember

1486

I had to get you to stop!

1487
01:34:39,539 --> 01:34:42,269
My fucking leg...

1488
01:34:42,342 --> 01:34:44,640

1489
01:34:44,711 --> 01:34:47,475
I'm sorry...
I'm sorry I couldn't...

1490
01:34:47,547 --> 01:34:49,913
get the job
that you wanted me to have.

1491
01:34:49,983 --> 01:34:54,215
But... I mean...
Who gives a shit?

1492
01:34:54,288 --> 01:34:57,018
'Cause I'm good
at what I do, Dad.

1493
01:34:57,090 --> 01:35:00,025
I'm good at what I do!

1494
01:35:00,093 --> 01:35:04,655

The casino was a fucking business...

1495
01:35:04,731 --> 01:35:07,962

1496
01:35:08,035 --> 01:35:11,163

1497
01:35:11,238 --> 01:35:13,297
Wait.
When did you close it?

1498
01:35:13,373 --> 01:35:17,969
And then I got this job 'cause I thought
it was what you wanted me to be doing!

1499
01:35:18,045 --> 01:35:20,377
Seth, wait a second.
When did you close it?

1500
01:35:20,447 --> 01:35:25,146
And I tried... I tried to make
the changes that you wanted me to!

1501
01:35:25,218 --> 01:35:27,652
And I'm leaving J.T. Now!

1502
01:35:27,721 --> 01:35:32,283
I'm just asking you for this one thing.
Just this one thing, please!

1503
01:35:32,359 --> 01:35:35,192
Help your son!

1504
01:35:39,066 --> 01:35:42,194
I can't, Seth.
I can't. I'm sorry.

1505
01:35:59,152 --> 01:36:01,677
What are you
gonna do now?

1506
01:36:01,755 --> 01:36:05,020
I'm still gonna do it.
I have a friend that'll go in with me.

1507
01:36:05,092 --> 01:36:07,754
If I do it right,
I can take J.T. For at least 300 grand.

1508
01:36:07,828 --> 01:36:10,228
- My father can go to hell.
- Seth, my mom.

1509
01:36:10,297 --> 01:36:14,495
- I'm sorry.
- I don't think you should do it.

1510
01:36:14,568 --> 01:36:17,162
- I think you should just quit.
- I told you...

1511
01:36:17,237 --> 01:36:19,262
I've invested
too much time in this.

1512
01:36:19,339 --> 01:36:21,273
I have no more money
coming in anymore...

1513
01:36:21,341 --> 01:36:23,901
because Jeff tanked
my fucking gold mine.

1514
01:36:23,977 --> 01:36:25,911
I need this.

1515
01:36:25,979 --> 01:36:29,176
I could hook you up with my friend
that works over at Smith Barney.

1516
01:36:29,249 --> 01:36:31,774
- I know you can get a job there.
- Doing what? Ticket running?

1517
01:36:31,852 --> 01:36:36,949
You think coming from J.T. Marlin,
they'll let me trade? No fuckin' way.

1518
01:36:37,023 --> 01:36:41,619
Why are you so against this?
What do you care if I pull this off?

1519
01:36:41,695 --> 01:36:44,220
This is gonna be great
for both of us.

1520
01:36:56,042 --> 01:36:59,375
Seth, I just have
a bad feeling about all this.

1521
01:37:00,847 --> 01:37:03,372
- I gotta go.
- Seth, I need to talk to you.

1522
01:37:03,450 --> 01:37:05,441
I've just got to
figure something out.

1523
01:37:05,519 --> 01:37:07,453
I need to tell you something.
Please don't walk out.

1524
01:37:07,521 --> 01:37:09,955
Abby, can you come in here
for a second?

1525
01:37:10,023 --> 01:37:14,960
Yeah, Mom, one sec...
Seth. Fuck.

1526
01:37:15,028 --> 01:37:17,428
Mommy, what's going on?

1527
01:37:18,665 --> 01:37:21,099
Okay. Get that. Let's go.

1528
01:37:21,168 --> 01:37:23,898
- Mom, where are we going?
- Let's just go.

1529
01:37:33,647 --> 01:37:36,013
Yeah, I know.

1530
01:37:36,082 --> 01:37:39,779
You went too far this time.

1531
01:37:39,853 --> 01:37:44,916
Well, then, when you'd figured it out,
you should've said something.

1532
01:37:44,991 --> 01:37:48,051
No, he certainly
hasn't helped any.

1533
01:37:51,932 --> 01:37:55,265
But he loves you, Seth.

1534
01:37:55,335 --> 01:37:57,428
Do you know that?

1535
01:37:57,504 --> 01:38:00,439
It's important
that you know that.

1536
01:38:09,449 --> 01:38:10,609
Line three.

1537
01:38:15,689 --> 01:38:18,783
- Seth Davis here.
- Hi, Seth. How are you?

1538
01:38:20,694 --> 01:38:23,925
- Dad?
- Yep.

1539
01:38:23,997 --> 01:38:27,558
Listen, can I change your mind
about doing this I.P.O. Scheme?

1540
01:38:27,634 --> 01:38:30,535
No, I'm sorry.

1541
01:38:30,604 --> 01:38:33,072
I've already gone in
with somebody.

1542
01:38:33,139 --> 01:38:35,869
Well, then, I'm gonna
help you out with this.

1543
01:38:35,942 --> 01:38:38,911
You're gonna do it with me?

1544
01:38:38,979 --> 01:38:40,913
No, Seth.
You know I can't do that...

1545
01:38:40,981 --> 01:38:43,381
but at least I can make sure
you don't get caught.

1546
01:38:43,450 --> 01:38:46,078
I know somebody
over at Ellis Proud...

1547
01:38:46,152 --> 01:38:48,677
and they can talk to you
about it.

1548
01:38:48,755 --> 01:38:52,885
So, why don't you come over
to the house tomorrow night?

1549
01:38:52,959 --> 01:38:55,052
Thank you, Dad.
I'm so glad you called.

1550
01:38:55,128 --> 01:38:57,255
Me too.

1551
01:38:57,330 --> 01:39:00,128
Okay, kiddo.
Tomorrow night.

1552
01:39:00,200 --> 01:39:02,065
Okay.

1553
01:39:09,376 --> 01:39:12,937
So, do you wanna
talk to me, or... I mean...

1554
01:39:14,180 --> 01:39:16,671
I don't know
what to tell you.

1555
01:39:16,750 --> 01:39:20,277
Let's think about this whole thing.
If you pull this I.P.O. Deal off...

1556
01:39:20,353 --> 01:39:23,379
and I'm associated with you,
what do you think will happen to me?

1557
01:39:23,456 --> 01:39:26,687
- But they can't prove anything.
- Who says they have to?

1558
01:39:26,760 --> 01:39:31,094
I'm gonna lose my job unless I put
some distance between us right now.

1559
01:39:31,164 --> 01:39:35,100
Who cares about that?
I'm gonna take care of you.

1560
01:39:35,168 --> 01:39:39,764
Look, you are the one real thing
in my life right now.

1561
01:39:41,041 --> 01:39:45,137
Get out of the car, please.

1562
01:39:45,211 --> 01:39:50,274
You are under arrest for violation
of 26 S.E.C. And N.A.S.D. Regulations.

1563
01:39:50,350 --> 01:39:52,875
What the hell is going on
out here?

1564
01:39:52,953 --> 01:39:55,421
Seth, I'm gonna get you
out of this.

1565
01:39:55,488 --> 01:39:59,948
- Just don't call my father.
- Get back in the car, Abby.

1566
01:40:12,606 --> 01:40:15,370
Why is he here right now?
He didn't do anything.

1567
01:40:15,442 --> 01:40:17,535
Seth, what the hell
is going on?

1568
01:40:17,611 --> 01:40:20,876
- You've been talking to them about me.
- Of course not!

1569
01:40:20,947 --> 01:40:24,348
- What is he doing here right now?
- Seth, are you sure?

1570
01:40:24,417 --> 01:40:28,786
Of course I'm sure.
I didn't say anything.

1571
01:40:28,855 --> 01:40:31,483
All right. That's it.
I am out of here in three seconds...

1572
01:40:31,558 --> 01:40:34,220
unless you can
charge me with something.

1573
01:40:35,996 --> 01:40:39,932
Can I change your mind
about doing the I.P.O. Scheme?

1574
01:40:40,000 --> 01:40:43,868
Well, then I'm gonna help you out.
I know somebody over at Ellis Proud.

1575
01:40:43,937 --> 01:40:46,132
At least I can make sure
you don't get caught.

1576
01:40:48,775 --> 01:40:50,709
Oh, my God.

1577
01:40:50,777 --> 01:40:54,178
So, what
do you want from me?

1578
01:40:54,247 --> 01:40:56,340
I want you to testify.

1579
01:40:56,416 --> 01:41:00,614
- Well, what are you offering?
- Full immunity.

1580
01:41:00,687 --> 01:41:06,250
- And what happens with my father?
- He won't do any time.

1581
01:41:06,326 --> 01:41:09,056
Seth, I haven't done
anything illegal.

1582
01:41:09,129 --> 01:41:11,359
So, what's the deal, then?

1583
01:41:11,431 --> 01:41:14,958
The deal is I lose my judgeship
just going along for the ride.

1584
01:41:15,035 --> 01:41:19,165
- I have nothing to do with that.
- What's that supposed to mean?

1585
01:41:19,239 --> 01:41:21,332
Are you gonna release the tape
to the press?

1586
01:41:21,408 --> 01:41:24,639
Makes your case more glamorous
with the involvement of a federal judge.

1587
01:41:24,711 --> 01:41:28,306
- No. No, no. No deal.
- Why?

1588
01:41:28,381 --> 01:41:33,216
No, you take my father out the back,
and you bring him home.

1589
01:41:33,286 --> 01:41:35,880
He has nothing
to do with this case.

1590
01:41:35,955 --> 01:41:40,187
I swear to God, if he ends up
in one newspaper, I do not testify.

1591
01:41:40,260 --> 01:41:43,058
And I mean that.

1592
01:41:43,129 --> 01:41:45,825
For me, it'd be worth
going to jail for.

1593
01:41:45,899 --> 01:41:49,357
- You serious?
- What do you think?

1594
01:41:53,239 --> 01:41:58,267
Before we get ahead of ourselves,
just what are you offering?

1595
01:41:58,344 --> 01:42:02,178
I'm gonna hand you this case
on a silver fucking platter.

1596
01:42:02,248 --> 01:42:05,911
I know everything you don't.
I know how it all works.

1597
01:42:05,985 --> 01:42:08,351
I know how Michael
makes his money.

1598
01:42:08,421 --> 01:42:10,446
I know how he hides it.

1599
01:42:10,523 --> 01:42:13,117
I know who he goes in with.

1600
01:42:13,193 --> 01:42:16,788
I even know where he moves
if you guys get too close.

1601
01:42:16,863 --> 01:42:19,696
I know everything!

1602
01:42:19,766 --> 01:42:22,462
So tell me what happens now.

1603
01:42:22,535 --> 01:42:25,902
You go back to work tomorrow
like nothing happened, for one day.

1604
01:42:25,972 --> 01:42:30,466
I need your client book and your whole
"C" drive backed up onto floppy.

1605
01:42:36,349 --> 01:42:39,978
- And we have to hold you overnight.
- Just a minute, please.

1606
01:42:40,053 --> 01:42:44,456
Please, I want a couple of moments
alone with my son.

1607
01:42:44,524 --> 01:42:47,721
- I'm sorry...
- David, let's give them a moment.

1608
01:43:01,941 --> 01:43:05,809
I am so sorry.
I am so fuckin' sorry.

1609
01:43:07,881 --> 01:43:12,580
Seth, just let me speak.

1610
01:43:14,020 --> 01:43:17,956
When I came up to you
behind that car...

1611
01:43:18,024 --> 01:43:20,515
it was the hardest thing
I ever had to bear...

1612
01:43:20,593 --> 01:43:24,791
because all I wanted to do
was make your pain disappear.

1613
01:43:30,503 --> 01:43:34,132
I don't even know how
to describe the feeling.

1614
01:43:40,980 --> 01:43:43,471
I just want you
to know one thing.

1615
01:43:45,251 --> 01:43:50,314
Not a day of my life has gone by
that I don't think about that moment...

1616
01:43:50,390 --> 01:43:54,554
that I don't dream about being back
there just to have one more chance.

1617
01:43:58,898 --> 01:44:01,890
I am more sorry
than you will ever know.

1618
01:44:17,917 --> 01:44:23,082
You know that E! 's got
that bathing suit thing going.

1619
01:44:23,156 --> 01:44:25,351
French Riviera.
It's on tonight.

1620
01:44:25,425 --> 01:44:29,225
The guy was an idiot. He acted like
he was from Staten Island. No...

1621
01:44:29,295 --> 01:44:33,231
Hi, you've reached the Reynards.
Please leave a message.

1622
01:44:33,299 --> 01:44:35,460
Thanks. Have a nice day.

1623
01:44:35,535 --> 01:44:37,696
Hey, Harry.
It's Seth Davis.

1624
01:44:37,770 --> 01:44:40,034
- Are you there?
- Isaac, your mother on line three.

1625
01:44:40,106 --> 01:44:44,008
You know, about the way
things went, I just...

1626
01:44:47,013 --> 01:44:49,379
I found a way
to get your money back.

1627
01:44:49,449 --> 01:44:51,542
I just need you
to call me back, all right?

1628
01:44:51,618 --> 01:44:54,451
George, get me a coffee.
Thanks.

1629
01:44:54,520 --> 01:44:56,454
So call me.

1630
01:45:13,206 --> 01:45:15,106
What?

1631
01:45:15,174 --> 01:45:18,940
- Hi.
- What's up?

1632
01:45:19,012 --> 01:45:22,470
- I want to talk to you about a client.
- Yeah.

1633
01:45:22,548 --> 01:45:26,040
- His name is Harry Reynard.
- I don't know him.

1634
01:45:27,553 --> 01:45:29,612
I think you should,
because we're about to lose him.

1635
01:45:29,689 --> 01:45:33,489
He dropped $50,000 on
Farrow Tech this week alone.

1636
01:45:33,559 --> 01:45:34,787
And you want to do what?

1637
01:45:34,861 --> 01:45:38,058
I want to keep him here.

1638
01:45:38,131 --> 01:45:42,500
I think that we should give him
a chunk of the Med Patent I.P.O.

1639
01:45:42,568 --> 01:45:44,900
We don't hand out I.P.O. To somebody
who had a bad day on the market.

1640
01:45:44,971 --> 01:45:47,963
Look, Michael, this guy
is a fucking whale...

1641
01:45:48,041 --> 01:45:50,475
and he's gonna do an obscene amount
of business with this firm.

1642
01:45:50,543 --> 01:45:54,172
- You're somehow sure of this.
- Yeah, the guy completely trusts me.

1643
01:45:54,247 --> 01:45:56,408
He doesn't even need the money.

1644
01:45:56,482 --> 01:45:58,848
He owns the biggest
foods company in Wisconsin.

1645
01:45:58,918 --> 01:46:00,783
He just wants to know
we're gonna do right by him.

1646
01:46:00,853 --> 01:46:02,411
How many trades has he made?

1647
01:46:04,123 --> 01:46:05,681
Two.

1648
01:46:05,758 --> 01:46:08,693
But he made a second trade
a week after I opened him.

1649
01:46:08,761 --> 01:46:12,128
Look, the guy's pretty fuckin'
sour on Farrow Tech...

1650
01:46:12,198 --> 01:46:13,426
and he's gonna walk.

1651
01:46:13,499 --> 01:46:17,367
I just think we need to make him
a little money on this next I.P. O...

1652
01:46:17,437 --> 01:46:19,371
and let him
take it for a ride.

1653
01:46:19,439 --> 01:46:21,669
What did Greg say?

1654
01:46:21,741 --> 01:46:25,199
He's busy closing somebody.
I didn't want to bother him.

1655
01:46:26,946 --> 01:46:28,811
Well, go get him.

1656
01:46:32,185 --> 01:46:35,552
Hey, Greg.
Michael wants to see you.

1657
01:46:48,401 --> 01:46:51,564
I don't know what he told you,
but I've had it with this shit.

1658
01:46:51,637 --> 01:46:56,574
This is a business, all right?
He should be making calls...

1659
01:46:56,642 --> 01:47:00,874
not in here bitching about
personal petty shit between me and him.

1660
01:47:00,947 --> 01:47:04,075
Seth was talking about giving
Med Patent I.P.O. To Harry Reynard.

1661
01:47:05,818 --> 01:47:07,752
What... Are you
fucking kidding me?

1662
01:47:07,820 --> 01:47:10,380
First of all, I don't even
know this guy Reynard.

1663
01:47:10,456 --> 01:47:14,483
No way. He's totally unreliable.
What are you doing?

1664
01:47:14,560 --> 01:47:17,654
Guy dropped 50 large
on Farrow Tech this week.

1665
01:47:17,730 --> 01:47:22,599
That's great. But I have lots of clients
who deserve I.P.O. More than this guy.

1666
01:47:22,668 --> 01:47:24,431
Clients who've been
with me six months...

1667
01:47:24,504 --> 01:47:26,233
taken losses
and continue to trade.

1668
01:47:26,305 --> 01:47:29,536
- And he's one of 'em, asshole.
- You see what I'm dealing with here?

1669
01:47:29,609 --> 01:47:33,409
- What do you mean, "he's one of them"?
- He's one of Greg's clients.

1670
01:47:33,479 --> 01:47:34,741
What?

1671
01:47:34,814 --> 01:47:36,714
I opened him when I was
closing my 40 accounts for you.

1672
01:47:36,783 --> 01:47:38,876
I'm just his contact here.
He's your client.

1673
01:47:38,951 --> 01:47:40,942
I'm not gonna
make a dime off this trade.

1674
01:47:41,020 --> 01:47:42,851
No wonder the guy's pissed off.

1675
01:47:42,922 --> 01:47:45,220
His own broker doesn't even know
he's a fuckin' client here.

1676
01:47:48,294 --> 01:47:50,592
Fine.

1677
01:47:50,663 --> 01:47:52,858
Give him 10,000 shares.

1678
01:47:52,932 --> 01:47:55,628
He just can't sell it
before we say so.

1679
01:47:55,701 --> 01:47:58,864
- Great. Okay.
- No joke, Seth.

1680
01:47:58,938 --> 01:48:01,805
He cannot sell it
before we sell it.

1681
01:48:01,874 --> 01:48:05,401
- At least six months, you understand?
- Absolutely. Absolutely.

1682
01:48:05,478 --> 01:48:08,311
Greg, I'm sure you don't
have a problem with this.

1683
01:48:08,381 --> 01:48:10,781
Can you get the fuck
out of my office?

1684
01:48:10,850 --> 01:48:12,784
Fine.

1685
01:48:17,190 --> 01:48:19,249
What the fuck are you doing?

1686
01:48:19,325 --> 01:48:22,317
Stand up! You cannot sit down
for the rest of the fuckin' day!

1687
01:48:22,395 --> 01:48:26,491
You cannot sit down
ever again! Okay?

1688
01:48:29,402 --> 01:48:31,336
Seth, line two.

1689
01:48:38,511 --> 01:48:41,878
- Hello?
- It's time, Seth.

1690
01:48:41,948 --> 01:48:43,916
Get going.

1691
01:49:15,681 --> 01:49:17,615
I'm going to lunch, boys.

1692
01:49:34,100 --> 01:49:36,568
What's this about?
You okay?

1693
01:49:36,636 --> 01:49:42,404
I need you to sign a sell ticket
for a client of mine.

1694
01:49:42,475 --> 01:49:44,636
Fuck Greg!
Let's fuckin' deal with...

1695
01:49:44,710 --> 01:49:47,975
- Let's talk to Michael.
- No, wait. Wait, wait.

1696
01:49:48,047 --> 01:49:50,038
Chris, I got arrested
last night.

1697
01:49:50,116 --> 01:49:52,414
What?

1698
01:49:52,485 --> 01:49:55,215
The F.B.I. Arrested me.

1699
01:49:55,288 --> 01:49:58,257
The F.B. I? Why the fuck
would the F.B.I. Arrest you?

1700
01:49:58,324 --> 01:50:00,815
Because of my involvement
in this firm.

1701
01:50:00,893 --> 01:50:04,852
Your involvement in the firm?
What the fuck does that mean?

1702
01:50:04,931 --> 01:50:06,990
Come on, Chris.
You know what that means.

1703
01:50:07,066 --> 01:50:09,261
No, I don't know what that means.
What does that mean?

1704
01:50:09,335 --> 01:50:12,964
- What the fuck did you tell 'em?
- No. No.

1705
01:50:13,039 --> 01:50:17,772
No, they knew everything, man.
They had photographs.

1706
01:50:17,843 --> 01:50:21,404
They had... They had
tape-recorded conversations.

1707
01:50:21,480 --> 01:50:23,744
They brought my father in,
you know. I mean...

1708
01:50:23,816 --> 01:50:27,582
- Chris, there was nothing I could do.
- What did you do?

1709
01:50:27,653 --> 01:50:30,087
Chris, the F.B.I. Are gonna
raid the place in 20 minutes.

1710
01:50:30,156 --> 01:50:33,057
What the fuck
are you talking about?

1711
01:50:33,125 --> 01:50:35,355
Fuck, Seth!

1712
01:50:35,428 --> 01:50:37,362
Come on, man.

1713
01:50:37,430 --> 01:50:39,557
I asked you for months
about shit going down here...

1714
01:50:39,632 --> 01:50:41,566
and you told me
to shut the fuck up.

1715
01:50:41,634 --> 01:50:43,727
You said get ready
to be a millionaire!

1716
01:50:43,803 --> 01:50:46,567
That's right. Shut the fuck up.
That's all you had to do.

1717
01:50:46,639 --> 01:50:48,163
Didn't you learn anything?

1718
01:50:48,241 --> 01:50:50,300
I learned how to fuck people
out of their money.

1719
01:50:51,577 --> 01:50:55,104
Harry Reynard just lost
his life savings.

1720
01:50:55,181 --> 01:50:58,446
And he wasn't a whale.

1721
01:50:58,517 --> 01:51:03,921
He was just some poor schmuck,
and I took him.

1722
01:51:03,990 --> 01:51:07,790
I did everything that J.T. Marlin
taught me to do...

1723
01:51:07,860 --> 01:51:09,828
and I made up his mind
for him.

1724
01:51:09,895 --> 01:51:13,797
What do you want me to tell you?
That's what we do here.

1725
01:51:13,866 --> 01:51:16,892
What? We lie?
We're liars?

1726
01:51:17,970 --> 01:51:21,770
Seth, this...

1727
01:51:26,846 --> 01:51:28,780
Who are they coming for?

1728
01:51:28,848 --> 01:51:32,215
They're coming
for everybody, everything.

1729
01:51:35,021 --> 01:51:37,114
You know how hard I worked
to get where I am?

1730
01:51:37,189 --> 01:51:39,749
No, Chris, you need
to forget about that.

1731
01:51:39,825 --> 01:51:41,884
It doesn't mean shit.

1732
01:51:41,961 --> 01:51:44,759
Right now at this moment
is what you should be thinking about.

1733
01:51:44,830 --> 01:51:47,594
What are you gonna do
in the next 15 minutes?

1734
01:51:47,667 --> 01:51:51,467
They're gonna come in here,
and make sure that we never trade...

1735
01:51:51,537 --> 01:51:53,937
another share of stock
for the rest of our lives.

1736
01:51:54,006 --> 01:51:58,170
- But we can do something.
- What's that?

1737
01:51:58,244 --> 01:52:01,008
Harry, my client.

1738
01:52:01,080 --> 01:52:04,413
I need a senior broker
to sign a sell ticket...

1739
01:52:04,483 --> 01:52:06,348
so he can take his shares...

1740
01:52:06,419 --> 01:52:11,118
and dump 'em on the open market
and make his money back.

1741
01:52:15,261 --> 01:52:18,697
Come on, Chris. Come on.
What's the difference?

1742
01:52:18,764 --> 01:52:21,528
Do one thing right here.

1743
01:52:22,601 --> 01:52:25,229
Just sign it, please.

1744
01:52:32,978 --> 01:52:35,003
Thank you, Chris.

1745
01:52:41,554 --> 01:52:44,990
I'm so sorry.

1746
01:53:07,580 --> 01:53:09,946
I'm plagued by "what ifs"
these days.

1747
01:53:10,015 --> 01:53:13,382
What if Greg hadn't
come over that night?

1748
01:53:13,452 --> 01:53:16,216
What if I hadn't
forgotten my bag...

1749
01:53:16,288 --> 01:53:18,950
or seen Michael walk
into the building that day?

1750
01:53:20,693 --> 01:53:24,026
What if I had
skipped over Harry's card?

1751
01:53:24,096 --> 01:53:26,064
What are the chances?
What are the odds?

1752
01:53:26,132 --> 01:53:27,861
That's what I think about.

1753
01:53:27,933 --> 01:53:30,561
Hey, I ran a casino.

1754
01:53:32,872 --> 01:53:38,208
It's the next step I gotta figure out,
'cause I'm no lottery winner.

1755
01:53:38,277 --> 01:53:43,010
I tried slinging crack rock,
and I never had a jump shot.

1756
01:53:44,116 --> 01:53:47,051
I gotta find a job.

897
01:53:48,000 --> 01:53:51,058
Best watched using Open Subtitles MKV Player

title: Equity
script:
1
00:00:11,120 --> 00:00:13,112
[BELL RINGING AND CROWD CHEERING]

2
00:00:14,600 --> 00:00:17,832
- MAN 1: The entire market is watching.
- WOMAN 1: Back with Dynacorps' CEO.

3
00:00:18,000 --> 00:00:19,753
You must be very happy with this news...

4
00:00:19,920 --> 00:00:21,912
MAN 2: This runaway hit
that is the Dynacorps IPO...

5
00:00:22,120 --> 00:00:23,554
MAN 3: Take a look at the evaluation,
I'm really doubtful...

6
00:00:23,720 --> 00:00:26,792
MAN 2: So a great day for Dynacorps
and for the bankers at Gemini Trust...

7
00:00:27,000 --> 00:00:28,559
WOMAN 2: You'll understand...

8
00:00:28,720 --> 00:00:31,394
WOMAN 1:
...is climbing rapidly upwards today.

9
00:00:31,560 --> 00:00:33,199
WOMAN 3 [ON TV]:
...moving broadly higher at this hour...

10
00:00:33,360 --> 00:00:35,716
with utility and tech shares
leading the gains.

11
00:00:35,880 --> 00:00:37,997
But there is really
only one story out there...

12
00:00:38,160 --> 00:00:40,436
that everybody
in the market is watching...

13
00:00:40,640 --> 00:00:42,677
and that is the Dynacorps IPO.

14
00:00:42,840 --> 00:00:44,911
This truly is a historic day.

15
00:00:45,080 --> 00:00:46,514
We knew from the road show...

16
00:00:46,680 --> 00:00:48,990
the demand for the stock
was going to be strong.

17
00:00:49,160 --> 00:00:51,311
We expected to see a pop at the open.

18
00:00:51,560 --> 00:00:53,916
But nobody thought Dynacorps
would soar like this...

19
00:00:54,080 --> 00:00:56,993
all the way to 47,
and it looks like it is still climbing...

20
00:00:57,200 --> 00:00:59,556
at this hour, so a much better debut...

21
00:00:59,720 --> 00:01:03,236
than investors could have hoped for.
Of course, with this kind of move...

22
00:01:03,400 --> 00:01:06,120
you wonder whether the stock
may have been mispriced...

23
00:01:06,280 --> 00:01:09,239
whether or not perhaps they left
a little money on the table.

24
00:01:09,400 --> 00:01:11,710
We know that they actually
switched underwriters...

25
00:01:11,920 --> 00:01:14,435
going into this IPO, so there
was a bit of concern...

26
00:01:14,600 --> 00:01:18,276
about how things would shake
up, but clearly Dynacorps' IPO...

27
00:01:18,440 --> 00:01:20,830
is shaping up to be
one of the most successful...

28
00:01:21,000 --> 00:01:23,515
public offerings of the year.

29
00:01:24,280 --> 00:01:25,555
[]

30
00:01:27,680 --> 00:01:29,672
[CLEARS THROAT]

31
00:01:31,680 --> 00:01:34,479
NEEL: So what happened with Dynacorps?

32
00:01:34,640 --> 00:01:39,590
Neel, I have taken nine Silicon Valley
companies public in the last five years...

33
00:01:39,760 --> 00:01:43,276
and you want to talk about
the one I didn't take to the finish line?

34
00:01:44,680 --> 00:01:47,912
I work for the largest
investment bank in the world.

35
00:01:48,080 --> 00:01:49,992
We both know I found you guys capital...

36
00:01:50,160 --> 00:01:53,039
when you were just a couple kids
with a laptop and a dream.

37
00:01:53,200 --> 00:01:56,955
So we can talk about Dynacorps...

38
00:01:57,120 --> 00:01:59,430
or we can talk about you...

39
00:01:59,640 --> 00:02:01,677
and how I'm gonna grow your company...

40
00:02:01,840 --> 00:02:05,117
so you can build technology
that will transform people's lives.

41
00:02:09,480 --> 00:02:13,030
- Try the Tasmanian sea trout.
- Yeah, maybe I should.

42
00:02:14,840 --> 00:02:17,150
- Okay.
- Okay.

43
00:02:17,400 --> 00:02:19,960
[]

44
00:03:49,520 --> 00:03:50,670
[HORN HONKING]

45
00:04:06,120 --> 00:04:09,113
[CHATTERING]

46
00:04:24,520 --> 00:04:25,670
[KNOCK ON DOOR]

47
00:04:25,880 --> 00:04:28,634
- Hi.
- Hi. I saw the e-mail from Neel.

48
00:04:29,280 --> 00:04:32,830
Mm. He does love to play hard to get.

49
00:04:33,040 --> 00:04:35,316
Everyone likes to think
their company's a unicorn.

50
00:04:35,480 --> 00:04:38,473
- You read up on the other companies?
- Yeah, so I was looking at...

51
00:04:38,640 --> 00:04:41,200
Cachet? I have a hunch
they're looking to expand.

52
00:04:41,360 --> 00:04:43,238
You've got the numbers on them?

53
00:04:45,440 --> 00:04:47,159
I will bring them right over.

54
00:04:47,320 --> 00:04:48,310
Great.

55
00:04:48,480 --> 00:04:50,312
[TYPING ON KEYBOARD]

56
00:04:52,680 --> 00:04:53,909
Yeah?

57
00:04:55,040 --> 00:04:57,999
Everyone's saying there's gonna be
some movement around here.

58
00:04:58,160 --> 00:05:00,675
So I'm wondering
if now might be the time...

59
00:05:00,840 --> 00:05:02,672
- ...to talk about that promotion?
- No.

60
00:05:02,840 --> 00:05:04,513
Now is not the right time.

61
00:05:04,680 --> 00:05:06,797
HR is out there snatching BlackBerries.

62
00:05:08,120 --> 00:05:11,192
I get that. But I've been
under-compensated two years in a row...

63
00:05:11,360 --> 00:05:16,196
Erin, I told you I'd make a push
for you, and I will. But it is a down year.

64
00:05:17,560 --> 00:05:19,358
I do need those numbers ASAP.

65
00:05:22,360 --> 00:05:24,033
[]

66
00:05:52,080 --> 00:05:54,072
[CHATTERING]

67
00:05:58,240 --> 00:06:00,197
Naomi?

68
00:06:00,360 --> 00:06:01,430
Excuse me.

69
00:06:01,640 --> 00:06:03,438
Sam, hi.

70
00:06:03,640 --> 00:06:07,714
I... You know, I meant to reach out
when I heard you were doing this, but I...

71
00:06:07,880 --> 00:06:10,440
I thought you hated alumni events.

72
00:06:10,640 --> 00:06:12,233
Well...

73
00:06:12,400 --> 00:06:14,198
- But I think this is important.
- Yeah.

74
00:06:14,360 --> 00:06:16,955
I think these girls look at me
as what not to do.

75
00:06:17,160 --> 00:06:20,119
How to go to law school
and still end up broke.

76
00:06:20,280 --> 00:06:24,593
Well, I'm sure there must be
one young idealist in here somewhere.

77
00:06:24,760 --> 00:06:26,797
I hope so. Heh.

78
00:06:26,960 --> 00:06:28,440
So how are you? How are things?

79
00:06:28,600 --> 00:06:32,116
Are you still at the U.S. Attorney's Office
locking up drug dealers?

80
00:06:32,280 --> 00:06:36,035
I am. Uh, I'm actually in your area now.

81
00:06:36,200 --> 00:06:39,238
White-collar crime, uh, securities.

82
00:06:41,080 --> 00:06:42,958
Wow, that's quite a change.

83
00:06:43,120 --> 00:06:45,316
And you're at Remson still?

84
00:06:45,480 --> 00:06:46,880
I'm a lifer.

85
00:06:47,600 --> 00:06:49,193
Golden handcuffs.

86
00:06:49,400 --> 00:06:50,436
[BOTH CHUCKLE]

87
00:06:50,680 --> 00:06:52,080
Yeah.

88
00:06:52,640 --> 00:06:54,518
You got a file on us?

89
00:06:55,440 --> 00:06:58,478
I imagine we have a file on everyone.

90
00:07:02,280 --> 00:07:04,840
You know, I was just thinking
the other night...

91
00:07:05,000 --> 00:07:09,279
about the evening of Goatee Guy.

92
00:07:09,440 --> 00:07:11,511
- No, no.
- Yeah, yeah.

93
00:07:11,680 --> 00:07:13,637
That was horrifying.

94
00:07:13,800 --> 00:07:16,110
- The most awful walk of shame.
- It was awesome.

95
00:07:16,280 --> 00:07:18,875
No, it's not awesome.
There's nothing awesome about it.

96
00:07:19,120 --> 00:07:20,110
[BOTH CHUCKLE]

97
00:07:20,320 --> 00:07:23,119
Know what? We really should
get together. It's been forever.

98
00:07:23,280 --> 00:07:24,475
I would love that.

99
00:07:24,640 --> 00:07:25,994
- Me too.
- I'll, um...

100
00:07:26,160 --> 00:07:28,994
- I'll see you on the panel.
- Yeah. See you up there.

101
00:07:31,840 --> 00:07:36,471
I'm wondering, for each of you,
what's that thing that really makes you...

102
00:07:36,680 --> 00:07:38,273
want to get up in the morning?

103
00:07:41,560 --> 00:07:43,119
[LAUGHS]

104
00:07:43,320 --> 00:07:48,270
Well, for me, I guess,
the simplest answer is...

105
00:07:50,280 --> 00:07:51,839
I like money.

106
00:07:52,040 --> 00:07:53,440
[AUDIENCE CHUCKLING]

107
00:07:53,640 --> 00:07:55,677
I do. I like numbers.

108
00:07:55,840 --> 00:07:57,513
I like negotiating.

109
00:07:57,680 --> 00:07:59,637
I love a challenge.

110
00:07:59,800 --> 00:08:02,520
Turning a no into a yes.

111
00:08:03,840 --> 00:08:05,718
But I really do like money.

112
00:08:05,920 --> 00:08:09,152
I like knowing that I have it.

113
00:08:09,320 --> 00:08:12,358
I grew up in a house
where there was never enough.

114
00:08:12,520 --> 00:08:15,433
I was raised by a single mom
with four kids.

115
00:08:15,640 --> 00:08:17,199
I took my first job on Wall Street...

116
00:08:17,360 --> 00:08:20,910
so I could put my little brothers
through college.

117
00:08:21,080 --> 00:08:26,155
But I am not going to sit here
and tell you that I only do what I do...

118
00:08:26,320 --> 00:08:32,237
to take care of other people,
because it is okay to do it for ourselves.

119
00:08:32,400 --> 00:08:35,393
For how it makes us feel.

120
00:08:35,560 --> 00:08:37,756
Secure? Yeah.

121
00:08:37,920 --> 00:08:40,879
Powerful? Absolutely.

122
00:08:41,080 --> 00:08:43,879
I am so glad
that it's finally acceptable...

123
00:08:44,080 --> 00:08:48,677
for women to talk about ambition openly.

124
00:08:48,880 --> 00:08:52,874
But don't let money be a dirty word.

125
00:08:53,040 --> 00:08:55,157
We can like that too.

126
00:08:55,760 --> 00:08:58,992
[]

127
00:09:04,240 --> 00:09:06,880
FRANK:
Did I see you in a dress last night?

128
00:09:07,040 --> 00:09:08,269
Shut up.

129
00:09:08,480 --> 00:09:10,039
[CHUCKLING]

130
00:09:11,120 --> 00:09:14,636
So you go to the thing? You talk to her?

131
00:09:15,560 --> 00:09:17,916
- Your friend?
- I did.

132
00:09:18,080 --> 00:09:22,393
And? She give you anything
on the hedge fund guy?

133
00:09:22,560 --> 00:09:24,392
I haven't seen the woman in eight years.

134
00:09:24,560 --> 00:09:26,597
What exactly do you think
she'll give me...

135
00:09:26,760 --> 00:09:28,638
at our appearance at an alumni event?

136
00:09:28,800 --> 00:09:32,476
Look, this was your idea to nail Benji
through your banker friend, not mine.

137
00:09:32,640 --> 00:09:34,552
I said I'd make contact.

138
00:09:34,760 --> 00:09:36,274
And?

139
00:09:36,440 --> 00:09:38,830
I made contact.

140
00:09:45,960 --> 00:09:47,838
[]

141
00:10:10,640 --> 00:10:12,950
RANDALL: Naomi, thanks for coming.

142
00:10:13,520 --> 00:10:15,239
You know Leslie from HR?

143
00:10:16,640 --> 00:10:19,997
She needs a couple more names
from your department.

144
00:10:22,200 --> 00:10:24,954
Teddy Sidel and Arthur Abbott.

145
00:10:26,000 --> 00:10:28,993
You do know who Teddy's uncle is?

146
00:10:29,160 --> 00:10:31,311
You asked me to identify
the weakest performers.

147
00:10:31,520 --> 00:10:34,672
What you do with that information
is up to you.

148
00:10:35,880 --> 00:10:37,155
LESLIE: Okay.

149
00:10:42,440 --> 00:10:43,999
I guess you've heard the talk.

150
00:10:44,200 --> 00:10:45,953
I'm getting out. Retiring.

151
00:10:47,280 --> 00:10:49,272
Congratulations, Randall.

152
00:10:50,680 --> 00:10:53,036
You never want to stay
at the party too long.

153
00:10:56,360 --> 00:10:58,158
Your turn.

154
00:11:07,000 --> 00:11:09,640
Steady now.

155
00:11:13,040 --> 00:11:15,760
So they'll be naming a new...

156
00:11:16,840 --> 00:11:18,957
global head.

157
00:11:24,960 --> 00:11:27,873
Look, Naomi, I'm gonna be frank with you.

158
00:11:28,080 --> 00:11:31,073
This doesn't look like your year.

159
00:11:32,800 --> 00:11:34,632
Because of Dynacorps?

160
00:11:34,800 --> 00:11:38,237
I did ask around
about what happened there.

161
00:11:38,400 --> 00:11:41,154
And the perception...

162
00:11:41,800 --> 00:11:44,190
is that you rubbed
some people the wrong way.

163
00:11:47,240 --> 00:11:49,755
They're looking for a rainmaker.

164
00:11:50,000 --> 00:11:51,195
[CHUCKLES]

165
00:11:53,200 --> 00:11:54,680
Hm.

166
00:12:04,080 --> 00:12:05,878
You're hesitating. Push it.

167
00:12:06,040 --> 00:12:08,111
Go. Go!

168
00:12:09,280 --> 00:12:12,352
Go! Go! Go.

169
00:12:12,520 --> 00:12:14,512
[GRUNTING]

170
00:12:15,240 --> 00:12:18,995
I mean, at least hit me with some facts.

171
00:12:19,160 --> 00:12:20,594
Use my numbers against me.

172
00:12:20,800 --> 00:12:23,713
But perception? What the fuck
do I do with that?

173
00:12:25,800 --> 00:12:28,076
You haven't told me
the details about that deal.

174
00:12:28,240 --> 00:12:30,596
You didn't discuss it
at the board meeting?

175
00:12:31,360 --> 00:12:34,319
Apparently I wore an awful dress.

176
00:12:34,560 --> 00:12:36,199
[LAUGHING]

177
00:12:38,000 --> 00:12:40,720
- Oh, men don't do this, right?
- Hmm?

178
00:12:40,920 --> 00:12:44,277
You don't... You don't lose sleep over
this kind of stuff, do you?

179
00:12:44,440 --> 00:12:46,477
Oh, yeah, yeah, we do.

180
00:12:47,000 --> 00:12:51,313
We just don't...
We just don't turn in on ourselves.

181
00:12:51,840 --> 00:12:53,354
No, it's much more fun...

182
00:12:53,520 --> 00:12:56,877
- ...to get really pissed at someone else.
- Ooh.

183
00:12:59,720 --> 00:13:01,439
Yeah.

184
00:13:09,160 --> 00:13:10,150
[]

185
00:13:10,320 --> 00:13:14,394
What's the biggest deal
you could get right now?

186
00:13:15,200 --> 00:13:19,479
Cachet just added their 12th board member.

187
00:13:19,640 --> 00:13:20,994
Right.

188
00:13:21,160 --> 00:13:23,391
So they're going public?

189
00:13:24,360 --> 00:13:28,673
I found VCs for that kid
when he had five employees.

190
00:13:29,800 --> 00:13:31,200
Huh.

191
00:13:32,760 --> 00:13:34,114
[CHUCKLES]

192
00:13:41,080 --> 00:13:43,640
[GABE GROANS]

193
00:13:46,880 --> 00:13:48,280
GABE: What time's your car coming?

194
00:13:48,440 --> 00:13:50,079
ERIN: Four-thirty.

195
00:13:50,240 --> 00:13:52,709
GABE: Oh, Jesus, babe.

196
00:13:52,880 --> 00:13:54,917
You need to sleep.

197
00:13:56,240 --> 00:13:58,118
Please don't tell me what I need.

198
00:13:58,280 --> 00:14:01,352
Okay. I get it.

199
00:14:01,520 --> 00:14:04,399
You have to win the bake sale.

200
00:14:05,960 --> 00:14:07,440
Bake off.

201
00:14:07,880 --> 00:14:09,633
Bring me a brownie.

202
00:14:10,200 --> 00:14:15,832
Hm. I am bringing home the fucking bakery.

203
00:14:16,040 --> 00:14:18,077
- Yes!
- Yes.

204
00:14:18,240 --> 00:14:20,709
That's right. Oh, where are you going?

205
00:14:20,920 --> 00:14:23,515
ERIN: Heh. I'm going to bed.

206
00:14:29,120 --> 00:14:32,352
I hope I never have
to battle you for anything.

207
00:14:32,520 --> 00:14:34,796
Because you'd lose.

208
00:14:35,040 --> 00:14:36,633
[]

209
00:14:57,280 --> 00:14:58,839
Here's your coffees.

210
00:14:59,040 --> 00:15:02,033
- Thank you so much. I appreciate that.
- Thanks.

211
00:15:03,640 --> 00:15:05,677
- Hey, was that Channing Trust?
- Yeah, dude.

212
00:15:05,880 --> 00:15:09,032
My uncle said Remson's tapping the guy
with the glasses for new global head.

213
00:15:09,200 --> 00:15:11,192
[]

214
00:15:18,760 --> 00:15:20,752
[SIGHS]

215
00:15:24,880 --> 00:15:26,872
[CHATTERING]

216
00:15:36,920 --> 00:15:40,152
NAOMI: When I was a kid,
if you wanted privacy...

217
00:15:40,320 --> 00:15:43,472
if you wanted to send a secret message...

218
