lt's just an electronic transaction.

952
01:01:45,840 --> 01:01:48,752
But l want the transfer done.
And l want the bank...

953
01:01:48,840 --> 01:01:53,550
..to send us a fax of the statement,
showing the 7.78 billion yen credit.

954
01:01:55,400 --> 01:01:57,550
All right, Nick. lf you say so.

955
01:01:57,640 --> 01:01:59,198
Cheers, Bonnie.

956
01:02:01,000 --> 01:02:02,877
Nick?

957
01:02:02,960 --> 01:02:05,155
What's all this about seven billion yen?

958
01:02:05,240 --> 01:02:08,198
Someone from London, Tony Hawes,
was looking for you.

959
01:02:08,280 --> 01:02:11,829
Jesus Christ, if l hear any more
about this seven billion yen...

960
01:02:11,920 --> 01:02:14,036
lt's about $70 million, innit?

961
01:02:14,120 --> 01:02:15,997
What do you reckon? Red or blue?

962
01:02:16,080 --> 01:02:18,878
You think l just walked off
with $70 million?

963
01:02:18,960 --> 01:02:20,359
l didn't say that.

964
01:02:20,440 --> 01:02:22,396
lt's a computer error.

965
01:02:22,480 --> 01:02:27,429
You need someone in the back office,
l told you. You're not bloomin' Superman!

966
01:02:27,520 --> 01:02:29,158
Don't start all that again.

967
01:02:29,240 --> 01:02:31,515
lt wouldn't have happened
if l'd been there.

968
01:02:31,960 --> 01:02:34,190
Right. l'm goin' out.

969
01:02:34,280 --> 01:02:36,555
- Where are you going?
- To get pissed.

970
01:02:36,640 --> 01:02:39,518
lf anyone calls, tell 'em
l've gone to South America.

971
01:02:39,600 --> 01:02:42,160
Well, you can bloody stay there, then!

972
01:02:42,240 --> 01:02:44,231
Twat!

973
01:02:49,880 --> 01:02:51,552
(key in door)

974
01:03:25,760 --> 01:03:28,399
What have you done now, Leeson?

975
01:03:28,480 --> 01:03:30,471
What have you done now?

976
01:03:48,960 --> 01:03:51,793
- (knock on door)
- Come in.

977
01:03:57,800 --> 01:04:00,758
l thought you'd like to know
the audit's been cleared.

978
01:04:00,840 --> 01:04:04,719
- Nick sent the papers. Everyone's happy.
- Thanks, Ron.

979
01:04:04,800 --> 01:04:09,112
Technically we've breached SlMEX rules,
but it was just a non-transaction.

980
01:04:09,200 --> 01:04:10,758
With any luck...

981
01:04:10,840 --> 01:04:15,311
..the auditors won't mention it, or we may
have problems with the local regulator.

982
01:04:15,400 --> 01:04:17,630
Sounds sensible.

983
01:04:17,720 --> 01:04:22,714
Do you know, Nick made $10 million
doing arbitrage in a week?

984
01:04:22,800 --> 01:04:25,553
That's about...
half a billion dollars a year.

985
01:04:25,640 --> 01:04:27,710
The guy's a turbo arbitrageur!

986
01:04:27,800 --> 01:04:31,588
lf he's doing that amount of business
for that amount of profit,...

987
01:04:31,680 --> 01:04:35,309
..why don't we shut down the rest
of the bank? We're just overhead.

988
01:04:35,400 --> 01:04:36,958
Yeah!

989
01:04:37,080 --> 01:04:38,991
(phone rings)

990
01:04:46,960 --> 01:04:49,030
- Hello?
- Nick,...

991
01:04:49,120 --> 01:04:51,953
..are you avoiding me?
l've been trying you for days.

992
01:04:52,040 --> 01:04:53,837
Sorry, Tony, it's been chaos.

993
01:04:53,920 --> 01:04:56,309
The audit went through.
l thought you knew.

994
01:04:56,400 --> 01:04:59,392
- lt's this SLK thing.
- lt's all been cleared up.

995
01:05:00,080 --> 01:05:04,676
l know. What's bothering me is where
you got all the money to actually...

996
01:05:04,760 --> 01:05:06,716
..well, pay SLK in the first place.

997
01:05:06,800 --> 01:05:09,268
l mean, it's the equivalent of $78 million!

998
01:05:09,360 --> 01:05:11,351
lt doesn't add up, you know.

999
01:05:12,560 --> 01:05:17,429
lt's obvious. lt's part of the funding we've
had from you over the past few weeks.

1000
01:05:17,520 --> 01:05:18,555
Yes.

1001
01:05:18,640 --> 01:05:22,030
So, the same figure will flow back to you.

1002
01:05:22,120 --> 01:05:26,352
l see. You're saying that some of
the funding was used to pay SLK?

1003
01:05:26,440 --> 01:05:29,910
That's right, Tony.
So we'll be able to pay it back to you.

1004
01:05:30,000 --> 01:05:33,276
That'll be good. Er...
getting our funding down will be good.

1005
01:05:33,360 --> 01:05:35,590
l'm having to juggle quite a few balls.

1006
01:05:35,680 --> 01:05:37,796
We all are, Tony. Look, l've got to dash.

1007
01:05:37,880 --> 01:05:39,677
l've got company for dinner.

1008
01:05:39,760 --> 01:05:42,558
- Of course. Thanks, Nick.
- (Nick hangs up abruptly)

1009
01:05:42,640 --> 01:05:44,631
Thanks for... clearing that up.

1010
01:05:45,800 --> 01:05:47,791
(phone rings)

1011
01:05:51,240 --> 01:05:53,196
Yes, Ron. What do you want?

1012
01:05:53,280 --> 01:05:55,953
lt's me, you wanker! Danny.

1013
01:05:56,040 --> 01:05:59,555
Bubble? What are you doing
calling me in the middle of the night?

1014
01:05:59,640 --> 01:06:01,517
Are you anywhere near a TV?

1015
01:06:01,600 --> 01:06:03,795
l suggest you tune in to CNN.

1016
01:06:08,680 --> 01:06:11,877
The worst damage was in
the seaport of Kobe.

1017
01:06:11,960 --> 01:06:14,269
Road and rail links are shattered...

1018
01:06:15,000 --> 01:06:17,992
Jesus, an earthquake!
That's all we fuckin' need.

1019
01:06:19,400 --> 01:06:21,391
This is gonna kill the market, man.

1020
01:06:21,480 --> 01:06:24,313
The Nikkei's gonna fall
through the fuckin' floor!

1021
01:06:24,400 --> 01:06:26,709
..milling around in search of help.

1022
01:06:26,800 --> 01:06:29,917
Rescue operations are going
to be complicated, long...

1023
01:06:30,000 --> 01:06:34,676
..and expensive. Mike Chinoy,
CNN, reporting live from Tokyo.

1024
01:06:34,760 --> 01:06:36,751
(uproar)

1025
01:06:57,240 --> 01:07:01,074
Market's down 300 points, you stand
there cool as a fuckin' cucumber.

1026
01:07:01,160 --> 01:07:03,230
The way l see it, it's an opportunity.

1027
01:07:03,320 --> 01:07:07,552
l'm gonna buy into the market.
Buy it all the way back up to 1 9,000.

1028
01:07:07,640 --> 01:07:08,914
Oi!

1029
01:07:12,240 --> 01:07:15,437
Fuckin' true what they say
about your gonads, mate.

1030
01:07:16,480 --> 01:07:18,471
See what l mean?

1031
01:07:19,480 --> 01:07:24,076
Think l'll give Fernando a bell in Tokyo,
see what's shakin'. No pun intended.

1032
01:07:24,160 --> 01:07:26,549
lt's Nick. What's the situation in Kobe?

1033
01:07:26,640 --> 01:07:30,713
We've been trying to contact our friends,
but the lines are down.

1034
01:07:30,800 --> 01:07:32,711
Hold it a second. We got movement.

1035
01:07:32,800 --> 01:07:36,031
Holy shit, selling! There's some selling!

1036
01:07:36,840 --> 01:07:38,876
Fuckin' hell, it's in free fall!

1037
01:07:38,960 --> 01:07:40,951
l've never seen it move so fast.

1038
01:07:42,080 --> 01:07:44,992
350! 350!

1039
01:07:45,080 --> 01:07:46,399
350!

1040
01:07:57,880 --> 01:07:59,950
Nick?

1041
01:08:00,040 --> 01:08:02,031
Sure you don't want us to stay?

1042
01:08:03,560 --> 01:08:05,516
No, l... l'm fine. You go.

1043
01:08:05,600 --> 01:08:07,670
You'll make it right, Nick.

1044
01:08:08,280 --> 01:08:10,157
We all believe in you.

1045
01:08:43,560 --> 01:08:45,551
50 million!

1046
01:08:49,280 --> 01:08:50,998
l,...

1047
01:08:51,080 --> 01:08:53,389
..Nicholas Leeson,...

1048
01:08:53,480 --> 01:08:55,311
..have lost...

1049
01:08:55,400 --> 01:08:57,391
..50 million quid...

1050
01:08:58,320 --> 01:09:00,311
..in one day!

1051
01:09:05,320 --> 01:09:07,276
What does he do, exactly?

1052
01:09:07,360 --> 01:09:09,828
That's what no one seems able to explain.

1053
01:09:09,920 --> 01:09:13,629
lt's simple. He switches contracts
between Osaka and SlMEX,...

1054
01:09:13,720 --> 01:09:16,996
..exploiting price differentials
between the two markets.

1055
01:09:17,080 --> 01:09:19,913
That's how he offers the best deals
to our customers.

1056
01:09:20,000 --> 01:09:22,753
lf it's that easy,
why isn't everybody doing it?

1057
01:09:22,840 --> 01:09:27,311
Because he's absolutely in the vortex
of the information curve over there.

1058
01:09:27,400 --> 01:09:30,312
He's discovered a whole
new way of making money.

1059
01:09:30,960 --> 01:09:35,272
Well, he's giving us horrendous
funding problems, that's all l know.

1060
01:09:36,440 --> 01:09:40,513
He doesn't do things by the book, Ron.
He just doesn't respect the rules.

1061
01:09:40,600 --> 01:09:44,309
ls he really the kind of person
we should be employing at Barings?

1062
01:09:44,400 --> 01:09:49,349
Oh, fuck the rules. lt's barrow boys like
Nick who are turning the City around.

1063
01:09:49,440 --> 01:09:53,831
You can't run a modern financial centre
with a bunch of Hooray Henries.

1064
01:09:58,560 --> 01:09:59,959
Bastard!

1065
01:10:00,040 --> 01:10:02,031
Wakey-wakey!

1066
01:10:02,600 --> 01:10:04,955
- What's the action, mate?
- You tell me.

1067
01:10:05,040 --> 01:10:07,918
The market's up and down
like a tart's knickers.

1068
01:10:08,000 --> 01:10:11,197
- l think the worst is over.
- Who knows? You could be right.

1069
01:10:11,280 --> 01:10:13,236
Well, that's my hunch anyway.

1070
01:10:13,320 --> 01:10:15,914
Listen, l was out last night with that Loy.

1071
01:10:16,000 --> 01:10:18,036
You know, that journo from Reuters.

1072
01:10:18,120 --> 01:10:20,634
He's convinced
there's no mystery customer.

1073
01:10:20,720 --> 01:10:24,349
He reckons it's you. He thinks
you're trading on your own account.

1074
01:10:24,440 --> 01:10:26,396
Without the bank's approval.

1075
01:10:28,600 --> 01:10:30,716
Now, you're not that crazy, are you?

1076
01:10:30,800 --> 01:10:32,677
What do you think?

1077
01:10:32,760 --> 01:10:36,036
Who, then? Beaumarchais?
l thought he'd given you the elbow.

1078
01:10:36,120 --> 01:10:39,271
- l can't tell you.
- Come on. lt's me, Danny Boy!

1079
01:10:39,360 --> 01:10:42,670
l could tell you... but l'd
have to shoot you afterwards.

1080
01:10:45,760 --> 01:10:48,433
l know one thing.
lf Customer X didn't exist,...

1081
01:10:48,520 --> 01:10:50,556
..you'd have to invent him.

1082
01:10:52,680 --> 01:10:55,319
45 million?
You've already had 100 this week.

1083
01:10:55,400 --> 01:10:59,791
Everybody's had an advance margin call
from SlMEX on their client positions.

1084
01:10:59,880 --> 01:11:03,077
They're worried about stability
with these big movements.

1085
01:11:03,160 --> 01:11:05,151
lt's an emergency measure(?)

1086
01:11:06,280 --> 01:11:08,271
lsn't everybody squealing out there?

1087
01:11:08,360 --> 01:11:11,352
No, we'll get it back
when the market calms down.

1088
01:11:12,400 --> 01:11:15,392
Nick, when are you gonna
reduce these positions?

1089
01:11:15,480 --> 01:11:17,869
The bean counters are freakin' out!

1090
01:11:17,960 --> 01:11:20,394
Ron! Didn't know you were there.

1091
01:11:20,480 --> 01:11:24,075
For fuck's sake, we've had
the Bank of lnternational Settlements...

1092
01:11:24,160 --> 01:11:26,720
..asking if Barings can
meet its margin payments!

1093
01:11:26,800 --> 01:11:30,509
- lt is not good for the image!
- l hear you, Ron. lt's a tight market.

1094
01:11:30,600 --> 01:11:32,795
Yeah, well, you've really gotta try.

1095
01:11:32,880 --> 01:11:34,871
Take a hit on it if you have to.

1096
01:11:34,960 --> 01:11:39,238
l know Norris is gonna want to discuss it
with you when he's out there next week.

1097
01:11:39,320 --> 01:11:40,992
Norris?

1098
01:11:41,760 --> 01:11:44,718
- l didn't know he was coming.
- Yeah, with Tony Hawes.

1099
01:11:44,800 --> 01:11:49,112
They want to check the numbers. lron out
these funding problems once and for all!

1100
01:11:50,600 --> 01:11:52,989
(thunder)

1101
01:11:54,400 --> 01:11:58,678
There was no way l could reduce my
positions without the market collapsing.

1102
01:11:58,760 --> 01:12:03,470
By the time they got to Singapore l was in
deeper than ever, faxing Brenda daily,...

1103
01:12:03,560 --> 01:12:06,313
..30, 40 million dollars at a time.

1104
01:12:07,560 --> 01:12:09,551
They were gonna kill me.

1105
01:12:32,280 --> 01:12:34,271
Lookin' like shit, Nick.

1106
01:12:35,840 --> 01:12:37,910
Lookin' like fuckin' shit, mate.

1107
01:12:45,600 --> 01:12:47,830
- Good evening, sir.
- Good evening.

1108
01:12:50,080 --> 01:12:52,071
(laughter and chat)

1109
01:12:54,320 --> 01:12:57,517
(Hawes) His approach shot
sliced into the woods...

1110
01:12:58,600 --> 01:13:01,910
- Nick. There you are.
- l'm sorry l'm a little bit late.

1111
01:13:02,000 --> 01:13:04,719
- What'll you have?
- A beer would be great, thanks.

1112
01:13:04,800 --> 01:13:06,791
Another Tiger, please.

1113
01:13:07,240 --> 01:13:09,231
Nick...

1114
01:13:10,600 --> 01:13:13,876
- How was the market today?
- lt stayed between 18,000 and 18,300.

1115
01:13:13,960 --> 01:13:15,951
lt's settled after the earthquake.

1116
01:13:16,040 --> 01:13:18,315
Happy with the positions you're running?

1117
01:13:18,400 --> 01:13:21,790
l'm relaxed. They're March contracts,
so l'll let them expire.

1118
01:13:21,880 --> 01:13:23,598
- Good.
- Thanks.

1119
01:13:25,440 --> 01:13:28,637
Now, we've had a lot of stick...
over funding.

1120
01:13:28,720 --> 01:13:32,998
Brenda Granger tells me we're borrowing
all over Japan to get the funds to you.

1121
01:13:33,080 --> 01:13:35,275
People are beginning to talk, Nick.

1122
01:13:35,360 --> 01:13:37,476
l understand.

1123
01:13:37,560 --> 01:13:39,391
l understand completely.

1124
01:13:39,960 --> 01:13:41,552
Excellent.

1125
01:13:41,640 --> 01:13:43,631
Good man.

1126
01:13:45,440 --> 01:13:49,399
And that was it. That was apparently
all he had to say on the subject...

1127
01:13:49,480 --> 01:13:54,076
..of my enormous exposure causing
so many ulcers throughout Barings.

1128
01:13:54,160 --> 01:13:56,913
Better than you get in London,
that's for sure!

1129
01:13:57,000 --> 01:13:58,877
You'll enjoy the next course.

1130
01:13:58,960 --> 01:14:01,952
- Lobster, sir?
- No, thanks. l'm not very hungry.

1131
01:14:02,040 --> 01:14:04,679
l should have been able
to relax after that,...

1132
01:14:04,760 --> 01:14:09,117
..but l couldn't stop thinking about
the losses in the five eights account.

1133
01:14:09,200 --> 01:14:11,714
Shame you can't stay
for the match on Saturday.

1134
01:14:11,800 --> 01:14:13,791
(voices echo)

1135
01:14:16,680 --> 01:14:18,671
(Hawes) You're down for 450, aren't you?

1136
01:14:20,680 --> 01:14:22,750
Your bonus.

1137
01:14:22,840 --> 01:14:24,876
Only a week to go.

1138
01:14:26,480 --> 01:14:27,913
Sorry?

1139
01:14:28,000 --> 01:14:32,516
Have you thought about what you're
going to do with it? Only a week to go!

1140
01:14:37,040 --> 01:14:40,032
Ahem! Excuse me.
l have an announcement to make.

1141
01:14:42,720 --> 01:14:46,633
l know that some of you are worried
about our exposure in the market,...

1142
01:14:46,720 --> 01:14:51,635
..and you're probably wondering about
the identity of our mystery Customer X.

1143
01:14:52,440 --> 01:14:54,829
Well, the fact is...

1144
01:14:54,920 --> 01:14:56,911
..he doesn't exist.

1145
01:14:57,680 --> 01:14:59,910
We are the customer: Barings.

1146
01:15:00,000 --> 01:15:02,514
Look properly at
the five eights account -

1147
01:15:02,600 --> 01:15:05,876
..which is not a client account,
it's an errors account -

1148
01:15:05,960 --> 01:15:10,511
..and you'll realise it's concealing
losses in the region of 200 million.

1149
01:15:11,200 --> 01:15:15,159
No, l tell a lie.
lt's more like 230 after today!

1150
01:15:26,120 --> 01:15:29,157
What are you going to do
with all that money, Nick?

1151
01:15:36,480 --> 01:15:38,994
Well, l won't spend it
on futures and options!

1152
01:15:42,960 --> 01:15:44,916
- That's very good.
- Very good.

1153
01:15:51,800 --> 01:15:54,837
l was living from day to day,
hoping for a miracle.

1154
01:15:56,480 --> 01:16:00,359
l wasn't running a position any more.
The position was running me.

1155
01:16:01,960 --> 01:16:05,077
Man, look at the state you're in.
You got the bloody shakes!

1156
01:16:05,160 --> 01:16:07,799
- You been on the razz all night?
- Nah.

1157
01:16:07,880 --> 01:16:11,031
- l'm just getting killed by the market.
- Tell me about it!

1158
01:16:11,120 --> 01:16:13,111
l've had a shitty week too.

1159
01:16:15,640 --> 01:16:17,631
Penguin? You lucky sod!

1160
01:16:18,400 --> 01:16:20,356
Do you know how rare they are?

1161
01:16:20,440 --> 01:16:22,431
Do you know?

1162
01:16:26,600 --> 01:16:29,672
- lt ain't that bloody funny!
- Lucky Leeson(!)

1163
01:16:29,760 --> 01:16:32,513
You have it.
l'm not laughing at you, Bubble.

1164
01:16:34,360 --> 01:16:36,351
Fuck! Sorry.

1165
01:16:37,920 --> 01:16:41,276
'Ey-ey-ey-ey-ey!
You really are in a bad way, ain't ya?

1166
01:16:42,080 --> 01:16:43,911
What's the matter?

1167
01:16:46,560 --> 01:16:48,630
l have an unauthorised position.

1168
01:16:52,800 --> 01:16:54,791
Fuckin' hell.

1169
01:16:55,800 --> 01:16:57,199
How big?

1170
01:16:58,280 --> 01:17:00,271
Big enough to be a problem.

1171
01:17:01,800 --> 01:17:03,472
Poor bastard!

1172
01:17:03,560 --> 01:17:06,393
l can't say it comes as
a complete surprise.

1173
01:17:06,480 --> 01:17:08,710
- Does Lisa know?
- No, she'd kill me.

1174
01:17:09,600 --> 01:17:14,116
She's got enough on her plate. She's just
waiting for my bonus so we can go home!

1175
01:17:14,200 --> 01:17:16,191
So what are you gonna do?

1176
01:17:17,880 --> 01:17:22,237
Well... l just have to keep buying
futures to support the market.

1177
01:17:22,320 --> 01:17:27,474
lf it sticks at 18,000, my options are still in
the money - l could get the position back.

1178
01:17:27,560 --> 01:17:30,279
- l may even come out ahead.
- Nick...

1179
01:17:30,360 --> 01:17:32,316
You listen to me now, right.

1180
01:17:32,400 --> 01:17:34,391
You don't fight the market, man.

1181
01:17:34,480 --> 01:17:38,792
Even if you can make the margin calls,
what happens when the contracts expire?

1182
01:17:38,880 --> 01:17:42,509
The way the market's going,
your losses could be catastrophic!

1183
01:18:07,680 --> 01:18:10,399
Five for a thousand,
five for a thousand! Come on!

1184
01:18:10,480 --> 01:18:14,553
George, move this fuckin' market!
lf it stays below 18,000 we're dead!

1185
01:18:23,960 --> 01:18:25,951
Come on!

1186
01:18:43,000 --> 01:18:43,989
Nick.

1187
01:18:45,520 --> 01:18:47,829
- Nick!
- Tony.

1188
01:18:47,920 --> 01:18:51,390
Nick, l really need to go over
some of the figures with you.

1189
01:18:51,480 --> 01:18:53,471
Sure, Tony.

1190
01:18:57,400 --> 01:18:59,038
Back in a minute.

1191
01:19:02,720 --> 01:19:04,711
Seven for five! Seven for five!

1192
01:19:11,920 --> 01:19:13,638
l'm sorry. Money!

1193
01:20:00,440 --> 01:20:04,353
l'd thrown away countless more millions,
and it hadn't made a dent.

1194
01:20:04,440 --> 01:20:07,955
l was only one day from bonus day,
but the game was up.

1195
01:20:09,520 --> 01:20:11,511
l was beaten.

1196
01:20:48,840 --> 01:20:51,513
Oh, Nick, you're a bloody fool, aren't you?

1197
01:20:52,880 --> 01:20:57,351
Well, it's not the end of the world.
You've got your health, you've got me...

1198
01:20:57,440 --> 01:20:59,396
Shame about the bonus.

1199
01:20:59,480 --> 01:21:01,471
Sorry.

1200
01:21:02,080 --> 01:21:04,435
Slow down.
The video shop's on the next left.

1201
01:21:04,520 --> 01:21:06,670
- l wanna get our deposit back.
- Right.

1202
01:21:06,760 --> 01:21:08,910
We're gonna need it, darlin'.

1203
01:21:17,120 --> 01:21:19,111
(phone rings)

1204
01:21:23,680 --> 01:21:26,672
- Hello?
- (Baker) The positions have got bigger!

1205
01:21:26,760 --> 01:21:30,116
lf they aren't reduced
l'm coming out there to sort you out!

1206
01:21:30,200 --> 01:21:33,317
- You're very faint, Ron.
- And what's this rumour l hear?

1207
01:21:33,400 --> 01:21:35,709
There's a rumour that we're the customer.

1208
01:21:35,800 --> 01:21:37,870
Sorry, you're gonna have to speak up.

1209
01:21:37,960 --> 01:21:40,235
Tell me we're not the customer, Nick.

1210
01:21:40,320 --> 01:21:43,392
- l'm losing you, Ron.
- Nick! Nick, are you there?

1211
01:21:43,480 --> 01:21:45,471
Goodbye, Ron.

1212
01:21:48,640 --> 01:21:51,871
They wouldn't give me the full 200,
but l stood my ground and got 180.

1213
01:21:51,960 --> 01:21:53,951
Good girl.

1214
01:21:58,080 --> 01:21:59,672
Nick...!

1215
01:21:59,760 --> 01:22:01,751
(phone rings)

1216
01:22:27,960 --> 01:22:30,394
Excuse me, sir.
There's a phone call for you.

1217
01:22:30,480 --> 01:22:33,472
- Not now.
- lt's Peter Norris. He said it's urgent.

1218
01:22:33,560 --> 01:22:35,118
Oh. Thank you.

1219
01:22:35,200 --> 01:22:37,031
Would you excuse me?

1220
01:22:47,400 --> 01:22:48,719
Peter?

1221
01:22:48,800 --> 01:22:51,837
l'm sorry to drag you away
from your dinner party.

1222
01:22:52,840 --> 01:22:55,559
l'm afraid l've got some rather bad news.

1223
01:22:57,840 --> 01:23:02,311
By the time the shit hit the proverbial fan
in London we'd escaped Singapore...

1224
01:23:02,400 --> 01:23:05,358
..to ponder the future
and consider my options.

1225
01:23:05,440 --> 01:23:07,317
lf l had any.

1226
01:23:08,280 --> 01:23:10,271
What's gonna happen, Nick?

1227
01:23:11,000 --> 01:23:14,834
They must have got my fax and
closed down all the positions on Friday.

1228
01:23:14,920 --> 01:23:17,036
The market seems to be holding up OK.

1229
01:23:17,120 --> 01:23:19,270
But you're definitely out of a job?

1230
01:23:22,280 --> 01:23:26,319
lt could have been a lot worse,
but l still lost them a ton of money.

1231
01:23:28,280 --> 01:23:30,589
l'm starving! Think they do burgers here?

1232
01:23:30,680 --> 01:23:32,955
(laughs) No! You're not having a burger.

1233
01:23:33,040 --> 01:23:36,794
- That tummy of yours is driving me nuts.
- Don't stress me, wench!

1234
01:23:36,880 --> 01:23:38,438
(laughs)

1235
01:23:38,520 --> 01:23:40,511
l'll work it off in the gym.

1236
01:23:43,320 --> 01:23:45,311
Better still...

1237
01:23:48,840 --> 01:23:51,274
(kissing)

1238
01:23:51,360 --> 01:23:55,319
- Stop it. People are watching.
- So? l don't care. Come here, girl.

1239
01:24:00,600 --> 01:24:01,999
Jesus Christ, Lisa!

1240
01:24:03,840 --> 01:24:06,195
- Barings has gone bust!
- What?!

1241
01:24:08,480 --> 01:24:11,472
The Chancellor of the Exchequer
is trying to calm fears...

1242
01:24:11,560 --> 01:24:15,348
..sparked by the failure of Barings Bank.
ln a statement to Parliament...

1243
01:24:15,440 --> 01:24:19,149
..he denied reports that the British
banking system is about to collapse.

1244
01:24:19,240 --> 01:24:23,074
According to him, Barings'
failure is a unique situation,...

1245
01:24:23,160 --> 01:24:26,869
..which he blames on the actions
of a rogue trader in Singapore.

1246
01:24:26,960 --> 01:24:32,432
Estimates of potential losses range from
800 million to over one billion pounds.

1247
01:24:32,520 --> 01:24:36,638
There's no way of knowing how markets
will react when they reopen on Monday.

1248
01:24:36,720 --> 01:24:40,110
As the Bank of England tries to
put together a rescue package,...

1249
01:24:40,200 --> 01:24:44,637
..with the Sultan of Brunei rumoured
as a buyer, time may be running out...

1250
01:24:44,720 --> 01:24:48,235
..for one of Britain's most
venerable financial institutions.

1251
01:24:48,320 --> 01:24:50,595
Charles Samson, CNN, London.

1252
01:24:50,680 --> 01:24:52,671
(whispers) Fuck!

1253
01:24:53,640 --> 01:24:55,517
Oh, Nick!

1254
01:25:01,200 --> 01:25:03,156
How could you not tell me?

1255
01:25:03,240 --> 01:25:06,869
How could you have kept it hidden
for all this time, Nick?

1256
01:25:09,200 --> 01:25:11,156
You must have been through hell!

1257
01:25:11,240 --> 01:25:14,516
You would have marched me
straight into Simon Jones's office.

1258
01:25:14,600 --> 01:25:17,034
- Too bloody right!
- Then l'd have got fired,...

1259
01:25:17,120 --> 01:25:20,556
..and l couldn't have made the money
back. That's all l was gonna do.

1260
01:25:20,640 --> 01:25:22,835
No, but you were gambling.

1261
01:25:22,920 --> 01:25:26,356
That's what you were doing.
With other people's money.

1262
01:25:27,600 --> 01:25:29,750
l didn't want to let everyone down.

1263
01:25:31,440 --> 01:25:34,557
You, my dad, the girls in the office...

1264
01:25:37,400 --> 01:25:39,391
Even Ron bloody Baker!

1265
01:25:42,840 --> 01:25:45,559
Do you think they're all
gonna hate me now?

1266
01:25:45,640 --> 01:25:48,552
Well, l don't think you're
gonna be Mr Popular!

1267
01:25:51,920 --> 01:25:54,434
lt could easily have been
the other way, you know.

1268
01:25:55,480 --> 01:25:57,471
lt so nearly was.

1269
01:25:59,040 --> 01:26:01,031
Then l'd be a hero.

1270
01:26:03,040 --> 01:26:04,951
Oh...!

1271
01:26:05,040 --> 01:26:07,110
(whispers) Come here. Come here.

1272
01:26:11,120 --> 01:26:13,111
l still love ya. Mm?

1273
01:26:14,640 --> 01:26:17,677
- (whispers) l love you very much.
- l love you too.

1274
01:26:25,400 --> 01:26:29,075
Shall we see if l can do
something about that belly?

1275
01:26:29,160 --> 01:26:31,151
l see.

1276
01:26:32,440 --> 01:26:34,271
Yes, l understand.

1277
01:26:34,360 --> 01:26:36,476
No, of course.

1278
01:26:37,160 --> 01:26:39,355
Thank you again for your efforts.

1279
01:26:39,440 --> 01:26:40,839
Goodbye.

1280
01:26:43,600 --> 01:26:47,513
That was the Sultan of Brunei's office.
They have decided not to proceed.

1281
01:26:47,600 --> 01:26:51,912
They believe the risks are too great and
the time too short, in view of the need...

1282
01:26:52,000 --> 01:26:56,437
..to have a rescue package ready by the
time markets open again in the Far East.

1283
01:26:56,520 --> 01:26:58,511
ls there really no one else?

1284
01:26:59,160 --> 01:27:01,549
We've tried everyone. lt's hopeless.

1285
01:27:03,880 --> 01:27:07,759
l therefore have to inform you
that Barings is insolvent...

1286
01:27:07,840 --> 01:27:10,513
..and will go into immediate liquidation.

1287
01:27:10,600 --> 01:27:12,591
(sobs)

1288
01:27:17,040 --> 01:27:21,192
Peter Barings has gone on TV
and said there's been a conspiracy.

1289
01:27:21,280 --> 01:27:22,998
They've lost 800 million quid!

1290
01:27:23,080 --> 01:27:25,548
l lost nowhere near that.
lt was more like 300!

1291
01:27:25,640 --> 01:27:30,031
But Barings didn't do anything Friday.
Now the word's out, the market's crashed.

1292
01:27:30,120 --> 01:27:31,633
Bloody idiots!

1293
01:27:31,720 --> 01:27:33,711
They think you've run off on your yacht.

1294
01:27:33,800 --> 01:27:35,836
- What?!
- l know. But listen, mate.

1295
01:27:35,920 --> 01:27:39,356
You've got no friends here now,
so just get the fuck out of Asia.

1296
01:27:39,440 --> 01:27:42,193
Get back to London, Australia, anywhere.
Just get out.

1297
01:27:42,280 --> 01:27:43,838
We're tryin'.

1298
01:27:43,920 --> 01:27:47,276
Oi, Nick...
get yourself a good lawyer.

1299
01:27:47,360 --> 01:27:49,351
- Be lucky.
- Cheers, mate.

1300
01:27:50,080 --> 01:27:52,230
(Tannoy) Flight 1 87 to Hong Kong...

1301
01:27:52,320 --> 01:27:54,311
..leaving from gate two.

1302
01:27:56,720 --> 01:27:57,948
Fuck!

1303
01:28:05,480 --> 01:28:09,917
There's a manhunt all over Asia. They
think we're sailing around in our yacht!

1304
01:28:10,000 --> 01:28:13,549
- What bloody yacht?
- l know. What about the flights?

1305
01:28:13,640 --> 01:28:16,757
- There's one to London. Via Singapore.
- That's no good.

1306
01:28:16,840 --> 01:28:19,513
There's a flight to Frankfurt.
Via Abu Dhabi.

1307
01:28:19,600 --> 01:28:21,158
Let's take it.

1308
01:28:21,240 --> 01:28:22,912
And Lisa...

1309
01:28:23,000 --> 01:28:24,991
Pay cash.

1310
01:29:13,480 --> 01:29:15,596
- Newspaper, sir?
- No, thank you.

1311
01:29:15,680 --> 01:29:17,671
- Ma'am?
- Er... no, thanks.

1312
01:29:21,120 --> 01:29:23,156
Nick, take that thing off.

1313
01:29:23,240 --> 01:29:26,152
There's a guy over there lookin' at me.

1314
01:29:26,240 --> 01:29:28,708
l'm not surprised, with that bloody hat on!

1315
01:29:28,800 --> 01:29:33,191
Talk about conspicuous! You're
sticking out like a sore bloody thumb.

1316
01:29:34,600 --> 01:29:36,795
Did you say we stop at Abu Dhabi?

1317
01:29:36,880 --> 01:29:39,110
Yeah.

1318
01:29:39,200 --> 01:29:43,239
- That's where they cut your hands off.
- Oh, don't be ridiculous!

1319
01:29:44,080 --> 01:29:46,071
They just stone you.

1320
01:29:47,200 --> 01:29:49,430
What?

1321
01:29:49,520 --> 01:29:51,670
l'm sorry, but you've gotta laugh!

1322
01:29:53,840 --> 01:29:58,630
Poor old Barings, eh? That's what you get
for hiring the wrong sort of person.

1323
01:30:12,800 --> 01:30:15,268
That was when it hit me -

1324
01:30:15,360 --> 01:30:17,351
..the enormity of what l'd done.

1325
01:30:18,200 --> 01:30:22,034
Whatever happened, l knew things
were never gonna be the same again.

1326
01:30:22,120 --> 01:30:24,793
And l've never felt lonelier in all my life.

1327
01:30:33,880 --> 01:30:36,110
l love you, Lisa.

1328
01:30:36,200 --> 01:30:38,191
Whatever happens, l love you.

1329
01:30:38,840 --> 01:30:40,831
l love you too.

1330
01:30:41,800 --> 01:30:43,791
l've got to get back to London.

1331
01:30:44,520 --> 01:30:49,833
l couldn't stand being in jail in Singapore.
l couldn't stand it if l couldn't see you.

1332
01:30:54,920 --> 01:30:56,911
Jesus Christ, it's the police!

1333
01:30:57,000 --> 01:30:59,036
They must know l'm on the flight.

1334
01:30:59,120 --> 01:31:01,350
Well... no, not necessarily.

1335
01:31:02,240 --> 01:31:07,758
Due to our early arrival, passport control
will take place as you leave the plane.

1336
01:31:07,840 --> 01:31:09,910
Please have your documents ready.

1337
01:31:11,400 --> 01:31:12,515
See?

1338
01:31:16,080 --> 01:31:18,071
l'm scared, Lisa!

1339
01:31:19,640 --> 01:31:21,631
You be strong, OK?

1340
01:31:29,800 --> 01:31:31,199
Danke.

1341
01:31:32,280 --> 01:31:33,998
Pass, bitte.

1342
01:31:34,080 --> 01:31:36,753
Danke. Thank you.

1343
01:31:38,640 --> 01:31:40,631
Please show your passport.

1344
01:31:43,800 --> 01:31:45,677
Where is your man?

1345
01:31:47,600 --> 01:31:49,591
l'm her man.

1346
01:31:50,680 --> 01:31:52,671
(uproar)

1347
01:32:10,920 --> 01:32:14,117
250 bid on 100! 250 bid on 100! Come on!

1348
01:32:14,200 --> 01:32:18,034
Who wants some of that?
250 bid on 100! 250 bid on 100! Come on!

1349
01:32:23,240 --> 01:32:25,549
# Aria from Mozart's ''The Magic Flute''

1350
01:32:36,000 --> 01:32:39,356
And that's it, more or less.
That's the end of my story.

1351
01:32:41,680 --> 01:32:46,390
Barings was eventually sold to the Dutch
bank lNG for the princely sum of 1.

1352
01:32:48,800 --> 01:32:52,315
Lisa's got a new life as a flight
attendant for Virgin Atlantic.

1353
01:32:52,400 --> 01:32:54,595
l hear she's got herself a new fella.

1354
01:32:56,400 --> 01:33:00,109
As for me, l fought unsuccessfully
against extradition...

1355
01:33:00,200 --> 01:33:05,194
..from Frankfurt to Singapore on charges
of fraud, forgery and breach of trust.

1356
01:33:07,320 --> 01:33:10,312
l was sentenced to
six and a half years in prison.

1357
01:33:11,200 --> 01:33:14,795
Despite rumours of secret
bank accounts and hidden millions,...

1358
01:33:14,880 --> 01:33:18,395
..l did not profit personally
from my unlawful trading.

1359
01:33:19,840 --> 01:33:22,195
To be absolutely honest,...

1360
01:33:22,280 --> 01:33:24,271
..sometimes l wish l had.

1361
01:33:56,280 --> 01:34:02,071
# l've got something to say

1362
01:34:06,880 --> 01:34:12,989
# We have come a long way

1363
01:34:17,760 --> 01:34:26,031
# After all the things
that we have been through

1364
01:34:28,040 --> 01:34:33,637
# l'm glad still to have you

1365
01:34:38,800 --> 01:34:43,476
# l know you're hurtin'

1366
01:34:43,560 --> 01:34:48,634
# And though you're hurtin'

1367
01:34:48,720 --> 01:34:53,589
# lt will get better every day

1368
01:34:58,240 --> 01:35:04,236
# l love all that you are

1369
01:35:08,440 --> 01:35:14,436
# You are what l live for

1370
01:35:18,680 --> 01:35:26,712
# After all the things
that we have been through

1371
01:35:28,600 --> 01:35:34,709
# l'm glad still to have you

1372
01:35:39,480 --> 01:35:44,270
# l know you're hurtin'

1373
01:35:44,360 --> 01:35:49,354
# And though you're hurtin'

1374
01:35:49,440 --> 01:35:54,594
# lt will get better every day

1375
01:37:05,480 --> 01:37:07,630
Visiontext subtitles: Paul Sofer

title: TheBigShort
script:
1
00:00:19,900 --> 00:00:24,900
Cleaned, corrected and OCR issues fixed by Tronar

2
00:01:20,857 --> 00:01:23,193
Hiya, Frank. How are the wife and kids?

3
00:01:23,276 --> 00:01:24,559
You know, for you, I'm considering

4
00:01:24,569 --> 00:01:28,281
treasury bonds
and utility stocks. Smoke?

5
00:01:28,364 --> 00:01:30,450
In the late '70s, banking wasn't a job

6
00:01:30,533 --> 00:01:33,036
you went into
to make large sums of money.

7
00:01:33,953 --> 00:01:35,663
It was a fucking snooze.

8
00:01:35,747 --> 00:01:37,540
How about those Mats'?

9
00:01:37,624 --> 00:01:40,293
Filled with losers.
Like selling insurance or

10
00:01:40,376 --> 00:01:41,711
accounting.

11
00:01:41,794 --> 00:01:42,921
And if banking was boring,

12
00:01:43,046 --> 00:01:45,715
then the bond department at the bank
was straight-up comatose.

13
00:01:46,549 --> 00:01:47,926
We all know about bonds.

14
00:01:48,009 --> 00:01:50,129
You give them to your
snot-nosed kid when he turns 15.

15
00:01:50,178 --> 00:01:52,180
Maybe when he's 30
he makes a hundred bucks.

16
00:01:52,263 --> 00:01:53,556
Boring.

17
00:01:53,640 --> 00:01:55,440
That is, until Lewis Ranieri
came on the scene

18
00:01:55,517 --> 00:01:56,559
at Salomon Brothers.

19
00:02:02,524 --> 00:02:04,734
You might not know who he is,
but he changed your life

20
00:02:04,817 --> 00:02:08,571
more than Michael Jordan, the iPod
and YouTube put together.

21
00:02:10,448 --> 00:02:12,273
All right, gentlemen!
Let's get some money in here!

22
00:02:12,283 --> 00:02:15,787
Let's make some money!
What do you say?

23
00:02:15,870 --> 00:02:17,705
You see, Lewis didn't know it yet,

24
00:02:17,789 --> 00:02:19,707
but he had already
changed banking forever

25
00:02:19,791 --> 00:02:21,000
with one simple idea.

26
00:02:21,793 --> 00:02:26,464
The mortgage-backed security.
Or private-label MBS.

27
00:02:27,298 --> 00:02:29,133
You've got your
average person's mortgage.

28
00:02:29,217 --> 00:02:30,635
Fixed rate, 30 years.

29
00:02:30,718 --> 00:02:34,055
Boring, safe, small payoff, right? But,

30
00:02:35,348 --> 00:02:38,059
when you have thousands
of them all bundled together,

31
00:02:38,142 --> 00:02:41,688
suddenly the yield goes up
but the risk is still small because,

32
00:02:41,771 --> 00:02:42,731
well, they're mortgages!

33
00:02:42,814 --> 00:02:44,305
And who the hell
doesn't pay their mortgage?

34
00:02:44,315 --> 00:02:46,693
What exactly is the credit
rating on this bond?

35
00:02:46,776 --> 00:02:49,612
This bond, gentlemen, is AAA-rated.

36
00:02:50,154 --> 00:02:53,074
This is exactly what the Michigan state
pension fund has been looking for.

37
00:02:53,324 --> 00:02:54,826
I'll buy $20 million.

38
00:02:54,909 --> 00:02:57,370
- Oh, come on, live a little.
- $25 million.

39
00:02:57,912 --> 00:03:00,873
The money came raining down,

40
00:03:00,957 --> 00:03:02,458
and for the first time,

41
00:03:02,542 --> 00:03:05,336
the banker went
from the country club to the strip club.

42
00:03:07,964 --> 00:03:11,175
Pretty soon, stocks and savings
were almost inconsequential.

43
00:03:11,342 --> 00:03:13,511
They were doing $50, $100, $200 billion

44
00:03:13,595 --> 00:03:17,557
in mortgage bonds
and dozens of other securities a year.

45
00:03:25,857 --> 00:03:28,151
And America barely noticed
as its number one industry

46
00:03:28,234 --> 00:03:30,320
became boring old banking.

47
00:03:33,990 --> 00:03:37,493
And then one day,
almost 30 years later, in 2008,

48
00:03:38,703 --> 00:03:40,455
it all came crashing down.

49
00:03:43,583 --> 00:03:46,336
March. Bear Stearns
was in a death spiral

50
00:03:46,419 --> 00:03:47,837
and the Fed brokered its sale.

51
00:03:47,920 --> 00:03:50,965
It's been called the worst financial crisis
in modern times.

52
00:03:51,299 --> 00:03:55,553
Certainly the largest financial disaster
in decades in this country,

53
00:03:55,637 --> 00:03:58,306
and perhaps the end of an era
in American business.

54
00:03:58,765 --> 00:04:01,017
In the end, Lewis Ranieri's
mortgage-backed security

55
00:04:01,100 --> 00:04:04,562
mutated into a monstrosity that
collapsed the whole world economy.

56
00:04:05,104 --> 00:04:07,190
And none of the experts
or leaders or talking heads

57
00:04:07,273 --> 00:04:08,566
had a clue it was coming.

58
00:04:10,068 --> 00:04:13,029
I'm guessing most of you
still don't really know what happened.

59
00:04:13,529 --> 00:04:16,397
Yeah, you got a soundbite you repeat
so you don't sound dumb, but come on.

60
00:04:16,407 --> 00:04:19,118
Our financial institutions are strong.

61
00:04:20,078 --> 00:04:22,497
But there were some
who saw it coming.

62
00:04:22,580 --> 00:04:24,666
While the whole world
was having a big old party,

63
00:04:24,749 --> 00:04:28,002
a few outsiders and weirdos
saw what no one else could.

64
00:04:28,086 --> 00:04:31,673
Not me. I'm not a weirdo.
I'm pretty fucking cool.

65
00:04:31,756 --> 00:04:33,758
But we'll meet again later.

66
00:04:34,258 --> 00:04:37,011
These outsiders saw the giant lie
at the heart of the economy.

67
00:04:37,095 --> 00:04:38,513
And they saw it by doing something

68
00:04:38,596 --> 00:04:41,391
the rest of the suckers
never thought to do.

69
00:04:42,308 --> 00:04:43,643
They looked.

70
00:04:56,447 --> 00:04:58,783
During the 1930s,

71
00:05:00,410 --> 00:05:05,081
the housing market
collapsed nationwide

72
00:05:06,457 --> 00:05:08,584
by roughly 80%.

73
00:05:08,668 --> 00:05:13,798
I mean, half of all mortgage debt
was in default.

74
00:05:13,881 --> 00:05:16,551
And, I mean, there were very

75
00:05:17,677 --> 00:05:21,180
specific identifiers,
extremely recognizable.

76
00:05:24,100 --> 00:05:25,143
I mean, for instance,

77
00:05:25,268 --> 00:05:28,479
one of the hallmarks of mania

78
00:05:28,813 --> 00:05:30,148
is the rapid rise

79
00:05:30,273 --> 00:05:32,316
in complexity and the rates of fraud.

80
00:05:32,400 --> 00:05:35,820
And did you know that they're going up?

81
00:05:55,339 --> 00:05:57,258
I've always been

82
00:05:57,341 --> 00:05:59,343
more comfortable alone.

83
00:06:06,642 --> 00:06:11,272
I believe maybe
it's because of my glass eye.

84
00:06:13,691 --> 00:06:16,486
I lost the eye in a childhood illness.

85
00:06:20,823 --> 00:06:23,159
It separates me from people.

86
00:06:27,205 --> 00:06:29,582
And did you know that they are going

87
00:06:29,665 --> 00:06:30,792
Up?

88
00:06:30,875 --> 00:06:34,378
The highest fraud rates since the 1930s.

89
00:06:34,462 --> 00:06:36,798
Hey, hey, it's okay. It's okay.

90
00:06:36,881 --> 00:06:38,841
No, I didn't know that.

91
00:06:43,054 --> 00:06:47,225
In 1933, the fourth year
of the Great Depression.

92
00:06:47,391 --> 00:06:49,060
Let's wash it off and put it back in.

93
00:06:49,143 --> 00:06:51,103
You were playing so great, son.

94
00:06:51,229 --> 00:06:53,231
I even heard the coach say it.

95
00:06:54,398 --> 00:06:56,651
Can we just go home?

96
00:06:56,734 --> 00:07:00,905
Most social interactions
are awkward for me and for the person.

97
00:07:00,988 --> 00:07:04,492
Even when I try
to compliment someone,

98
00:07:04,575 --> 00:07:05,952
it comes out wrong.

99
00:07:06,869 --> 00:07:10,456
You have a very nice haircut.
Did you do it yourself?

100
00:07:11,374 --> 00:07:12,542
What?

101
00:07:12,625 --> 00:07:15,127
No. No, I...

102
00:07:23,761 --> 00:07:25,596
I'm sorry. I'm just...

103
00:07:31,310 --> 00:07:32,478
I'm going on and on.

104
00:07:32,603 --> 00:07:34,313
My wife told me I need to share more.

105
00:07:36,274 --> 00:07:38,109
- That seems healthy.
- Yeah.

106
00:07:50,913 --> 00:07:52,290
So do I get the job?

107
00:07:52,415 --> 00:07:54,750
I really think I could help your fund.

108
00:07:56,127 --> 00:07:57,503
Yeah.

109
00:07:57,587 --> 00:07:59,213
Yeah, sure. Go on.

110
00:08:01,924 --> 00:08:05,177
- You're...
- David. Great.

111
00:08:05,261 --> 00:08:07,096
I guess I'll go find a desk.

112
00:08:07,179 --> 00:08:09,765
Is there anything you want me
to work on for start...

113
00:08:12,810 --> 00:08:14,186
Yeah.

114
00:08:14,270 --> 00:08:16,110
You could let me know later.
I could come back.

115
00:08:18,691 --> 00:08:23,237
Did you think it was strange when

116
00:08:23,321 --> 00:08:25,823
the tech bubble burst in 2001

117
00:08:25,907 --> 00:08:28,701
and the housing market in San Jose,

118
00:08:28,784 --> 00:08:30,995
the tech capital of the world,

119
00:08:32,496 --> 00:08:34,248
Went up?

120
00:08:34,332 --> 00:08:36,375
- Wasn't that strange?
- No.

121
00:08:36,459 --> 00:08:39,086
No, it's housing.
Housing is always stable.

122
00:08:39,170 --> 00:08:40,212
Low risk. It's solid.

123
00:08:40,296 --> 00:08:42,256
That's the idea, yeah.

124
00:08:42,340 --> 00:08:44,091
I want you to get me

125
00:08:44,175 --> 00:08:47,386
the top 20 selling mortgage bonds.

126
00:08:47,470 --> 00:08:50,306
So you want to know what the top 20
selling mortgage bonds are?

127
00:08:50,389 --> 00:08:54,727
No, no, no, I want to know
what mortgages are in each one.

128
00:08:56,145 --> 00:08:59,106
Okay, aren't those
mortgages made up of...

129
00:08:59,190 --> 00:09:00,650
Wait, aren't those bonds made up

130
00:09:00,733 --> 00:09:02,777
of thousands and thousands
of mortgages?

131
00:09:02,860 --> 00:09:04,320
Yeah.

132
00:09:08,366 --> 00:09:09,867
Right away, Dr. Burry.

133
00:09:28,928 --> 00:09:33,265
I am a nice guy all day long.

134
00:09:33,349 --> 00:09:36,018
Ask anyone, I'm a pleasure to work with.

135
00:09:37,937 --> 00:09:42,274
But the second my son
screws up, I am...

136
00:09:42,942 --> 00:09:45,444
...yelling at him
just like my dad did to me.

137
00:09:48,781 --> 00:09:51,492
I hear the words that are
coming out of my mouth and...

138
00:09:51,575 --> 00:09:54,370
Sorry I'm late! No cabs.

139
00:09:56,539 --> 00:09:58,124
So, get this.

140
00:09:58,874 --> 00:10:01,377
I met with this retail banker yesterday.

141
00:10:01,627 --> 00:10:04,046
I'm supposed to be getting him
to invest in a fund,

142
00:10:04,130 --> 00:10:05,464
but instead

143
00:10:05,548 --> 00:10:08,426
I start grilling him about
overdraft penalties

144
00:10:08,509 --> 00:10:11,512
and how his bank will let
a customer write 10-12 checks

145
00:10:11,595 --> 00:10:12,920
before they tell them they're overdrawn.

146
00:10:12,930 --> 00:10:16,851
And this creep is making billions off
screwing over people this way.

147
00:10:16,934 --> 00:10:18,728
And I'm getting madder and madder.

148
00:10:18,811 --> 00:10:22,189
And I ask him,
I look him in the face and I say,

149
00:10:22,273 --> 00:10:24,108
"How can you sleep at night"

150
00:10:24,608 --> 00:10:28,070
"knowing that you are
ripping off working people?"

151
00:10:28,154 --> 00:10:29,864
And you know what he did? He left.

152
00:10:29,947 --> 00:10:32,658
He just walks out of the lunch,
doesn't say a word.

153
00:10:32,742 --> 00:10:33,743
What the fuck is that?

154
00:10:33,826 --> 00:10:36,162
Who's fucked up in that scenario? Am I?

155
00:10:36,245 --> 00:10:38,706
Or is this douchebag,
who leaves me hanging?

156
00:10:38,789 --> 00:10:40,041
Is he the fucked up one?

157
00:10:40,124 --> 00:10:42,918
We have talked about
this numerous times.

158
00:10:43,002 --> 00:10:46,130
You can't come in late
and hijack the entire session.

159
00:10:46,213 --> 00:10:47,747
What do you mean?
I didn't hijack the meeting.

160
00:10:47,757 --> 00:10:50,092
- Did I hijack the session?
- Yeah.

161
00:10:50,551 --> 00:10:53,012
- What do you do?
- I'm in commodities.

162
00:10:53,095 --> 00:10:54,388
Good luck with that.

163
00:10:54,472 --> 00:10:58,059
Mark, I know
you suffered a terrible loss.

164
00:10:58,142 --> 00:10:59,560
Maybe you want to talk about that.

165
00:10:59,643 --> 00:11:00,686
I don't talk about that.

166
00:11:00,770 --> 00:11:02,188
Hold on.

167
00:11:02,271 --> 00:11:03,606
Hold on...

168
00:11:03,689 --> 00:11:06,525
Shit, I have to take this. Sorry. Sorry.

169
00:11:07,443 --> 00:11:09,570
No... I don't care, Porter.

170
00:11:09,653 --> 00:11:11,312
This guy's whole business
is built on ripping people off.

171
00:11:11,322 --> 00:11:12,865
How long can that last?

172
00:11:14,366 --> 00:11:15,534
Bye, everybody!

173
00:11:16,619 --> 00:11:18,287
95...

174
00:11:18,537 --> 00:11:20,664
That's 30 days late... Sixty days late...

175
00:11:23,125 --> 00:11:25,628
They pay on time...

176
00:11:28,506 --> 00:11:30,132
These FICO scores...

177
00:11:35,846 --> 00:11:38,849
Late. And they caught up
on their payments...

178
00:11:38,933 --> 00:11:40,434
Another 30 days late...

179
00:11:40,518 --> 00:11:43,771
