...rolled out of Mary Thomajan's fax machine.

939
00:45:40,074 --> 00:45:42,492
The fax was from the small feeder fund...

940
00:45:42,536 --> 00:45:44,994
...she had trusted for 18 years...

941
00:45:45,039 --> 00:45:46,662
...telling her that all her money...

942
00:45:46,706 --> 00:45:49,081
...had been invested with Madoff,

943
00:45:49,126 --> 00:45:51,126
...who had been arrested.

944
00:45:52,295 --> 00:45:54,213
She later recalled,

945
00:45:54,255 --> 00:45:57,048
"In the 50 seconds it took
to read that fax,"

946
00:45:57,092 --> 00:45:59,717
"I went from being
a multi-millionaire..."

947
00:45:59,762 --> 00:46:02,720
"...to having my life savings wiped out..."

948
00:46:02,764 --> 00:46:06,474
"...and life as I knew it
altered forever."

949
00:46:09,188 --> 00:46:12,063
Robert Halio's son called him
at his retirement home...

950
00:46:12,106 --> 00:46:14,148
...in Boca Raton with the news.

951
00:46:14,193 --> 00:46:15,983
It's all gone, Dad.

952
00:46:16,028 --> 00:46:19,153
I don't...
I don't know what to do.

953
00:46:19,197 --> 00:46:20,947
95% of his wealth...

954
00:46:20,990 --> 00:46:25,159
...had been entrusted to Madoff
and was now gone.

955
00:46:25,204 --> 00:46:27,036
Mr. De la Villehuchet...

956
00:46:27,081 --> 00:46:29,831
...had written his brother a letter that said,

957
00:46:29,874 --> 00:46:32,918
"If you ruin your friends,
your clients,"

958
00:46:32,961 --> 00:46:35,420
"...you have to face the consequences."

959
00:46:35,463 --> 00:46:37,297
He then positioned a trash basket...

960
00:46:37,340 --> 00:46:39,215
...to protect the carpet...

961
00:46:39,260 --> 00:46:41,842
...and slit his wrist with a box cutter.

962
00:46:41,887 --> 00:46:45,347
Tim Murray,
a property manager in Minnesota,

963
00:46:45,391 --> 00:46:47,807
...was traveling
and nearly drove off the road...

964
00:46:47,851 --> 00:46:50,269
Fort Lauderdale...

965
00:46:51,981 --> 00:46:54,273
- Richard Freedman...
- David Iselin...

966
00:47:12,293 --> 00:47:14,458
Time to pay the piper, Bernie.

967
00:47:14,503 --> 00:47:17,378
Presumably...

968
00:47:17,423 --> 00:47:20,798
...presumably with the life
savings of another piper.

969
00:47:20,842 --> 00:47:21,882
Just...

970
00:47:21,927 --> 00:47:24,385
This was the worst pyramid scheme...

971
00:47:24,429 --> 00:47:27,889
...since the actual pyramids.

972
00:47:27,932 --> 00:47:30,745
- Ruth loves to go to the California Pizza Kitchen.
- Yeah.

973
00:47:30,769 --> 00:47:32,428
And they say that her favorite dish there...

974
00:47:32,438 --> 00:47:34,353
...is the veal Scallo-Ponzi.

975
00:47:36,775 --> 00:47:39,143
Listen, I have something to tell
you that's really important.

976
00:47:39,153 --> 00:47:41,193
I have your money!
I can get it to you.

977
00:47:43,740 --> 00:47:45,900
Okay, I guess you're not there.

978
00:47:47,577 --> 00:47:50,202
They can see right in.

979
00:47:50,246 --> 00:47:52,414
- They can see right in.
- What?

980
00:47:52,458 --> 00:47:55,333
We... we don't have any curtains.

981
00:47:55,376 --> 00:47:57,501
They can see right in.

982
00:47:57,545 --> 00:47:59,795
Hold on, let me call you back.

983
00:47:59,840 --> 00:48:02,373
- Catherine, it's gonna be fine.
- No, they're gonna be looking in...

984
00:48:02,383 --> 00:48:04,300
...with their long lenses
and we'll be trapped.

985
00:48:04,344 --> 00:48:07,720
They're gonna get bored
just standing around.

986
00:48:07,764 --> 00:48:09,806
I'm not the story.

987
00:48:09,849 --> 00:48:12,224
We've gotta get curtains
right now.

988
00:48:40,213 --> 00:48:42,755
Shit.

989
00:48:50,391 --> 00:48:52,349
Hi, how are you?

990
00:48:52,393 --> 00:48:54,059
I'm all right.

991
00:48:54,103 --> 00:48:55,601
You?

992
00:48:55,646 --> 00:48:57,396
I've been better.

993
00:48:58,898 --> 00:49:01,608
I'll bet.

994
00:49:13,371 --> 00:49:15,246
- Mommy, Mommy.
- What?

995
00:49:15,289 --> 00:49:18,999
- Is that Ruth Madoff?
- Jessica, not another word.

996
00:49:19,043 --> 00:49:20,836
It's okay.

997
00:49:22,172 --> 00:49:25,132
No, none of it is.

998
00:49:45,153 --> 00:49:47,112
There she is.

999
00:50:03,547 --> 00:50:05,380
- Hi, Sarah.
- Oh, hi.

1000
00:50:05,423 --> 00:50:07,090
Is Gisele here?
I was wondering...

1001
00:50:07,133 --> 00:50:09,008
...if she might be able to fit me in today.

1002
00:50:09,052 --> 00:50:11,927
I haven't had my hair colored
in God knows how long.

1003
00:50:11,972 --> 00:50:14,054
- Um, I think she's...
- You know, don't worry.

1004
00:50:14,099 --> 00:50:16,016
- I'll find her.
- Uh...

1005
00:50:21,273 --> 00:50:25,065
I've been coming here for 15 years, Pierre.

1006
00:50:25,110 --> 00:50:27,360
I understand.

1007
00:50:28,447 --> 00:50:30,197
We have too many clients...

1008
00:50:30,240 --> 00:50:32,320
...who have lost their money
because of your husband.

1009
00:50:33,327 --> 00:50:35,911
But I don't trust anyone else.

1010
00:50:37,246 --> 00:50:38,829
I'm very sorry,

1011
00:50:38,874 --> 00:50:43,710
...but I can't afford to
risk my reputation.

1012
00:50:46,840 --> 00:50:48,298
What about a house call?

1013
00:50:48,342 --> 00:50:49,925
I can pay extra.

1014
00:50:51,177 --> 00:50:53,094
- I'm sorry...
- Pierre.

1015
00:50:53,137 --> 00:50:55,889
...but I have to ask you to leave now.

1016
00:50:55,932 --> 00:50:57,891
I'm sorry, Ruth.

1017
00:51:05,316 --> 00:51:06,775
- Shit.
- Ruth!

1018
00:51:06,818 --> 00:51:09,735
- What are you doing?
- Nothing!

1019
00:51:09,780 --> 00:51:11,530
What are you doing?

1020
00:51:11,572 --> 00:51:13,949
- Looking for something?
- My lighter.

1021
00:51:15,577 --> 00:51:17,151
Well, aren't there matches in the drawer?

1022
00:51:17,161 --> 00:51:19,119
- No.
- No? What do you mean?

1023
00:51:19,164 --> 00:51:21,239
- There's always matches in the drawer.
- Well, we're out.

1024
00:51:21,249 --> 00:51:23,083
Where'd you last see it?

1025
00:51:23,126 --> 00:51:24,668
If I knew where I last saw it,

1026
00:51:24,711 --> 00:51:26,836
I wouldn't be looking for it, Bernie.

1027
00:51:32,010 --> 00:51:33,802
I'm such an idiot.

1028
00:51:33,845 --> 00:51:35,427
How did I get to be this age...

1029
00:51:35,472 --> 00:51:39,014
...without doing anything on my own?

1030
00:51:39,059 --> 00:51:40,516
What are you talking about?

1031
00:51:40,561 --> 00:51:42,978
I... I didn't do anything, Bernie.

1032
00:51:43,021 --> 00:51:45,688
I never did one thing on my own.

1033
00:51:45,731 --> 00:51:48,900
I... I don't have a career,
I don't have a name,

1034
00:51:48,943 --> 00:51:52,028
I don't... I don't have
any friends of my own.

1035
00:51:52,072 --> 00:51:54,489
The only thing I have are regrets.

1036
00:51:54,532 --> 00:51:56,949
That's all I got to show for myself.

1037
00:51:56,994 --> 00:52:00,911
- Regret after regret.
- Ruth, do we have to go into this now?

1038
00:52:00,956 --> 00:52:02,831
I got a lot on my mind.

1039
00:52:02,874 --> 00:52:05,333
I'm going away and who knows
if I'm going to come back.

1040
00:52:05,376 --> 00:52:08,670
- Why would you say that?
- I'm not saying for certain...

1041
00:52:08,713 --> 00:52:11,840
- No, Ike said that you'd be able to...
- Forget I mentioned it.

1042
00:52:11,883 --> 00:52:13,382
You can't do that.

1043
00:52:13,427 --> 00:52:15,050
I'm not ready.

1044
00:52:15,094 --> 00:52:17,262
I... I'm, I'm not ready to be alone.

1045
00:52:17,306 --> 00:52:19,054
You're all I have.

1046
00:52:19,099 --> 00:52:20,974
The boys don't speak to me.

1047
00:52:21,018 --> 00:52:22,391
No one speaks to me.

1048
00:52:22,436 --> 00:52:25,561
I'll...
I'll go crazy, Bernie.

1049
00:52:25,606 --> 00:52:30,025
I'll... I'll go crazy all alone.

1050
00:52:30,068 --> 00:52:33,360
I'll go crazy, Bernie, I will.

1051
00:53:08,023 --> 00:53:09,459
Hi.

1052
00:53:09,483 --> 00:53:11,273
Leave a message after the tone.

1053
00:53:11,318 --> 00:53:13,818
Bernie!

1054
00:53:13,862 --> 00:53:15,570
Bernie, you there?

1055
00:53:15,614 --> 00:53:18,030
Bernie?
Come on, pick up.

1056
00:53:18,074 --> 00:53:19,774
I know you're hiding that 50 billion somewhere,

1057
00:53:19,784 --> 00:53:22,202
...you piece-of-shit cocksucker.

1058
00:53:22,244 --> 00:53:24,279
I hope you enjoy getting your
ass raped every night,

1059
00:53:24,289 --> 00:53:26,246
'cause you're going away for a long time.

1060
00:53:26,291 --> 00:53:28,291
Hasta la vista, you kike motherfucker.

1061
00:53:32,088 --> 00:53:33,463
What are you doing?

1062
00:53:33,507 --> 00:53:35,048
I can't live like this.

1063
00:53:35,092 --> 00:53:37,132
Slogging through,

1064
00:53:37,177 --> 00:53:38,969
...being miserable to no good end.

1065
00:53:39,012 --> 00:53:40,970
What's the point?

1066
00:53:41,014 --> 00:53:42,889
You know, I was thinking earlier...

1067
00:53:42,932 --> 00:53:45,349
...this... this isn't even about me.

1068
00:53:46,853 --> 00:53:48,269
This country needs a villain,

1069
00:53:48,313 --> 00:53:50,229
...someone to send to the gallows...

1070
00:53:50,273 --> 00:53:53,273
...so everyone can feel okay
about living under a rigged system.

1071
00:53:53,318 --> 00:53:56,152
I don't give a rat's ass, Bernie.

1072
00:53:56,195 --> 00:53:58,530
Well, it'll be better once I go.

1073
00:53:59,824 --> 00:54:01,324
What's with the jewelry?

1074
00:54:01,367 --> 00:54:03,450
It's the only thing the court didn't freeze.

1075
00:54:03,494 --> 00:54:05,119
I'm gonna wrap it all up,

1076
00:54:05,162 --> 00:54:07,789
...give it to family,

1077
00:54:07,833 --> 00:54:09,081
...and then kill myself.

1078
00:54:09,126 --> 00:54:11,501
Why would you kill yourself?

1079
00:54:11,545 --> 00:54:14,461
Because I'm tired of being hated.

1080
00:54:14,505 --> 00:54:16,255
I don't even understand it.

1081
00:54:16,298 --> 00:54:19,342
I...
you got yourself into trouble.

1082
00:54:19,385 --> 00:54:21,335
You couldn't get out.
What do I have to do with it?

1083
00:54:21,345 --> 00:54:22,887
Why does the world hate me?

1084
00:54:22,931 --> 00:54:25,264
They all think I'm some kind of a mastermind.

1085
00:54:25,307 --> 00:54:27,099
Take it as a compliment, Ruth.

1086
00:54:27,144 --> 00:54:29,936
They say all these
horrible things about me.

1087
00:54:29,979 --> 00:54:32,604
They say
I... I was your bookkeeper.

1088
00:54:32,648 --> 00:54:34,815
- They say...
- You weren't my bookkeeper.

1089
00:54:34,860 --> 00:54:37,027
I did maintain the records the first year.

1090
00:54:37,070 --> 00:54:39,570
That was in 1960.
It was just you and me.

1091
00:54:39,614 --> 00:54:41,697
I mean, but you weren't even a real bookkeeper.

1092
00:54:41,742 --> 00:54:44,026
No, but I'm just saying don't make
it seem like I didn't pitch in...

1093
00:54:44,036 --> 00:54:46,327
...because I even came back, remember?

1094
00:54:46,371 --> 00:54:48,696
- Yeah, but then we hired a real bookkeeper.
- And I helped with payroll.

1095
00:54:48,706 --> 00:54:51,073
- We hired a real bookkeeper.
- Right, so why are they making it seem...

1096
00:54:51,083 --> 00:54:53,543
...like I...
like, I'm involved with all this stuff?

1097
00:54:53,586 --> 00:54:55,503
Because they're out for blood, honey.

1098
00:54:55,547 --> 00:54:57,672
That's why.
They just wanna...

1099
00:54:57,715 --> 00:55:00,550
But anybody in the know knows
you weren't the mastermind.

1100
00:55:00,594 --> 00:55:02,342
- That's nonsense.
- Oh, well, thanks.

1101
00:55:02,387 --> 00:55:03,677
I already wanna kill myself.

1102
00:55:03,722 --> 00:55:05,429
Are you trying to make me feel worse?

1103
00:55:05,474 --> 00:55:08,224
No, but I...

1104
00:55:08,268 --> 00:55:10,309
You, uh...

1105
00:55:10,353 --> 00:55:12,478
...you'd commit suicide?

1106
00:55:14,690 --> 00:55:16,315
With what?

1107
00:55:18,153 --> 00:55:21,570
I don't know. I haven't figured that part out yet.

1108
00:55:21,615 --> 00:55:24,157
Something nice.
Maybe Ambien.

1109
00:55:26,911 --> 00:55:28,744
How much Ambien do we have?

1110
00:55:28,789 --> 00:55:31,539
Enough to open a fucking pharmacy.

1111
00:55:58,150 --> 00:56:01,068
What about these?
Klonopin?

1112
00:56:01,112 --> 00:56:03,862
Same thing.
Just put it in here.

1113
00:56:17,670 --> 00:56:20,420
Do have yourself a merry little Christmas.

1114
00:56:20,465 --> 00:56:22,965
It's a great song and you'll be
hearing Judy Garland sing it...

1115
00:56:23,008 --> 00:56:25,385
Can't we just have quiet?

1116
00:56:25,427 --> 00:56:28,470
I can't fall asleep unless I watch something.

1117
00:56:28,514 --> 00:56:31,599
You just took a whole
fucking bottle

1118
00:56:31,643 --> 00:56:32,976
...of Ambien, Bernie.

1119
00:56:33,019 --> 00:56:35,061
Sleep's not gonna be your problem.

1120
00:56:35,104 --> 00:56:37,646
My mind races.

1121
00:56:37,690 --> 00:56:39,190
Fine.

come on. Get in.

563
00:54:13,445 --> 00:54:17,438
I'm going to get to the bottom of this.
This has been a grave mistake.

564
00:54:18,075 --> 00:54:21,067
Hey, that looks just like
the dude that had me busted.

565
00:54:21,329 --> 00:54:23,240
Sir?

566
00:54:23,457 --> 00:54:26,369
Right there,
he looked just like the mother

567
00:54:26,627 --> 00:54:29,903
I mean, he looks just like
the gentleman that had me busted.

568
00:54:30,673 --> 00:54:32,425
To whom are you referring, sir?

569
00:54:32,634 --> 00:54:34,431
The dude right there.

570
00:54:36,430 --> 00:54:38,898
- Right over there.
- That's my car.

571
00:54:39,141 --> 00:54:43,180
Coleman!
Coleman, that's my car!

572
00:54:43,480 --> 00:54:46,870
That's my car! That's my driver.

573
00:54:52,698 --> 00:54:54,893
There's some strange shit
going on here, Coleman.

574
00:54:55,952 --> 00:54:58,420
You don't want
to be late for your first day, sir.

575
00:55:06,214 --> 00:55:08,569
What do they want me to do here?

576
00:55:08,800 --> 00:55:12,349
- I'm sure they'll tell you.
- What if I can't do it?

577
00:55:13,389 --> 00:55:15,380
Just be yourself, sir.

578
00:55:15,600 --> 00:55:19,070
Whatever happens,
they can't take that away from you.

579
00:55:35,164 --> 00:55:37,758
- Excuse me, my name is
- Mr Valentine.

580
00:55:38,000 --> 00:55:40,468
They're waiting in the last office
down the hall.

581
00:56:02,987 --> 00:56:07,777
- Ah, William, my boy. Right on time.
- Come in, come in.

582
00:56:10,496 --> 00:56:12,487
Sit down.

583
00:56:15,418 --> 00:56:18,216
No thanks, guys.
I already had breakfast.

584
00:56:18,463 --> 00:56:21,023
This is not a meal, Valentine.

585
00:56:21,258 --> 00:56:25,490
We are here to try to explain to you,
what it is we do here.

586
00:56:25,805 --> 00:56:28,603
We are commodities brokers, William.

587
00:56:28,850 --> 00:56:31,080
Now, what are commodities?

588
00:56:31,311 --> 00:56:34,109
Commodities are agricultural products.

589
00:56:34,356 --> 00:56:37,985
Like coffee, that you had for breakfast.

590
00:56:38,278 --> 00:56:40,917
Wheat, which is used to make bread.

591
00:56:41,156 --> 00:56:43,351
Pork bellies, which is used to make bacon,

592
00:56:43,575 --> 00:56:47,454
which you might find in a bacon,
lettuce and tomato sandwich.

593
00:56:49,165 --> 00:56:54,797
Then there are other commodities like
frozen orange juice and gold.

594
00:56:55,172 --> 00:56:59,643
Though, of course, gold
doesn't grow on trees like oranges.

595
00:57:01,221 --> 00:57:03,815
- Clear so far?
- Yeah.

596
00:57:04,057 --> 00:57:07,891
Good, William.
Now, some of our clients are speculating

597
00:57:08,187 --> 00:57:11,418
that the price of gold
will rise in the future.

598
00:57:11,691 --> 00:57:16,685
We have other clients who are speculating
that the price of gold is going to fall.

599
00:57:17,030 --> 00:57:19,703
They've placed their orders with us

600
00:57:19,950 --> 00:57:23,625
and we buy or sell their gold for them.

601
00:57:23,913 --> 00:57:26,586
Tell him the good part.

602
00:57:26,833 --> 00:57:32,032
The good part is that no matter whether
our clients make money,

603
00:57:32,381 --> 00:57:37,296
or lose money,
Duke & Duke get the commissions.

604
00:57:37,971 --> 00:57:40,485
Well, what do you think, Valentine?

605
00:57:42,726 --> 00:57:46,196
Sounds to me like you guys
are a couple of bookies.

606
00:57:46,481 --> 00:57:48,039
I told you he'd understand.

607
00:57:49,776 --> 00:57:53,451
It doesn't take a genius
to figure out what happened.

608
00:57:53,739 --> 00:57:57,971
It's the same guy who tried
to rob the payroll, no doubt, that's him.

609
00:57:58,286 --> 00:58:00,277
He planted the drugs on me.

610
00:58:00,497 --> 00:58:02,692
Rachim, Mohammed, Larry.
How are you guys doing?

611
00:58:02,916 --> 00:58:05,714
Hey, hey, how ya doing?

612
00:58:07,546 --> 00:58:09,537
You know those people?

613
00:58:21,855 --> 00:58:24,050
He was wearing my Harvard tie.

614
00:58:24,274 --> 00:58:28,552
Can you believe it? My Harvard tie.
Like, oh sure, he went to Harvard.

615
00:58:30,197 --> 00:58:35,430
If he's being driven around in my car,
he could actually be living in my house.

616
00:58:36,621 --> 00:58:38,816
Maybe he's even taken my job.

617
00:58:39,041 --> 00:58:43,239
For all I know, right at this moment
he could be fondling my fiance.

618
00:58:44,005 --> 00:58:47,714
And Coleman -
after years of service, this betrayal.

619
00:58:48,009 --> 00:58:50,000
I don't understand it.

620
00:58:50,721 --> 00:58:53,713
There's going to be retribution.
Oh, he's going to pay.

621
00:58:53,975 --> 00:58:56,489
- The things that I
- Shut up, Louis.

622
00:58:56,728 --> 00:59:00,118
Taxis cost money,
food costs money and rent costs money!

623
00:59:00,399 --> 00:59:04,233
Now, you want me to help you out,
I expect a lot in return.

624
00:59:04,528 --> 00:59:08,521
These were here when I moved in.
Put 'em on if you want.

625
00:59:14,832 --> 00:59:19,860
Look, I cannot begin to tell you
how much I appreciate this

626
00:59:20,213 --> 00:59:24,365
- Ophelia.
- Ophelia, you realise that's the name

627
00:59:24,676 --> 00:59:27,793
I know, Hamlet's girlfriend.
He went crazy, she killed herself.

628
00:59:28,055 --> 00:59:30,853
This is not Shakespeare, Louis.

629
00:59:31,100 --> 00:59:35,651
I'm 24. I'm from a small, miserable
mining town you probably never heard of.

630
00:59:37,232 --> 00:59:41,544
The only thing I've got going for me,
is this body, this face,

631
00:59:41,863 --> 00:59:43,854
and what I got up here.

632
00:59:53,626 --> 00:59:55,617
I don't do drugs.

633
00:59:55,837 --> 00:59:57,828
And I don't have a pimp.

634
00:59:59,550 --> 01:00:01,541
This place is a dump.

635
01:00:01,761 --> 01:00:04,992
But it's cheap,
it's clean and it's all mine.

636
01:00:05,265 --> 01:00:08,655
I've saved 42 grand
and it's in T-Bills earning interest.

637
01:00:08,935 --> 01:00:12,166
I've got three more years on my back.
I'll have enough to retire.

638
01:00:13,691 --> 01:00:15,886
You're a prostitute?

639
01:00:21,867 --> 01:00:24,586
I'm talking about
a business proposition, Louis.

640
01:00:24,829 --> 01:00:29,778
I help you get back on your feet
and you pay me, in cash, five figures.

641
01:00:30,126 --> 01:00:33,118
That's the deal
and it's not subject to negotiation.

642
01:00:33,380 --> 01:00:35,371
Understood?

643
01:00:51,609 --> 01:00:56,239
By the way, food and rent are not
the only things here that cost money.

644
01:00:56,573 --> 01:00:58,484
You sleep on the couch.

645
01:01:01,120 --> 01:01:03,190
It's hit rock bottom. Come on, let's buy.

646
01:01:04,916 --> 01:01:07,111
Buy 200 May belly contracts at 66.8.

647
01:01:07,336 --> 01:01:11,534
- Put them on my personal account.
- That's a big mistake, man.

648
01:01:11,841 --> 01:01:17,757
- Valentine, this is very important, watch.
- You're going to get reamed on this one.

649
01:01:18,140 --> 01:01:20,973
Why shouldn't we buy now, William?

650
01:01:21,227 --> 01:01:22,979
Price is going to keep going down.

651
01:01:25,189 --> 01:01:27,623
Randolph, this isn't
Monopoly money we're playing with.

652
01:01:30,279 --> 01:01:33,351
This is Randolph Duke.
Hold that belly over a moment.

653
01:01:34,742 --> 01:01:39,338
Tell me why you think
the price of pork bellies is going down.

654
01:01:39,664 --> 01:01:44,374
- It's Christmas time. Everybody's uptight.
- Could we please buy now?

655
01:01:44,712 --> 01:01:48,068
- If you want to lose money go ahead.
- What are you trying to say?

656
01:01:48,341 --> 01:01:51,856
OK, pork belly prices
have been dropping all morning.

657
01:01:52,137 --> 01:01:56,688
So everybody's waiting for them
to hit rock bottom so they can buy cheap.

658
01:01:57,018 --> 01:01:59,816
The people with
pork belly contracts are thinking,

659
01:02:00,063 --> 01:02:03,214
"Hey, we're losing all our money
and Christmas is coming."

660
01:02:03,483 --> 01:02:06,475
"I won't be able to buy my
son the GI Joe with the Kung Fu grip."

661
01:02:06,737 --> 01:02:10,730
"And my wife won't make love to me
cos I ain't got no money."

662
01:02:11,034 --> 01:02:13,502
They're panicking, screaming, "Sell, sell."

663
01:02:13,745 --> 01:02:18,023
They don't want to lose all their money.
They are panicking right now. I can feel it.

664
01:02:18,334 --> 01:02:19,972
Look at them.

665
01:02:20,169 --> 01:02:22,967
He's right, Mortimer, my God, look at it.

666
01:02:23,923 --> 01:02:26,312
I'd wait till you get to 64, then buy.

667
01:02:26,551 --> 01:02:28,940
You'll have cleared out
all the suckers by then.

668
01:02:30,139 --> 01:02:32,733
Do you realise how much money
he just saved us?

669
01:02:32,975 --> 01:02:35,364
Money isn't everything, Randolph.

670
01:02:38,190 --> 01:02:42,468
Advise our clients
interested in bellies to buy at 64.

671
01:02:42,778 --> 01:02:45,008
Mr Valentine has set the price.

672
01:02:47,492 --> 01:02:51,371
Well done, William.
Very well done.

673
01:02:51,663 --> 01:02:54,416
Come on, Randolph, we're gonna be late.

674
01:03:24,659 --> 01:03:28,254
Yo
Mortimer dropped his money clip.

675
01:03:29,457 --> 01:03:32,449
- You can count it, it's all there.
- Thank you.

676
01:03:32,710 --> 01:03:37,420
- It's all there, count it.
- I'm sure it is. Keep up the good work.

677
01:03:37,758 --> 01:03:39,794
All right, Randy.

678
01:03:40,010 --> 01:03:42,001
Nice try, Mortimer.

679
01:04:36,075 --> 01:04:38,669
That was great, that was really great.

680
01:04:42,373 --> 01:04:45,171
and she stepped on the ball.

681
01:04:47,921 --> 01:04:51,277
Oh my God, I don't believe it.

682
01:04:54,429 --> 01:04:58,468
- Ah, there you are.
- I think I'm going to be sick.

683
01:04:58,767 --> 01:05:00,758
Don't worry, I'll handle this, Pookums.

684
01:05:02,563 --> 01:05:04,554
Todd, Harry, Andrew, Philip.

685
01:05:04,774 --> 01:05:08,608
I realise this looks completely awful
but I just wanted to assure you,

686
01:05:08,904 --> 01:05:11,543
my friends, that I am completely innocent.

687
01:05:11,782 --> 01:05:15,980
I'm going to fight this.
Someone is out to get me and I know who.

688
01:05:16,287 --> 01:05:19,757
The important thing is
that I can rely on you,

689
01:05:20,042 --> 01:05:22,317
my friends, as character witnesses.

690
01:05:29,636 --> 01:05:31,672
I'm going to be defending myself

691
01:05:31,888 --> 01:05:35,244
and I wondered
if you could see your way clear

692
01:05:35,518 --> 01:05:40,114
to perhaps advance me
a small loan until the hearing.

693
01:05:42,150 --> 01:05:46,428
Frankly, Winthorpe,
and I think I speak for all of us,

694
01:05:46,739 --> 01:05:51,017
I think it shows incredibly bad taste
for you to embarrass us like this.

695
01:05:53,163 --> 01:05:55,313
I believe I'm still a member of this club.

696
01:05:57,376 --> 01:06:02,769
Nobody wants to buy your drugs, Louis.
Why don't you just go away?

697
01:06:16,314 --> 01:06:18,305
Burnt my fingers, man.

698
01:06:21,445 --> 01:06:23,436
I beg your pardon.

699
01:06:25,033 --> 01:06:27,831
Man, that watch is so hot, it's smokin'.

700
01:06:28,078 --> 01:06:31,753
Hot? Do you mean to imply, stolen?

701
01:06:32,041 --> 01:06:35,431
- I'll give you 50 bucks for it.
- 50 bucks!

702
01:06:36,129 --> 01:06:40,247
No, no, no. This is a Rochefoucauld,
the thinnest water-resistant watch in the world.

703
01:06:40,550 --> 01:06:43,110
Singularly unique, sculptured in design,

704
01:06:43,345 --> 01:06:47,941
hand-crafted in Switzerland
and water-resistant to three atmospheres.

705
01:06:48,268 --> 01:06:53,706
This is the sports watch of the '80s.
$6,955 retail.

706
01:06:54,066 --> 01:06:55,704
Got a receipt?

707
01:06:55,901 --> 01:06:58,096
Look, it tells time simultaneously

708
01:06:58,321 --> 01:07:01,518
in Monte Carlo, Beverly Hills, London,
Paris, Rome and Gstaad.

709
01:07:01,783 --> 01:07:05,901
In Philadelphia it's worth 50 bucks.

710
01:07:06,997 --> 01:07:08,988
Just give me the money.

711
01:07:22,140 --> 01:07:24,700
How much for the gun?

712
01:07:29,398 --> 01:07:32,993
So, this snail is standing
in front of the Cadillac salesman, see,

713
01:07:33,277 --> 01:07:36,667
and says,
"How much is that Cadillac?"

714
01:07:44,081 --> 01:07:47,960
The snail says,
"I want a big 'S' put on each door"

715
01:07:48,253 --> 01:07:53,373
"and on top of the car, I want a big 'S'
so everybody can see it."

716
01:07:53,717 --> 01:07:57,869
Salesman says, "Why do you want that?"
He says, "When I drive down the avenue

717
01:07:58,181 --> 01:08:02,652
"I want everybody to say
'Look at that S-car-go."'

718
01:08:09,569 --> 01:08:12,129
"Look at the S-car-go."

719
01:08:19,288 --> 01:08:23,440
I'm considering going long on April wheat.
What do you think, Valentine?

720
01:08:26,922 --> 01:08:30,517
I can think of three good reasons
why you shouldn't do that, judge.

721
01:08:30,802 --> 01:08:35,000
One, the Russian wheat harvest isn't going
to be as bad as people think and two

722
01:08:38,310 --> 01:08:41,302
and three, judging by
the jewels around your girlfriend's neck,

723
01:08:41,564 --> 01:08:45,079
I think you're going to need every penny
just to keep her happy.

724
01:09:25,364 --> 01:09:28,879
103.
That's it, you're staying in bed.

725
01:09:29,160 --> 01:09:34,154
That man has moved into my house.
He's stolen my job. I have to do something.

726
01:09:36,502 --> 01:09:38,493
Stay here.

727
01:09:44,970 --> 01:09:47,200
It's ten o'clock - here's Johnny.

728
01:09:47,431 --> 01:09:51,390
Listen, baby, I'm sorry.
My momma just came in from outta town.

729
01:09:51,686 --> 01:09:53,677
Can we do it next week?

730
01:09:57,568 --> 01:09:59,559
Flowers for me?

731
01:09:59,778 --> 01:10:01,370
Thanks.

732
01:10:06,119 --> 01:10:08,792
- What are you doing?
- You've got company.

733
01:10:09,039 --> 01:10:11,428
Business is business.
I'll go for a walk.

734
01:10:11,667 --> 01:10:14,659
- Fresh air will do me good.
- Lay down.

735
01:10:19,301 --> 01:10:22,293
I'm sorry you had to cancel
your appointment.

736
01:10:25,183 --> 01:10:27,174
What are you doing?

737
01:10:41,159 --> 01:10:44,390
Ophelia, I can't tell you
how good that feels.

738
01:10:45,414 --> 01:10:48,008
You've been so kind to me.

739
01:10:48,251 --> 01:10:51,561
I'm just protecting my investment.
That's all.

740
01:10:53,757 --> 01:10:55,748
Shut up and go to sleep.

741
01:11:11,027 --> 01:11:14,417
99 and a half. You're not
getting out of bed until it's normal.

742
01:11:14,698 --> 01:11:17,292
I feel fine and I've
inconvenienced you enough.

743
01:11:17,534 --> 01:11:20,094
You have work to do and so do I.

744
01:11:20,329 --> 01:11:22,320
Nobody works on Christmas Eve.

745
01:11:22,540 --> 01:11:26,453
I'm going shopping
and then I'll make you a nice quiet dinner.

746
01:11:26,753 --> 01:11:28,744
Now, read your paper.

747
01:11:44,482 --> 01:11:48,555
Christmas! I'll give him a Christmas
present he'll never forget.

748
01:13:16,003 --> 01:13:18,801
Ah William, where've you been?
The party's already begun.

749
01:13:19,048 --> 01:13:21,039
I have some work to finish.

750
01:13:21,259 --> 01:13:24,251
It's Christmas Eve
and William wants to keep working.

751
01:13:25,639 --> 01:13:28,915
I'll think of you in Stockholm,
when I accept the Nobel Prize.

752
01:13:29,185 --> 01:13:33,497
The wager has two parts - something
about a second party turning to crime.

753
01:13:37,403 --> 01:13:39,837
Didn't you say you had work to do?

754
01:13:40,072 --> 01:13:44,384
Yes sir. I was wondering about this
$10,000 cheque to Mr Clarence Beeks.

755
01:13:44,703 --> 01:13:46,694
I'll take care of it, Valentine.

756
01:13:46,913 --> 01:13:49,711
I don't recall a Clarence Beeks, Mr Duke.

757
01:13:49,959 --> 01:13:52,348
It was before you joined us, Valentine.

758
01:13:52,587 --> 01:13:57,058
We did manage to stay in business
for 47 years before your arrival.

759
01:13:57,759 --> 01:14:00,557
Have a drink, William.
Merry Christmas.

760
01:14:00,804 --> 01:14:03,796
- Merry Christmas, Mr Duke.
- What?

761
01:14:04,058 --> 01:14:06,970
- Merry Christmas.
- Oh, oh, Merry Christmas.

762
01:14:17,615 --> 01:14:21,085
Ho, ho, ho!

763
01:14:32,132 --> 01:14:34,123
Just what do you think you're doing?

764
01:14:34,760 --> 01:14:38,958
Randolph, Mortimer, come in here quickly,
I've finally caught him.

765
01:14:42,394 --> 01:14:44,908
- Who are you?
- I've caught him red-handed.

766
01:14:45,147 --> 01:14:47,138
Winthorpe, is that you?

767
01:14:47,358 --> 01:14:50,953
I'm making a citizen's arrest.
This man is a drug dealer.

768
01:14:51,237 --> 01:14:54,195
Look, his office drawer,
he's got all the bad drugs here.

769
01:14:54,449 --> 01:14:57,247
Marijuana joints, pills, Quaaludes,

770
01:14:57,494 --> 01:15:01,772
Valium, yellow ones, red ones,
cocaine grinder, drug needles.

771
01:15:02,083 --> 01:15:04,153
He's the pusher, not me.

772
01:15:04,377 --> 01:15:07,335
I just came in
and caught him planting this stuff.

773
01:15:07,589 --> 01:15:10,387
It's obviously
some primitive attempt to frame me.

774
01:15:10,634 --> 01:15:15,025
Frame you? Boy, if that
isn't the pot calling the kettle black.

775
01:15:15,348 --> 01:15:18,101
This man's obviously a lunatic.
I'm calling security.

776
01:15:19,394 --> 01:15:21,385
Put that phone down.

777
01:15:23,149 --> 01:15:26,346
Hello, security
Merry Christmas.

778
01:15:28,863 --> 01:15:31,172
You tried to rob me,
plant drugs on me.

779
01:15:31,408 --> 01:15:35,321
You steal my house, my car, my job.
I ought to kill him now.

780
01:15:35,621 --> 01:15:37,612
Look, this is a big misunderstanding.

781
01:15:37,832 --> 01:15:41,507
I don't know nothing about it.
Could you put the gun away?

782
01:15:41,795 --> 01:15:45,424
Put that gun away at once, Winthorpe.
Have you lost your mind?

783
01:15:46,842 --> 01:15:48,275
Freeze, slime ball.

784
01:15:50,472 --> 01:15:55,626
I realise this whole experience
must have been rather unsettling for you.

785
01:15:55,978 --> 01:15:58,014
Winthorpe, don't leave. We can explain.

786
01:15:58,773 --> 01:16:01,367
Yeah, you'll be sorry.

787
01:16:03,945 --> 01:16:07,221
You'll all be very, very sorry.

788
01:16:29,725 --> 01:16:33,638
Poor, deluded creature.
We caught him pilfering at our club,

789
01:16:33,938 --> 01:16:37,248
embezzling funds, selling drugs.

790
01:16:37,525 --> 01:16:39,834
Now he's dressing up like Santa Claus.

791
01:16:40,863 --> 01:16:42,854
Very sordid business.

792
01:16:43,073 --> 01:16:46,622
I can't believe Winthorpe
would fall to pieces like that.

793
01:16:47,036 --> 01:16:49,231

795

796

797

798
01:18:07,837 --> 01:18:10,067

799

800

801

802
01:18:27,777 --> 01:18:29,768

803

804

805

809

812

813
01:19:11,368 --> 01:19:13,928

814
01:19:14,163 --> 01:19:17,712

816

817

836
01:23:39,675 --> 01:23:41,666
- Merry Christmas.

The Dukes used us as guinea pigs.

849

01:25:47,488 --> 01:25:49,444

884

01:30:41,909 --> 01:30:43,900

buying like crazy right from the opening.

1029
01:43:32,833 --> 01:43:34,824
We wait until he drives the price up?

1030
01:43:35,044 --> 01:43:39,435
Right. I can't wait to see his face, when
they broadcast that genuine crop report.

1031
01:43:39,757 --> 01:43:41,748
OJ trading opens at 9:00.

1032
01:43:41,968 --> 01:43:44,766
- Let's go kick some butt.
- Let's go.

1033
01:44:46,626 --> 01:44:49,936
Hey, hey. The Dukes
are trying to corner the market.

1034
01:44:50,213 --> 01:44:53,205
- They know something.
- Let's get in on it.

1035
01:44:54,384 --> 01:44:55,897
200, taken.

1036
01:44:56,095 --> 01:45:00,054
- 130.
- 200, 200.

1037
01:45:00,391 --> 01:45:02,382
Louis.

1038
01:45:02,602 --> 01:45:04,593
Not yet, almost.

1039
01:45:05,022 --> 01:45:07,092
- 220 taken.
- 209.

1040
01:45:07,316 --> 01:45:10,353
- Yeah, yeah, got 'em.
- 139.

1041
01:45:14,407 --> 01:45:18,116
Now!
Sell, 200 April at 142.

1042
01:45:32,470 --> 01:45:36,463
That's not right.
How can the price be going down?

1043
01:45:36,766 --> 01:45:39,360
Something's wrong. Where's Wilson?

1044
01:45:41,897 --> 01:45:43,888
What are they doing here?

1045
01:45:44,108 --> 01:45:47,896
- They're selling, Mortimer.
- Why, that's ridiculous.

1046
01:45:49,823 --> 01:45:55,102
- Unless that crop report
- God help us.

1047
01:46:05,549 --> 01:46:08,825
I told you we shouldn't have
committed everything, you asshole.

1048
01:46:09,095 --> 01:46:13,088
We've got to get Wilson
and tell him to sell.

1049
01:46:39,255 --> 01:46:40,654
Ladies and gentlemen,

1050
01:46:40,840 --> 01:46:42,671
the Secretary Of Agriculture.

1051
01:46:52,937 --> 01:46:57,169
Ladies and gentlemen, the
orange crop estimates for the next year.

1052
01:47:11,500 --> 01:47:15,857
After calculating the estimates from
various orange producing states,

1053
01:47:16,172 --> 01:47:18,128
We have concluded the following

1054
01:47:18,633 --> 01:47:22,546
The cold winter has apparently
not effected the orange harvest.

1055
01:47:28,311 --> 01:47:32,782
consumers can expect
orange juice prices to fall

1056
01:47:40,158 --> 01:47:42,194
Wilson, for Christ's sake, sell.

1057
01:47:54,048 --> 01:47:55,845
Buy 'em.

1058
01:48:30,549 --> 01:48:32,540
Wilson, where are you going?

1059
01:48:32,759 --> 01:48:37,150
You idiot. Get back in there at once
and sell, sell.

1060
01:48:50,488 --> 01:48:52,479
- Five.
- Yeah, 200.

1061
01:48:52,699 --> 01:48:55,497
- 100.
- Yeah, that was 100.

1062
01:48:55,744 --> 01:48:58,622
Did you get that?

1063
01:49:15,475 --> 01:49:17,466
Happy New Year.

1064
01:49:19,438 --> 01:49:22,475
- Winthorpe.
- Valentine.

1065
01:49:22,733 --> 01:49:26,487
- How'd you make out today?
- How could you do this to us,

1066
01:49:26,780 --> 01:49:28,771
after everything we've done for you?

1067
01:49:28,990 --> 01:49:31,982
Oh, see I made Louis a bet here.

1068
01:49:32,244 --> 01:49:35,919
Louis bet me that we couldn't get rich
and put you in the poorhouse.

1069
01:49:36,207 --> 01:49:39,005
He didn't think we could do it. I won.

1070
01:49:39,252 --> 01:49:41,243
I lost.

1071
01:49:41,797 --> 01:49:44,595
- One dollar.
- Thank you, Louis.

1072
01:49:46,260 --> 01:49:48,251
- After you.
- Certainly.

1073
01:49:52,434 --> 01:49:54,425
Margin call, gentlemen.

1074
01:49:54,645 --> 01:49:57,079
- Why you can't expect
- You know the rules.

1075
01:49:57,315 --> 01:50:02,230
All accounts to be settled at the end
of the day's trading, without exception.

1076
01:50:02,571 --> 01:50:06,689
You know perfectly well,
we don't have $394 million in cash.

1077
01:50:06,992 --> 01:50:11,907
I'm sorry, boys. Put the Duke brothers'
seats on the exchange up for sale at once.

1078
01:50:12,248 --> 01:50:15,479
Seize all assets of Duke & Duke
Commodity Brokers,

1079
01:50:15,752 --> 01:50:19,301
as well as all personal holdings
of Randolph and Mortimer Duke.

1080
01:50:19,590 --> 01:50:22,627
We're ruined!

1081
01:50:22,885 --> 01:50:25,604
This is an outrage,
I demand an investigation.

1082
01:50:25,847 --> 01:50:30,284
You can't sell our seats. A Duke has been
on this exchange since it was founded.

1083
01:50:30,603 --> 01:50:32,878
We founded this exchange. It's ours.

1084
01:50:33,106 --> 01:50:35,097
It belongs to us.

1085
01:50:36,234 --> 01:50:38,190
We'd better call your brother
an ambulance.

1086
01:50:38,403 --> 01:50:41,793
Fuck him!
I want trading reopened, right now.

1087
01:50:42,074 --> 01:50:45,908
Get those brokers back in here.
Turn those machines back on.

1088
01:50:46,204 --> 01:50:49,002
Turn those machines back on.

1089
01:50:53,379 --> 01:50:57,008
You and your Nobel Prize, you idiot.

1090
01:50:57,300 --> 01:51:00,019
Where's Beeks? Where in hell is Beeks?

1091
01:51:00,262 --> 01:51:02,822
- Beeks!
- Yeah, I forgot all about that guy.

1092
01:51:12,317 --> 01:51:14,751
OK, one male gorilla.

1093
01:51:14,987 --> 01:51:17,547
Wait a minute.
There's two of them in that cage.

1094
01:51:17,782 --> 01:51:21,491
One gorilla, two gorillas. Big deal.
Whole bunch is getting sent back to Africa.

1095
01:51:21,786 --> 01:51:26,098
It's a big scientific experiment.
What do I know? Anyway, they're in love.

1096
01:51:47,274 --> 01:51:50,027
- Hey, Coleman.
- Yes.

1097
01:51:51,529 --> 01:51:54,202
What about lunch?
The lobster or the cracked crab?

1098
01:51:54,449 --> 01:51:57,725
- What do you think?
- Can't we have both?

1099
01:51:57,994 --> 01:51:59,950
Why not?

1100
01:52:00,164 --> 01:52:02,155
- Dimitri.
- Sir.

1101
01:52:02,374 --> 01:52:07,402
- Lobster and cracked crab for everyone.
- Extra prima good, Mr Coleman, sir.

1102
01:52:16,808 --> 01:52:19,276
Looking good, Billy Ray.

1103
01:52:19,519 --> 01:52:21,908
Feeling good, Louis.

title: WallStreet
script:
1
00:00:58,822 --> 00:01:03,511
Sync for
"Wall.Street.1987.BluRay.720P.DTS.x264-CHD"

2
00:01:03,512 --> 00:01:08,201
::nlsinh@gmail.com::

3
00:01:08,202 --> 00:01:13,579
WALLSTREET
hddanang.com

4
00:02:20,570 --> 00:02:23,364
- (man) Easy!
- (woman) Excuse me!

5
00:02:40,756 --> 00:02:42,049
Good morning. Jackson Steinem.

6
00:02:43,050 --> 00:02:45,469
- How you doing, Buddy?
- Great, Carolyn.

7
00:02:45,553 --> 00:02:48,055
Doing any better would be a sin.

8
00:02:50,433 --> 00:02:52,518
Morning.

9
00:03:00,151 --> 00:03:02,403
Morning, Dan. What's looking good today?

10
00:03:02,486 --> 00:03:06,157
lf l knew, l wouldn't be in this business.
Get out while you're young.

11
00:03:06,240 --> 00:03:09,493
l came here one day, l sat down,
and look at me now.

12
00:03:09,577 --> 00:03:11,662
Look at you now.

13
00:03:14,081 --> 00:03:15,708
Morning, Brian.

14
00:03:15,791 --> 00:03:19,587
- Chuckie! How's the woman slayer?
- Looking for an 18-year-old wife.

15
00:03:19,670 --> 00:03:22,673
- How you doing, pal?
- Well, if l had your looks, better.

16
00:03:22,757 --> 00:03:26,385
Takes years of genetics,
a Yale education and the right tailor.

17
00:03:26,469 --> 00:03:28,971
Not that you learned anything, Chunk.

18
00:03:31,057 --> 00:03:35,061
Marv, l got a feeling that we
are gonna make a killing today.

19
00:03:35,144 --> 00:03:36,812
Yeah? Where's your machine gun?

20
00:03:36,896 --> 00:03:38,898
You can't make a buck in this market.

21
00:03:38,981 --> 00:03:42,985
The country's going to hell faster
than when Roosevelt was in charge!

22
00:03:43,069 --> 00:03:46,239
Too much cheap money
sloshing around the world.

23
00:03:46,322 --> 00:03:50,284
Worst mistake we ever made was
letting Nixon get off the gold standard.

24
00:03:50,368 --> 00:03:52,703
Putney Drug - you boys
might wanna look at it.

25
00:03:52,787 --> 00:03:57,250
- No. They'll take five years to come around.
- But they got a good new drug.

26
00:03:57,333 --> 00:04:01,337
Stick to the fundamentals.
That's how lBM and Hilton were built.

27
00:04:01,420 --> 00:04:04,423
Good things sometimes take time.

28
00:04:04,507 --> 00:04:09,053
(PA) Look sharp, especially you rookies.
Nikkei lndex closed up 90 points last night.

29
00:04:09,136 --> 00:04:11,764
We expect heavy Japanese buying
on the opening.

30
00:04:11,848 --> 00:04:16,894
The firm has 200,000 steel for sale.
A million Big Blue. 350,000 pork and beans.

31
00:04:16,978 --> 00:04:22,024
Get on the horn with your institutions.
These utilities are our top priority today.

32
00:04:22,108 --> 00:04:26,404
- OK. Let's go to work.
- And they're off and running!

33
00:04:26,487 --> 00:04:28,573
(bell rings)

34
00:04:42,086 --> 00:04:47,967
We cleared up to 60,000 XGC at 48 1/2.
Yes, that's right. Right.

35
00:04:52,972 --> 00:04:55,892
- The marketjust doubled.
- Brenner!

36
00:04:56,225 --> 00:04:59,020
Research has put thrifts
on the recommended.

37
00:04:59,103 --> 00:05:01,814
What? Dump it for chrissake!

38
00:05:01,898 --> 00:05:06,527
30,000. Three-eight top.
l go along at 23. You got it.

39
00:05:06,611 --> 00:05:09,697
Now you own it!
Conwest Air? Let me check it.

40
00:05:15,786 --> 00:05:17,997
Circle 29,000 Niagaras for Templeton.

41
00:05:18,080 --> 00:05:24,086
Mr Harrison, are you aware that we are
in the biggest bull market of our generation?

42
00:05:24,170 --> 00:05:28,049
No, sir, it's not what you think.
lf you take five minutes of your time...

43
00:05:28,549 --> 00:05:31,052
Dreyfus is looking for 50,000 Conair!

44
00:05:31,135 --> 00:05:33,679
September 50s? How about Decembers?

45
00:05:33,763 --> 00:05:36,432
Mr Zaros? Bud Fox, Jackson Steinem.

46
00:05:36,516 --> 00:05:37,975
Yes, sir, l am aware of that.

47
00:05:38,059 --> 00:05:42,355
But if l could have five minutes
to explain the opportunities emerging...

48
00:05:42,438 --> 00:05:44,440
..in the international debt market.

49
00:05:44,524 --> 00:05:45,400
No, no...

50
00:05:45,483 --> 00:05:47,318
Bud Fox, Jackson Steinem.

51
00:05:47,401 --> 00:05:53,324
Yes, l am aware of this. But if l could just
explain the opportunities emerging...

52
00:05:53,407 --> 00:05:56,327
- ..in the international debt market...
- (line disconnects)

53
00:05:56,410 --> 00:05:58,496
l'm sure that...

54
00:06:05,670 --> 00:06:10,424
Yesterday concerns my future.
l need the info now, before the close.

55
00:06:10,508 --> 00:06:13,553
No, in ten minutes it's history.
At four l'm a dinosaur!

56
00:06:13,636 --> 00:06:19,016
Howard, l thought you were a gentleman.
Sure it's gone down. You got the tip. l didn't.

57
00:06:19,100 --> 00:06:22,061
- Why would l tell you to sell it?
- Give it back!

58
00:06:22,144 --> 00:06:24,856
To who? l can't give it back - you own it!

59
00:06:24,939 --> 00:06:26,607
No, he's not here.

60
00:06:26,691 --> 00:06:29,986
- (whispers) That's what you told us to say.
- Gimme that phone.

61
00:06:30,069 --> 00:06:32,071
- Hello?
- Hello.

62
00:06:32,154 --> 00:06:35,741
- Who am l talking to?
- The sales manager. What's the problem?

63
00:06:35,825 --> 00:06:40,413
What? Will you gimme a break? How was
l supposed to know you were in surgery?

64
00:06:40,538 --> 00:06:42,915
What am l - Marvin the Mindreader?!

65
00:06:42,999 --> 00:06:47,962
Uh, no, sir. l'll discuss that with the
account executive, and l'll get back to you.

66
00:06:48,045 --> 00:06:50,339
No, no, sir. You're welcome.

67
00:06:53,676 --> 00:06:57,305
l'm closing the account.
lf he doesn't pay tomorrow, you pay.

68
00:06:57,513 --> 00:06:59,849
Mr Lynch, l swear to you, he's lying.

69
00:06:59,932 --> 00:07:02,268
We give you a rich man's account,...

70
00:07:02,351 --> 00:07:05,938
..and you tell me he's gonna DK you
for a lousy quarter point?

71
00:07:06,022 --> 00:07:10,401
You're being unfair, sir.
You know he's got a history for bullshit.

72
00:07:10,484 --> 00:07:13,029
Somebody's got to pay.

73
00:07:13,112 --> 00:07:15,406
Ain't gonna be me.

74
00:07:17,825 --> 00:07:20,995
Buddy, Buddy.
A little trouble, huh, today, Buddy?

75
00:07:21,078 --> 00:07:25,791
Howard the jerk reneged on me. l gotta
cover his losses to the tune of seven grand.

76
00:07:25,875 --> 00:07:27,335
Yeah! l'm holding!

77
00:07:27,418 --> 00:07:30,922
l'm tapped out. American Express
got a hit man looking for me.

78
00:07:31,339 --> 00:07:34,926
lt coulda been worse, right?
Coulda been my money.

79
00:07:36,594 --> 00:07:41,057
Here, here, rookie, let me help you out.
l got... a C-note.

80
00:07:42,600 --> 00:07:46,395
- Thanks, Marv. l'll make it up to you.
- Yes, l am still here!

81
00:07:47,271 --> 00:07:51,442
You know what my dream is?
To one day be on the other end of that phone.

82
00:07:51,526 --> 00:07:54,779
Oh, you got it, baby.
Where the real cheesecake is.

83
00:07:55,947 --> 00:07:58,449
Hey, Bud, you forgetting something?

84
00:07:58,533 --> 00:08:00,618
The Gekko phone call?

85
00:08:01,118 --> 00:08:05,915
When are you gonna realise it's the big game
hunters who bag elephants, not guys like us.

86
00:08:05,998 --> 00:08:08,251
- Gordon Gekko, please.
- Gekko's beautiful.

87
00:08:08,334 --> 00:08:12,171
30 seconds after the Challenger blew up,
he's selling NASA stock short.

88
00:08:12,255 --> 00:08:16,342
Yeah, but... 47 million he made
on the Melcore deal.

89
00:08:16,425 --> 00:08:19,345
23 on the lmperial deal before he was 40.

90
00:08:19,428 --> 00:08:24,559
The guy makes 20 times what Dave Winfield
makes in a year, and he talks to everybody.

91
00:08:24,642 --> 00:08:27,103
And he had an ethical bypass at birth.

92
00:08:27,186 --> 00:08:29,397
- Hello, Natalie. Guess who?
- Mr Fox.

93
00:08:29,480 --> 00:08:35,945
Right. Every day l say to myself that today
could be the day. So will you marry me?

94
00:08:36,028 --> 00:08:39,740
- l'll think about it.
- Then can you get me through to Mr Gekko?

95
00:08:39,824 --> 00:08:43,786
- He's very busy.
- Of course he is. Five minutes is all l ask.

96
00:08:43,911 --> 00:08:49,542
Mr Fox, l'm sure you're a good broker,
but our traders deal with the brokers.

97
00:08:49,625 --> 00:08:51,919
Mr Gekko deals with investment bankers.

98
00:08:52,003 --> 00:08:56,299
- Tell him l called. There are big changes...
- Yes, l'll give him your message.

99
00:08:56,382 --> 00:09:02,013
Leo, l understand, but you have to realise
there'll be major subordinated debt involved.

100
00:09:16,694 --> 00:09:20,239
- Buddy, how ya doing?
- Great, Charlie. Any better would be a sin.

101
00:09:20,323 --> 00:09:25,328
Jesus Christ! Listen, l hear all you guys
on Wall Street are millionaires.

102
00:09:25,411 --> 00:09:29,457
- When you gonna make us all rich?
- You need an account to win the lottery.

103
00:09:29,540 --> 00:09:33,920
- Give me 50 grand. l'll get you a condo.
- Sure! We'll own the airline by then!

104
00:09:34,003 --> 00:09:38,549
Why don't he make himself rich,
so he can pay off his school loans?

105
00:09:38,758 --> 00:09:42,762
Nice to see you're in such a good mood, Dad.
Did Mom give you fish for dinner?

106
00:09:42,845 --> 00:09:46,349
You smoke too much. How often you
gotta go to the hospital to realise?

107
00:09:46,432 --> 00:09:51,020
Leave me alone. lt's the only thing that
makes me feel good. There, Frank. All set.

108
00:09:51,103 --> 00:09:54,774
Spaghetti!
Your mother still makes lousy spaghetti.

109
00:09:54,857 --> 00:09:59,320
- lt's pasta now. Spaghetti's out of date.
- So am l. You want a beer?

110
00:09:59,695 --> 00:10:02,532
Billie! Bring a Molson Lite for the kid!

111
00:10:03,741 --> 00:10:06,160
- Looking good, huh?
- He looks terrific.

112
00:10:06,244 --> 00:10:09,372
Carl, we'll be at the bar.

113
00:10:09,956 --> 00:10:13,000
- l'll catch up with you.
- All right, Charlie.

114
00:10:14,877 --> 00:10:16,754
So...

115
00:10:17,213 --> 00:10:21,509
You look like you've grown another inch,
but you don't look so hot, Buddy.

116
00:10:21,592 --> 00:10:25,596
- You're gonna get bags under your eyes.
- Yeah, l had a tough day.

117
00:10:25,680 --> 00:10:29,684
- Some jerk DK'd me. l gotta cover his loss.
- Speak English.

118
00:10:29,767 --> 00:10:33,271
DK: Didn't Know who l was
when the options he bought took a bath.

119
00:10:33,354 --> 00:10:36,899
- Bastard reneged on me!
- l told you not to get into that racket.

120
00:10:36,983 --> 00:10:39,277
You coulda been a doctor or a lawyer.

121
00:10:39,360 --> 00:10:45,241
lf you'd stayed at Bluestar, you coulda been a
supervisor now, instead of being a salesman.

122
00:10:45,324 --> 00:10:49,745
Dad, how many times l gotta tell you l am not
a salesman? l'm an account executive.

123
00:10:49,829 --> 00:10:52,331
Soon l'm moving into investment banking.

124
00:10:52,415 --> 00:10:55,626
You ask strangers for money -
you're a salesman.

125
00:10:55,710 --> 00:10:59,005
Dad, it takes time.
You gotta build a client list.

126
00:10:59,088 --> 00:11:02,967
l can make more money in one year
as a broker than in five at this airline.

127
00:11:03,134 --> 00:11:05,136
Thank you, Billie.

128
00:11:05,219 --> 00:11:09,932
l don't get it, kid. You borrow money to go
to NYU. First year out, you make 35 grand.

129
00:11:10,016 --> 00:11:13,936
You made 50 grand last year, and can't
pay off your loans. Where does it go?!

130
00:11:14,020 --> 00:11:17,440
Dad, 50K does not get you
to first base in the Big Apple.

131
00:11:17,523 --> 00:11:19,692
l got 40% in taxes, 15 grand for rent.

132
00:11:19,775 --> 00:11:24,530
l got school loans, car loans, food -
that's three bills a month. l need suits...

133
00:11:24,614 --> 00:11:29,118
Come back home and live rent-free
instead of that roach-infected place.

134
00:11:29,202 --> 00:11:32,872
$50,000! Jesus Christ!
The whole world's off its rocker!

135
00:11:32,955 --> 00:11:36,792
l made $47,000 last year. That's before taxes.

136
00:11:36,876 --> 00:11:40,296
That's Queens, Dad! A 5% mortgage
and you rent the top room.

137
00:11:40,379 --> 00:11:45,801
l gotta live in Manhattan to be a player.
There is no nobility in poverty any more, Dad.

138
00:11:45,885 --> 00:11:48,596
One day you'll be proud of me. You'll see.

139
00:11:49,555 --> 00:11:53,476
lt's yourself you gotta
be proud of, Huckleberry.

140
00:11:53,559 --> 00:11:55,645
How much you need?

141
00:11:56,229 --> 00:11:59,941
Can you spare 300?
l'll pay you back next month, l promise.

142
00:12:00,024 --> 00:12:03,694
- l don't know if l got that much on me.
- Not in here. Please.

143
00:12:05,655 --> 00:12:08,991
lt adds up. 300 here, 200 there.
Your brother...

144
00:12:09,492 --> 00:12:14,205
l always say money's something you need
in case you don't die tomorrow. Right, Carl?

145
00:12:14,288 --> 00:12:16,165
How you doing?

146
00:12:16,249 --> 00:12:19,794
- How's work treating you?
- Damn mandatory drug test.

147
00:12:19,877 --> 00:12:24,757
They're driving us crazy. l got flagged for my
blood pressure pills. Can you believe that?

148
00:12:24,840 --> 00:12:29,470
The good news is we had a meeting with
the controller about some union business.

149
00:12:29,554 --> 00:12:32,974
Remember the accident last year
and the investigation?

150
00:12:33,057 --> 00:12:38,729
The FAA is gonna rule it was a manufacturing
error in the door-latch mechanism. l knew it.

151
00:12:38,813 --> 00:12:43,818
l kept telling 'em it wasn't maintenance.
lt's the greedy manufacturers in Cincinnati.

152
00:12:43,901 --> 00:12:47,321
- That's great.
- This gets us out from under suspension.

153
00:12:47,405 --> 00:12:52,952
We can go for those new routes to Pittsburgh
and Boston. We'll compete with the big guys.

154
00:12:53,202 --> 00:12:58,040
To Bluestar. As your broker, all l can
advise is you hold on to that stock.

155
00:12:58,124 --> 00:13:00,626
What stock? Are you kiddin'?

156
00:13:01,502 --> 00:13:04,213
- Are you sure about this thing?
- What?

157
00:13:05,047 --> 00:13:07,884
- The FAA announcement.
- Sure l'm sure.

158
00:13:09,677 --> 00:13:14,682
Look at me. You got that
mischievous look in your eye, Buddy.

159
00:13:14,765 --> 00:13:17,894
You used to smile like that
when you were a kid sleeping.

160
00:13:18,311 --> 00:13:20,771
lt's true. Just like that.

161
00:13:50,718 --> 00:13:53,262
(** computer plays "Happy Birthday")

162
00:14:01,854 --> 00:14:03,523
Morning, Gordon.

163
00:14:12,156 --> 00:14:16,244
Delivery for Mr Gekko. lt's a personal item.
He needs you to sign for it.

164
00:14:16,327 --> 00:14:17,995
Send him in.

165
00:14:31,175 --> 00:14:36,472
Hello, Natalie. Recognise the voice? Here's
a hint - you're thinking about marrying me.

166
00:14:36,556 --> 00:14:39,475
- Why are you here?
- You're lovelier than l pictured.

167
00:14:39,559 --> 00:14:43,980
- Got a birthday present for Mr Gekko.
- You can't come barging in here.

168
00:14:44,063 --> 00:14:48,901
- What makes you think it's his birthday?
- Well, it's in the bible, see?

169
00:14:48,985 --> 00:14:51,153
You better go buy him a gift.

170
00:14:51,237 --> 00:14:56,868
Please, Natalie, let me give this to him.
Cuban cigars. His favourite and tough to get.

171
00:14:58,828 --> 00:15:00,913
Please, Natalie?

172
00:15:03,124 --> 00:15:05,710
Stay here. l'll see what l can do.

173
00:15:24,562 --> 00:15:26,230
Wait outside.

174
00:15:28,482 --> 00:15:30,985
Yeah, l'll see you shortly, l hope.

175
00:15:43,664 --> 00:15:45,750
Five minutes.

176
00:15:51,839 --> 00:15:54,759
Well, life all comes down to a few moments.

177
00:15:55,384 --> 00:15:57,470
This is one of 'em.

178
00:15:59,805 --> 00:16:01,891
What the hell's going on?

179
00:16:01,974 --> 00:16:06,646
l'm looking at 200,000 shares move, pal.
l wanna know if we're part of it.

180
00:16:06,729 --> 00:16:10,816
We'd better be, or l'm gonna come
and eat your lunch for you. Back in two.

181
00:16:10,900 --> 00:16:15,279
Sorry, Jeff. Look, l loved it at 40.
lt's an insult at 50.

182
00:16:15,404 --> 00:16:19,033
Their analysts don't know
preferred stock from livestock.

183
00:16:19,116 --> 00:16:24,163
Wait till it heads south, then we raise the
sperm count on the deal. Get back at ya.

184
00:16:25,706 --> 00:16:30,920
This is the kid. Calls me 59 days in a row.
Wants to be a player.

185
00:16:31,003 --> 00:16:34,048
Oughta be in the dictionary
under "persistence".

186
00:16:34,131 --> 00:16:38,636
Listen, Jerry, l'm looking for negative control.
No more than 30, 35%.

187
00:16:38,719 --> 00:16:44,308
Just enough to block anybody else's merger
plans, and find out if the books are cooked.

188
00:16:44,392 --> 00:16:48,062
lf it looks as good as on paper,
we're in the kill zone, pal.

189
00:16:48,145 --> 00:16:52,149
Lunch? You kiddin'? Lunch is for wimps.
OK, Billy. l'll talk at ya.

190
00:16:55,820 --> 00:16:58,614
How do you do, Mr Gekko? l'm Bud Fox.

191
00:16:58,698 --> 00:17:01,951
So you say. Nice to meet you.
Hope you're intelligent.

192
00:17:02,034 --> 00:17:06,664
- Where'd you get these?
- l got a connection at the airport.

193
00:17:06,747 --> 00:17:10,376
So what's on your mind, kemo sabe?
Why am l listening to you?

194
00:17:10,459 --> 00:17:14,297
l gotta monitor my blood pressure,
so don't upset me.

195
00:17:14,422 --> 00:17:15,882
No. No, sir.

196
00:17:15,965 --> 00:17:21,179
ln 45 seconds, the microprocessor computes
your systolic and diastolic pressure.

197
00:17:21,262 --> 00:17:25,766
Got an LCD read-out, cost-effective...
Less than one visit to a doctor.

198
00:17:28,186 --> 00:17:34,025
l just wanna let you know l've read all about
you at NYU Business. l think you're a genius.

199
00:17:34,734 --> 00:17:38,988
l've always dreamed of one thing and
that's to do business with a man like you.

200
00:17:39,071 --> 00:17:41,365
- What firm you with?
- Jackson Steinem.

201
00:17:41,449 --> 00:17:44,243
They're going places.
Good junk-bond department.

202
00:17:44,327 --> 00:17:47,246
You the financing on
that Jansen investment?

203
00:17:47,330 --> 00:17:50,625
Yeah. l'm working on
some other interesting stuff.

204
00:17:50,708 --> 00:17:53,294
Cosmetic company, by any chance?

205
00:17:53,377 --> 00:17:56,088
Are you twelfth man on the deal team?
Last to know?

206
00:17:56,714 --> 00:18:00,551
- l can't tell you that, Mr Gekko.
- So what you got for me, sport?

207
00:18:00,635 --> 00:18:03,346
Chart breakout on
Whitewood-Young lndustries.

208
00:18:03,429 --> 00:18:08,142
Explosive earnings. A 30% discount from
book. Great cash flow. Couple of 5% holders.

209
00:18:08,226 --> 00:18:10,102
- lt's a dog.
- Strong management.

210
00:18:10,186 --> 00:18:14,899
lt's a dog, pal. What else you got
besides connections at the airport?

211
00:18:14,982 --> 00:18:18,110
(secretary) Mr Stevenson in San Francisco.

212
00:18:21,489 --> 00:18:23,991
- He respond?
- Lecturing on economics.

213
00:18:24,075 --> 00:18:26,160
- What?!
- No, he's in Chicago.

214
00:18:26,244 --> 00:18:31,082
Why the hell is Cromwell giving a lecture
tour when he's losing 60 million a quarter?!

215
00:18:31,165 --> 00:18:33,793
Guess he's giving lectures
in how to lose money.

216
00:18:33,876 --> 00:18:39,090
lf this guy owned a funeral parlour,
no one would die! This turkey is braindead!

217
00:18:39,841 --> 00:18:43,803
OK. All right, Christmas is over,
and business is business.

218
00:18:43,886 --> 00:18:46,889
You keep on buying. Dilute the son of a bitch!

219
00:18:46,973 --> 00:18:50,726
Ollie, l want every orifice
in his fuckin' body flowin' red!

220
00:18:50,810 --> 00:18:53,020
He's flowin', Gordo. Piece of cake.

221
00:18:53,104 --> 00:18:55,523
This guy's the best trader on the street.

222
00:18:55,606 --> 00:19:00,528
Susan, get me the LBO analysis
on Teldar Paper. Bring it in here, please.

223
00:19:00,611 --> 00:19:03,739
- (intercom) Mr Gekko, your wife.
- What else you got?

224
00:19:04,407 --> 00:19:09,996
Terafly. Analysts don't like it. l do.
The break-up value is twice the market price.

225
00:19:10,079 --> 00:19:13,165
This deal finances itself.
You sell off two divisions...

226
00:19:13,249 --> 00:19:16,669
Not bad for a quant,
but that's a dog with different fleas.

227
00:19:17,295 --> 00:19:20,172
Come on, pal.
Tell me something l don't know.

228
00:19:20,256 --> 00:19:22,508
lt's my birthday.

229
00:19:22,592 --> 00:19:24,677
Surprise me.

230
00:19:28,306 --> 00:19:30,391
- Bluestar.
- What?

231
00:19:31,225 --> 00:19:34,812
- Bluestar Airlines.
- Rings a bell somewhere. So what?

232
00:19:35,688 --> 00:19:40,067
lt's a comer. 80 medium-body jets. 300 pilots.

233
00:19:40,151 --> 00:19:44,697
Flies to Florida, Canada,
uh, Northeast, the Caribbean.

234
00:19:44,780 --> 00:19:48,576
- Great slots in major cities.
- l don't like airlines. Lousy unions.

235
00:19:48,659 --> 00:19:51,787
Well, there was a crash last year.

236
00:19:51,871 --> 00:19:54,749
They just got a favourable
ruling on a lawsuit.

237
00:19:54,832 --> 00:19:57,668
Even the plaintiffs don't know about it.

238
00:19:57,960 --> 00:20:00,671
Well, how do you know about it?

239
00:20:01,297 --> 00:20:03,216
l just know.

240
00:20:03,299 --> 00:20:06,761
The decision should clear the way
for new planes and routes.

241
00:20:06,844 --> 00:20:10,848
There's only a small float. You should grab it.
Good for a five-point pop.

242
00:20:10,932 --> 00:20:13,559
250,000 shares at 18 1/4 from Jansen.

243
00:20:13,643 --> 00:20:17,188
l can pull twice that at 18 1/2
from the California pensions.

244
00:20:17,271 --> 00:20:20,483
We got close to half a million
shares in the bag.

245
00:20:20,566 --> 00:20:24,153
The Terminator!
Blow 'em away, Ollie!

246
00:20:24,779 --> 00:20:28,449
We got the Beezer Brothers.
l'm working on the Silverberg boys.

247
00:20:28,533 --> 00:20:33,120
Rip their fuckin' throats out!
Stuff 'em in your garbage compactor!

248
00:20:33,204 --> 00:20:35,289
lnteresting. Got a card?

249
00:20:35,915 --> 00:20:38,000
Home number's on the back.

250
00:20:38,084 --> 00:20:41,921
Bud Fox, l look at a hundred
deals a day. l choose one.

251
00:20:42,004 --> 00:20:45,550
- l hope to hear from you, sir.
- Thanks for the cigars.

252
00:20:45,633 --> 00:20:48,761
Let's go, guys. Looks like
we're going over 5% in Teldar.

253
00:20:48,845 --> 00:20:51,806
Start the lawyers on a tender offer and 13D.

254
00:20:51,889 --> 00:20:54,767
We buy everything in sight,
but we don't pay over 22.

255
00:20:55,226 --> 00:20:58,896
They'll fight. They got Myers
and Thromberg doing their legal.

256
00:21:00,481 --> 00:21:02,984
- Thanks, Natalie.
- Have a nice day, Mr Fox.

257
00:21:03,067 --> 00:21:08,030
Mr Gekko, your conference call is ready. Mr
Sugarman in Delaware, Mr Bernard in LA,...

258
00:21:08,114 --> 00:21:11,284
..Mr Jackson and Ms Rosco
in London. They're all on.

259
00:21:11,659 --> 00:21:14,745
Please, l'm begging you.
l'm in a bind down here.

260
00:21:15,162 --> 00:21:20,293
We got all these damn new computers and
young men that are edging me out here.

261
00:21:21,836 --> 00:21:24,338
Hey, Bud! Did he see you?

262
00:21:24,839 --> 00:21:26,966
Yeah, he saw right through me.

263
00:21:27,049 --> 00:21:30,678
Cheer up. You shook Gekko's hand
and you still got all your fingers.

264
00:21:30,761 --> 00:21:34,140
Besides, he's not the only
elephant in the jungle.

265
00:21:34,223 --> 00:21:37,852
Holy cow! Did you get something
from him? Teldar Paper, huh?

266
00:21:37,935 --> 00:21:40,646
Nah. lt's a dog with fleas.

267
00:21:41,939 --> 00:21:46,569
Fox, where have you been
for the last three hours, hm?

268
00:21:47,069 --> 00:21:50,656
lf l were you, and l thank
my personal God l am not,...

269
00:21:50,740 --> 00:21:53,367
..l wouldn't be sitting around chinwagging.

270
00:21:53,451 --> 00:21:58,039
Plenty of six-figure names
in that zip-code pile to cold-call.

271
00:22:01,542 --> 00:22:06,672
Buddy, l got tickets for the Knick game
tonight. Cruise some chicks afterwards.

272
00:22:06,756 --> 00:22:07,840
Whaddaya say?

273
00:22:07,924 --> 00:22:10,968
- No, l gotta read my charts.
- Forget charts, will ya?

274
00:22:11,052 --> 00:22:13,846
We're not fund managers.
Churn 'em and burn 'em!

275
00:22:13,930 --> 00:22:16,390
l am offering you the Knicks and chicks.

276
00:22:16,474 --> 00:22:20,895
God help you before you turn
into poor Steeples over there.

277
00:22:22,396 --> 00:22:24,732
Preferably Lou Mannheim.

278
00:22:24,815 --> 00:22:30,696
Yeah, nice guy, but he's a loser. He lost all
his equity when the firm went belly-up in '71.

279
00:22:31,030 --> 00:22:33,824
You wanna be in your sixties still pitching?

280
00:22:33,908 --> 00:22:38,412
Hey, Buddy, whatever happened to
that cute analyst at Thudder and Wicks?

281
00:22:38,496 --> 00:22:42,416
Cindy. Having sex with her
was like reading the Wall Street Journal.

282
00:22:42,500 --> 00:22:44,794
- She had a heartbeat.
- You wanna bet?

283
00:22:45,086 --> 00:22:47,797
l gotta get to work. Zs today.

284
00:22:49,090 --> 00:22:51,259
Call for you, Buddy! Pick up two!

285
00:22:54,136 --> 00:22:56,931
- Bud Fox.
- All right, Bud Fox.

286
00:22:57,014 --> 00:23:00,560
l want you to buy 20,000 shares of Bluestar...

287
00:23:01,269 --> 00:23:05,565
..at fifteen and an eighth,
three-eighths tops.

288
00:23:06,357 --> 00:23:08,860
And don't screw it up, sport.

289
00:23:09,151 --> 00:23:14,407
- Think you can handle that?
- Yes, sir! Thank you. You won't regret this.

290
00:23:14,574 --> 00:23:17,702
Whoo! Marv, l just bagged the elephant!

291
00:23:20,037 --> 00:23:21,289
Gekko?

292
00:23:55,406 --> 00:23:58,492
- Hiya, sport.
- Nice to see you again, Mr Gekko.

293
00:23:58,576 --> 00:24:02,121
Try the steak tartare. lt's off the menu.
Louis'll make it for you.

294
00:24:02,205 --> 00:24:07,251
- (Louis) Of course, sir. Anything to drink?
- Just an Evian, please.

295
00:24:07,335 --> 00:24:11,881
Hey, see this? Can you believe it?
lt's got a two-inch screen.

296
00:24:11,964 --> 00:24:14,342
l can hardly see it.

297
00:24:14,425 --> 00:24:18,429
lt's for my kid - Rudy.
Three years old, he's an electronics freak.

298
00:24:18,513 --> 00:24:21,432
We're going into a new age, pal.

299
00:24:22,225 --> 00:24:24,310
So how's business today?

300
00:24:24,393 --> 00:24:29,065
Great. Bluestar was at 17 1/4
when l left the office. Up from 15.

301
00:24:29,148 --> 00:24:31,234
Might spin up to 18 by the bell.

302
00:24:31,317 --> 00:24:34,904
Teldar's shooting up.
Did you buy any for yourself?

303
00:24:34,987 --> 00:24:39,742
l bet you were on the phone
two minutes after you got out of my office.

304
00:24:39,951 --> 00:24:43,162
No, sir, that wouldn't have been legal.

305
00:24:43,246 --> 00:24:47,833
Sure. Relax, pal.
No one's gonna blow the whistle on you.

306
00:24:49,168 --> 00:24:53,089
ls that legal? Why don't you
put that in my account?

307
00:24:53,172 --> 00:24:56,717
- Hey, Gordon!
- Georgie! The cellular king! How you been?

308
00:24:56,801 --> 00:25:00,096
- Monique, nice to see you, my dear.
- Hello, Gordon.

309
00:25:00,179 --> 00:25:04,016
- You look wonderful.
- You're looking very well yourself.

310
00:25:04,100 --> 00:25:06,185
And Mr Davis...

311
00:25:07,103 --> 00:25:10,439
Can l get the check here, please?
For chrissakes!

312
00:25:10,523 --> 00:25:15,862
Cover that Bluestar buy. Put 200 thou on one
of those bow-wow stocks you mentioned.

313
00:25:15,945 --> 00:25:21,075
Pick the dog with the least fleas.
Use a stop-loss, so your downside's 100 thou.

314
00:25:21,868 --> 00:25:25,872
And buy a decent suit.
You can't come in here looking like this.

315
00:25:25,955 --> 00:25:28,165
Go to Morty Sills. Tell him l sent you.

316
00:25:28,249 --> 00:25:33,087
Yes, sir. Thank you, Mr Gekko. Thank you
for the chance. You will not regret this.

317
00:25:33,170 --> 00:25:34,839
You're with a winner.

318
00:25:34,922 --> 00:25:36,841
Right... right...

319
00:25:37,842 --> 00:25:42,555
Put the rest of the money in a tax-free fund.
l wanna see how you do before l invest it.

320
00:25:42,638 --> 00:25:45,349
And save the cheap salesman talk.
lt's obvious.

321
00:25:45,433 --> 00:25:48,060
- Excuse me, sir?
- You heard me.

322
00:25:48,644 --> 00:25:53,149
l don't like losses, sport.
Nothing ruins my day more than losses.

323
00:25:53,232 --> 00:25:56,527
Now you do good... you get perks.

324
00:25:57,195 --> 00:25:59,280
Lots and lots of perks.

325
00:25:59,780 --> 00:26:03,326
- Louis, take care of my friend.
- Thank you, sir.

326
00:26:03,409 --> 00:26:05,494
Have a good lunch, Buddy.

327
00:26:07,246 --> 00:26:09,332
Hi, Richard.

328
00:26:22,803 --> 00:26:24,889
(knock on door)

329
00:26:39,320 --> 00:26:40,821
Hi, Bud.

330
00:26:40,905 --> 00:26:42,156
Hi.

331
00:26:42,240 --> 00:26:45,451
l'm Lisa. A friend of Gordon's.

332
00:26:46,869 --> 00:26:50,623
Lisa? Gordon? Oh, oh, Mr Gekko. Sure.

333
00:26:51,916 --> 00:26:54,418
Uh, would you like to come in?

334
00:26:54,835 --> 00:26:56,629
Didn't he tell you?

335
00:26:56,712 --> 00:26:59,549
Oh, that's so like Gordon.

336
00:27:00,091 --> 00:27:03,970
Why don't you get dressed? We're going out.

337
00:27:04,554 --> 00:27:06,639
We are?

338
00:27:24,699 --> 00:27:27,076
So... where are we going?

339
00:27:27,159 --> 00:27:29,245
Wherever you like.

340
00:27:29,871 --> 00:27:33,541
Lutce. 21. The River Caf.

341
00:27:34,500 --> 00:27:36,794
Or maybe we could just...

342
00:27:37,670 --> 00:27:40,173
..drive around for a while.

343
00:27:42,008 --> 00:27:44,510
Work up an appetite.

344
00:27:47,680 --> 00:27:49,765
Want some?

345
00:27:54,729 --> 00:27:57,857
Gordon tells me that
you're a very talented broker.

346
00:27:59,692 --> 00:28:01,777
What do you like?

347
00:28:02,445 --> 00:28:04,780
Like? (clears throat) Well...

348
00:28:04,989 --> 00:28:08,784
l've got this guy who tells me
to buy Hewlett-Packard,...

349
00:28:08,868 --> 00:28:11,370
..but l've been burned on tips.

350
00:28:12,038 --> 00:28:16,500
Uh... Hewlett.
Now, let's see. lt closed at 41 1/4.

351
00:28:17,001 --> 00:28:19,670
Up an eighth. Very attractive.

352
00:28:21,047 --> 00:28:23,549
About, uh... average yield.

353
00:28:24,258 --> 00:28:26,219
- Very attractive.
- Mmm...

354
00:28:26,302 --> 00:28:28,596
- Rising profits.
- Ooh!

355
00:28:28,679 --> 00:28:30,723
Strong balance sheet.

356
00:28:30,806 --> 00:28:32,683
You're hot on this stock.

357
00:28:32,767 --> 00:28:35,478
Uh... lt's ready to take off.

358
00:28:36,103 --> 00:28:38,814
l'd jump all over it if l were you.

359
00:28:41,150 --> 00:28:44,237
- Good morning, Carolyn.
- Morning. You look happy.

360
00:28:44,320 --> 00:28:48,366
- Any better and l'd be guilty.
- You were never innocent, sugar pie.

361
00:28:48,449 --> 00:28:51,160
How do you know? You wish!

362
00:30:07,486 --> 00:30:12,283
Goddamn! We sure went down
the toilet on that ugly bitch!

363
00:30:12,408 --> 00:30:18,331
Oh, Buddy! Mr Gekko's office is looking
for you. Be at the Wyatt Club courts at six.

364
00:30:29,759 --> 00:30:32,386
Come on, sport. You gotta try harder.

365
00:30:33,304 --> 00:30:35,932
l need some exercise, for chrissakes.

366
00:30:37,517 --> 00:30:42,230
- l don't think l can go on, Mr Gekko.
- Push yourself. Finish out the game.

367
00:30:43,606 --> 00:30:45,942
lt's a very nice club, Mr Gekko.

368
00:30:46,025 --> 00:30:47,777
Yeah.

369
00:30:47,860 --> 00:30:50,363
Not bad for a City College boy.

370
00:30:51,697 --> 00:30:56,619
Bought my way in. Now all these lvy League
schmucks are sucking my kneecaps.

371
00:30:57,995 --> 00:31:00,915
l just got on the board of the Bronx Zoo.

372
00:31:01,249 --> 00:31:03,543
lt cost me a mil.

373
00:31:04,460 --> 00:31:07,296
That's the thing you gotta
remember about WASPs.

374
00:31:07,463 --> 00:31:10,591
They love animals,
but they can't stand people.

375
00:31:12,885 --> 00:31:15,054
Uh, Mr Gekko,...

376
00:31:15,638 --> 00:31:18,140
..we took a little loss today.

377
00:31:18,766 --> 00:31:22,812
We got stopped out on Terafly.
About a hundred grand.

378
00:31:27,733 --> 00:31:32,697
Well, l guess your dad's not a union
representative of that company, huh?

379
00:31:32,780 --> 00:31:35,366
How do you know about my father?

380
00:31:35,658 --> 00:31:39,787
The most valuable commodity
l know of is information.

381
00:31:40,413 --> 00:31:42,498
Wouldn't you agree?

382
00:31:42,999 --> 00:31:44,876
Yeah.

383
00:31:50,590 --> 00:31:54,135
The public's out there
throwing darts at a board, sport.

384
00:31:55,845 --> 00:32:00,558
l don't throw darts at a board.
l bet on sure things.

385
00:32:01,767 --> 00:32:04,562
Read Sun Tzu, The Art of War.

386
00:32:04,645 --> 00:32:08,816
"Every battle is won before it's ever fought."

387
00:32:09,525 --> 00:32:11,652
Think about it.

388
00:32:11,736 --> 00:32:14,280
You're not as smart as l thought you were.

389
00:32:14,530 --> 00:32:18,492
You ever wonder why fund managers
can't beat the S&P 500?

390
00:32:18,576 --> 00:32:21,913
Cos they're sheep.
And sheep get slaughtered.

391
00:32:23,831 --> 00:32:26,834
l've been in this business since '69.

392
00:32:26,918 --> 00:32:30,505
Most of these Harvard MBA types
don't add up to dogshit.

393
00:32:30,588 --> 00:32:35,176
You need guys that are poor,
smart and hungry. And no feelings.

394
00:32:35,426 --> 00:32:39,597
You win a few, you lose a few,
but you keep on fighting.

395
00:32:40,139 --> 00:32:44,894
And if you need a friend, get a dog.
lt's trench warfare out there, pal.

396
00:32:44,977 --> 00:32:47,063
- Hey, Georgie.
- Hey, Gordon.

397
00:32:47,146 --> 00:32:51,275
- How's Larchmont treating you?
- Fine. How's the Praxar deal going?

398
00:32:51,359 --> 00:32:54,070
- You should know, pal.
- Asshole!

399
00:32:55,696 --> 00:32:57,782
And inside here, too.

400
00:32:59,283 --> 00:33:03,829
l got 20 other brokers analysing charts, pal.
l don't need another one.

401
00:33:04,580 --> 00:33:07,124
See you around, Buddy.

402
00:33:07,208 --> 00:33:12,630
l am notjust another broker, Mr Gekko.
lf you give me another chance, l'll prove it.

403
00:33:12,713 --> 00:33:16,634
l'll go the extra yard for you.
Just one more chance, Mr Gekko. Please!

404
00:33:16,717 --> 00:33:22,890
Want another chance? Then stop sending me
information, and start getting me some.

405
00:33:23,933 --> 00:33:26,644
Get dressed. l'll show you my charts.

406
00:33:30,481 --> 00:33:34,360
- You know the name?
- Larry Wildman, one of the first raiders.

407
00:33:34,443 --> 00:33:39,574
Sir Larry Wildman. Like all Brits, thinks
he was born with a better pot to piss in.

408
00:33:39,657 --> 00:33:42,451
Bribed an old secretary of mine
to open her mouth.

409
00:33:42,535 --> 00:33:45,955
Stole RDL Pharmaceuticals
right from under me.

410
00:33:46,038 --> 00:33:48,124
Wildman, the "White Knight".

411
00:33:48,207 --> 00:33:51,586
l remember that deal.
You were involved, Mr Gekko?

412
00:33:51,669 --> 00:33:53,713
Payback time, sport.

413
00:33:53,796 --> 00:33:59,302
See that building? l bought that building
ten years ago. My first real-estate deal.

414
00:33:59,385 --> 00:34:03,556
Sold it two years later.
Made an $800,000 profit.

415
00:34:04,640 --> 00:34:07,143
lt was better than sex.

416
00:34:07,226 --> 00:34:12,565
At the time l thought that was all the money
in the world. Now it's a day's pay.

417
00:34:13,316 --> 00:34:16,819
Anyway, l had a mole in Wildman's operation.

418
00:34:16,903 --> 00:34:21,324
- He gave me half the picture, then got fired.
- l don't think l follow you.

419
00:34:21,407 --> 00:34:25,703
Wildman's in town.
He just became an American citizen.

420
00:34:25,786 --> 00:34:28,331
Something big is going down, OK?

421
00:34:28,414 --> 00:34:34,045
l wanna know where he goes, what he sees. l
want you, pal, to fill out the missing picture.

422
00:34:36,881 --> 00:34:40,635
Mr Gekko, it's not exactly what l do.
l could lose my licence.

423
00:34:40,718 --> 00:34:46,766
lf the SEC found out, l could go to jail.
That's inside information, isn't it?

424
00:34:46,849 --> 00:34:51,229
Like when a father tells his son
about a court ruling on an airline?

425
00:34:51,312 --> 00:34:55,566
Or someone overhears l'm buying Teldar,
and decides he's gonna buy some?

426
00:34:55,650 --> 00:35:00,613
Or the chairman of the board of XYZ
decides it's time to blow out XYZ?

427
00:35:00,696 --> 00:35:02,782
ls that what you mean?

428
00:35:05,701 --> 00:35:10,456
Unless your father's on the board
of directors of another company,...

429
00:35:10,540 --> 00:35:14,669
..you and l are gonna have a very
tough time doing business together.

430
00:35:14,752 --> 00:35:18,047
- What about hard work?
- What about it? You work hard?

431
00:35:18,130 --> 00:35:22,385
Bet you stayed up analysing that stock
you gave me. Where'd it get you?

432
00:35:22,468 --> 00:35:27,557
My father worked like an elephant till
he dropped dead at 49 with a heart attack.

433
00:35:27,640 --> 00:35:29,767
Wake up, will ya, pal?

434
00:35:29,851 --> 00:35:33,145
lf you're not inside, you are outside, OK?

435
00:35:33,229 --> 00:35:36,858
l'm not talking about some
$400,000-a-year Wall Street stiff,...

436
00:35:36,941 --> 00:35:41,571
..flying first class and being comfortable.
l'm talking about liquid.

437
00:35:41,654 --> 00:35:44,574
Rich enough to have your own jet.

438
00:35:44,657 --> 00:35:47,577
Rich enough not to waste time.

439
00:35:47,660 --> 00:35:50,580
Fifty, a hundred million dollars, Buddy.

440
00:35:51,539 --> 00:35:53,624
A player,...

441
00:35:53,708 --> 00:35:55,793
..or nothing.

442
00:35:57,336 --> 00:36:00,798
Now you had what it took
to get into my office.

443
00:36:00,882 --> 00:36:04,844
The real question is whether
you got what it takes to stay.

444
00:36:08,723 --> 00:36:10,183
Look at that.

445
00:36:10,266 --> 00:36:15,021
You're gonna tell me the difference
between this guy and that guy is luck?

446
00:36:16,480 --> 00:36:19,066
Mohammed, pull over.

447
00:36:19,150 --> 00:36:22,570
lf you don't mind, l'm gonna
drop you off here. l'm late.

448
00:36:22,653 --> 00:36:25,615
Buddy, it's been nice meeting you, OK?

449
00:36:41,047 --> 00:36:43,132
(Buddy taps on window)

450
00:36:48,304 --> 00:36:50,389
All right, Mr Gekko.

451
00:36:51,641 --> 00:36:53,726
You got me.

452
00:37:55,037 --> 00:37:56,914
Excuse me, please.

453
00:37:56,998 --> 00:37:58,666
Excuse me.

454
00:38:13,806 --> 00:38:16,058
l'm sorry, sir. Do you have a reservation?

455
00:38:16,142 --> 00:38:20,313
- Uh, table for one.
- Reservations only. We're booked for a week.

456
00:38:20,396 --> 00:38:22,106
All right. Don't touch.

457
00:38:49,717 --> 00:38:51,802
Everything ready, sir.

458
00:39:07,610 --> 00:39:11,405
Excuse me! ls Mr Wildman
on board that plane?

459
00:39:11,489 --> 00:39:15,535
Shit! My boss is gonna kill me!
l'm supposed to give him this.

460
00:39:15,618 --> 00:39:18,871
- You know where that plane is going?
- Erie, Pennsylvania.

461
00:39:18,955 --> 00:39:21,040
Thank you.

462
00:39:22,041 --> 00:39:27,713
After spending the morning at Kahn
Seidelman in the junk-bond department,...

463
00:39:27,797 --> 00:39:32,969
..he had lunch at that restaurant, Le Circus,
with some well-dressed bean counters.

464
00:39:33,344 --> 00:39:37,723
He later stopped off at Morgan. l'd say
from all the smiling and palm-pressing...

465
00:39:37,849 --> 00:39:40,601
..Larry got himself some
nice fat financing, GG.

466
00:39:40,685 --> 00:39:45,231
Bright, but not bright enough, Sherlock.
Roll the dice and play Monopoly.

467
00:39:45,314 --> 00:39:48,734
What box is Sir Larry gonna
land on in Erie, Pennsylvania?

468
00:39:50,736 --> 00:39:54,156
Jesus Christ! He's buying Anacott Steel.

469
00:39:54,240 --> 00:40:00,913
OK. When the market opens tomorrow,
l want you to buy 1500 July 50 calls.

470
00:40:01,706 --> 00:40:03,374
- You hear me?
- Yes, sir.

471
00:40:03,457 --> 00:40:08,379
And start buying 1,000-share blocks
and take it up to $50.

472
00:40:08,713 --> 00:40:12,800
When it reaches 50,
give out a little taste to your friends.

473
00:40:12,884 --> 00:40:18,055
Then l want you to call
the Wall Street Chronicle, extension 1605.

474
00:40:18,931 --> 00:40:23,394
You tell the man
"Blue Horseshoe loves Anacott Steel".

475
00:40:23,477 --> 00:40:25,980
- You got that?
- The Wall Street Chronicle.

476
00:40:26,063 --> 00:40:30,443
Congratulations, Buddy.
You scored. l'll talk at ya.

477
00:40:33,446 --> 00:40:36,699
Start buying Anacott Steel across the board.

478
00:40:36,782 --> 00:40:39,285
Use the offshore accounts.

479
00:40:40,077 --> 00:40:42,496
And keep it quiet.

480
00:40:49,837 --> 00:40:54,008
Frank, 10,000 ANC at 46. Let me know
how the options are opening, OK?

481
00:40:54,091 --> 00:40:55,760
Thank you.

482
00:40:59,555 --> 00:41:01,474
Jackson Steinem!

483
00:41:04,727 --> 00:41:08,147
- How is Anacott Steel?
- 5 3/4, 6. 2,000 up.

484
00:41:08,231 --> 00:41:10,942
- Six at 10,000.
- l'll sell you 2,000.

485
00:41:11,025 --> 00:41:13,945
That's not what l said. l said 20,000 shares.

486
00:41:22,662 --> 00:41:25,164
(trader) Anacott trades at six.

487
00:41:25,915 --> 00:41:29,043
- 8,000 at a quarter?
- l'll take 8,000.

488
00:41:29,126 --> 00:41:31,420
Make it six to a half, 2,000 up.

489
00:41:32,505 --> 00:41:35,842
(Marvin) l know what time it is,
and this is what l'm saying.

490
00:41:35,925 --> 00:41:42,056
We have important financial news, Mr Erlich,
that just happens to concern your future.

491
00:41:42,139 --> 00:41:47,979
- You could benefit... What's going on?
- Anacott Steel. Put your best customers in it.

492
00:41:51,399 --> 00:41:53,693
Lou, l got a sure thing.

493
00:41:54,110 --> 00:41:55,987
Anacott Steel.

494
00:41:56,070 --> 00:42:01,701
No such thing, except death and taxes. Not
a good company any more. No fundamentals.

495
00:42:02,660 --> 00:42:04,745
What's goin' on, Bud?

496
00:42:06,789 --> 00:42:08,875
You know something?

497
00:42:09,876 --> 00:42:13,004
Remember, there are no short cuts, son.

498
00:42:13,546 --> 00:42:16,883
Quick-buck artists come and go
with every bull market.

499
00:42:16,966 --> 00:42:19,927
The steady players make it
through the bear markets.

500
00:42:20,011 --> 00:42:22,054
You're a part of something here, Bud.

501
00:42:22,138 --> 00:42:26,934
The money you make for people creates
